loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a thirty-five-year-old farmer in Nkubu  area in Kenya. She is married with two children who are both schooling. She has been in farming for over fifteen years producing maize, beans, milk and peas that she sells to the people in her local area.

Irene is requesting 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry to enhance her income so she will be able to use her money to educate her children through to college in future. Her main challenge is high cost of feeds.

Irene requests Juhudi Kilimo to lower their interest rates for paying up the loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: 09.01.02 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Nhung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Nhung is 39 years old and she is married with two children. Nhung lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Nhung is the group leader of the 09.01.02 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2012, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nhung has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nhung hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 60208-Tiền Phong - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and pigs to raise. 

Thảo is 41 years old and she is married with two children. Thảo supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, another child is grown up.

She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 60208-Tiền Phong - Hoằng Châu solidarity group. In 2004, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thảo has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thảo hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella has been busy growing her business since her last Kiva loan in 2009.  

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and manage to pay school fees for her children. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to increase sales and get enough profits so as to complete her house. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es:
Edinson anteriormente se estaba dedicando a la venta de alimentos en un triciclo de su propiedad, pero ahora al ver que este negocio no le estaba generando los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento, ha decidido comenzar con la venta de frutas y verduras. Las dificultades económicas en su hogar están empeorando cada vez más y su esposa y sus 4 hijos ya están sufriendo grandes consecuencias de esto. Es por esto que ahora buscando mejorar esta condición, Edinson busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de verduras y frutas y comenzar con el negocio de venta de estos productos.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su condición económica a través de este negocio que genera mejores ingresos y en un futuro ubicarse en un local propio.
texts.en:
Edinson was previously selling food on a tricycle of his own, but now, seeing that this business was not generating enough income to support himself, he has decided to start selling fruits and vegetables. The economic difficulties at his home are getting worse every time and his wife and his four children are already suffering big consequences because of this.

This is why now, looking to improve this condition, Edinson seeks a loan to buy an assortment of vegetables and fruits and start with the business of selling these products.

His dream is to be able to improve his economic condition through this business, which generates better income, and in the future work in his own establishment.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of vegetables and fruits and start with the business of selling these products.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 55 years old, married to Grace and has been blessed with two children that he supports. He has operated a taxi transport business for the last 22 years getting a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This is his first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd. and he intends to do a full service to his pickup. He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his operation area. 

His future dreams are to have a sustainable business and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to pay for a full service to his pick-up.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise, age 49, is married and has five children between 12 and 24 years of age. She has been running a retail business of different foodstuffs in the past years, but now she wants to set up a hardware business as a joint business. She wants this loan to add more items such as locks and lumps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items for sale

loans.name: 09.01.04 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Diệu has a retail business selling construction material. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction material for resell.

Diệu is 64 years old, and she is married with two children. Diệu is the group leader of the 09.01.04 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of six members. Diệu lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up.

This is Diệu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Diệu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Diệu faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Diệu hopes for her children to find a good job, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase construction material for resell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 57 years old and married with two adult sons. She has been engaged in the food vending business for 20 years. She sells home-cooked dishes. She is asking for a loan to buy meat, vegetables and seasoning. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's diet, save for the future and reinvest in the same business. She hopes to improve her menu so she can attract more customers in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and seasoning

loans.name: 60317-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lài works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

Lài is 55 years old, and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 60317-Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường solidarity group. Lài supports one dependent with her business in the Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her two other children are grown up.

In 2005, Lài joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lài has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lài has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Lài hopes for her children to do well in school, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hot dogs to resell

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La Sr. Erika tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, es Auxiliar en Enfermería hace más de 4 años, ella vive con sus padres quienes  necesitan el apoyo moral y económico de la cliente, por ello la cliente les apoya y no se aleja de ellos , pues fue ese uno de los motivo que le impulsaron a emprender en la actividad de comercio en la venta de ropa casual de vestir conocida ya por muchos de sus clientes y compañeros de trabajo a quienes vende su producto; es por tal motivo que hoy solicita el crédito para poder comprar más mercadería y de alguna forma mejorar sus ingresos que tiene pudiendo así ayudar a su familia económicamente ya que con el crédito otorgado  le será más fácil lograr esto y por ende concretar los sueños que tiene como el de comprar un terreno y consolidar a futuro una familia, además de sentirse más satisfecha de haber logrado lo que quiso y ver a su queridos padres felices por lo que su hija pudo realizar.
texts.en:
Erika is 37 years old, single and has been a nursing assistant for more than four years. She lives with her parents who need the client’s moral and financial support, so she helps them and doesn’t drift away from them. That was one of the reasons that prompted her to engage in her commercial activity of selling casual clothing. 

She is known by her clients and coworkers to whom she sells her products. It is for this reason that today she is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and somehow improve her income so that she can help her family financially since with the granted loan it will be easier to achieve this and as a consequence attain her dreams such as buying land and building a secure future for her family. In addition to that she wants the increased satisfaction of having achieved her goals and to see her beloved parents happy for what their daughter could do.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to expand her sales inventory of casual clothing

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El sr. Manuel  tiene 23 años de edad vive con sus papas y hermanos, ellos vivían en el departamento de Chuquisaca en la población de yamparaez como hace 23 años tuvieron que venirse a la población de Santa Rosa Ñ donde habitan hace 20 años, de la provincia Tiraque, en el departamento de Cochabamba, él se encuentra Soltero viviendo junto a su padre y hermanos,  Manuel se dedica al Trabajo como jornalero realizando los chaqueos en la misma población de santa rosa Ñ para las plantaciones de arroz, plátano y yuca, él se volvió a levantar  junto a su padre tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron  de cero.  El préstamo que solicita Manuel es para la compra de lote agrícola así podrá tener mas ingreso económicos y de esa manera podrá ayudar a su padre y madre, pero él tendrá en un futuro sus hijos que si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Manuel, 23, is single and lives with his parents and siblings.  They used to live in the department of Chuquisaca in the community of Yamparaez about 23 years ago, but they had to come to Santa Rosa Ñ, in the province of Tiraque in the department of Cochabamba, where they've lived for 20 years.

Manuel works as a day laborer doing the slash-and-burn preparation of land on rice, banana, and yucca farms.  He and his father lifted themselves up and set out on a new path, starting from scratch.

The loan that Manuel is requesting is to buy a plot of land to farm so he'll be able to have more income and help his father and mother.

In the future he'll have children who will be able to have a career and help people in the region.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to farm

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportion business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle that she uses for her tricycle transport business. Dolores has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Luz Albany

texts.es:
Luz Albany comenzó a trabajar desde que salió del colegio en diferentes almacenes de venta de productos de uso personal, de allí adquirió una gran experiencia y también fue muy juiciosa con sus pagos, pues consiguió tener unos ahorros con los cuales decidió montar su propio negocio, el cual es un almacén ubicado cerca del parque principal de su municipio y esto le permite tener muy buena ubicación. Actualmente Luz Albany se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijas de 8 y 12 años de edad y para ofrecerles una buena calidad de vida se esfuerza arduamente todos los días en su negocio. Como el local donde tiene ubicado su negocio es muy amplio, Luz Albany busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su negocio para aprovechar el amplio espacio con el que cuenta.

Su sueño es tener un gran negocio y poder tener unos buenos ingresos para progresar económicamente con su familia. Además de tener la oportunidad de brindarle a sus 2 hijas una educación escolar de muy buena calidad.
texts.en:
From the time she finished secondary school, Luz Albany began working in different stores, selling personal use products.  From this, she obtained a great experience and was very wise with her income, and therefore, she acquired some savings with which she decided to start her own business.  She has a store located near the main park of her community and this allows her a very good location.  Currently, Luz Albany is married and has two daughters ages 8 and 12 and in order to provide them with a good quality of life, she arduously exerts herself everyday at her business.  Since the shop where she has her business is quite large, Luz Albany is looking for a loan to purchase more personal use products to stock her business in order to take advantage of the ample space she has available. 

Her dream is to have a great business and to be able to have a good income to progress economically with her family.  Moreover, she wants to have the opportunity to offer her two daughers a good quality education.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products and to stock her business to take advantage of the ample space she has available.

loans.name: German Emilio

texts.es:
Germán es un gran luchador de la vida que luego de haber trabajado durante muchos años como empleado, ahora quiere tener su propio negocio, generarse sus propios recursos y progresar junto a su familia. Buscando mejorar su condición de trabajo y también mejorar sus ingresos, Germán va a montar una tienda general en un espacio adecuado en su residencia, donde la idea es ofrecer a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar. Como Germán no cuenta con el capital suficiente para surtir los primeros productos de la tienda, busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y así iniciar con su tienda general.

De esta manera aspira a superar sus dificultades económicas que se complican más por el hecho de ser cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos. Su sueño es sacar esta tienda adelante.
texts.en:
Germán is a great fighter for life.  After having worked for many years as an employee, now he wants to have his own business, generating his own resources and progressing together with his family.  Looking to improve his working conditions as well as his income, Germán is going to start up a general store in a space connected to his home, where the idea is to offer his customers staple goods.  Since Germán doesn't have the sufficient capital to stock the initial products of the store, he is requesting a loan to purchase staple goods, and thus start up his general store.

In this way, he aspires to overcome his financial difficulties, that are more complicated because he is the head of a household with two children.  His dream is that his store will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods and thus start up his general store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years old, married to Juddith and has been blessed with three children that he supports. He has operated a motorcycle transport business in Narok for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

Samuel has applied for his first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, and he intends to add his savings to it and start a motorcycle spare parts shop. He plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into mechanical services. His future dream is to have a large motor spare parts outlet in Bomet town.

loans.use: to start a motorcycle spare parts shop

loans.name: Lurlyn

texts.en:
Lurlyn is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a small baking shop for more than two years now. Lurlyn is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients for baking bread such as flour, butter, sugar, and milk. With this, she will be able to bake more bread to sell.

Lurlyn hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she plans to continually support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking bread such as flour, butter, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy screen, nylon, binder, and fishing equipment.

Leonila has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy screen, nylon, binder, and fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her pedicab

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.en: Ruperto is a supportive head of the family. He untiringly provides sustenance to his family, especially education for his two children. Ruperto is now 35 years old and married to a housekeeper. Ruperto provides motorcycle transport services to the people in his village. From this kind of business, he earns PHP 300 each day. Now, he wants to further improve his transport services so he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy tires and crude oil and repair existing vehicle trouble. He promises to pay back his loan and keep providing safe travel for his passengers, and it will someday lead to economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tires and crude oil and repair existing vehicle trouble

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 28 year old married woman from Ashrafia Amman Jordan who has 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for home improvements, as she will be repainting her home. In the future she wants to provide her family with a good living environment.
Since Faten is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Liezel has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as pants, t-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Liezel has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as pants, t-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sariem

texts.en: Sariem is 45 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. In addition, she prepares krill (small shrimp) to sell to generate more income for the family when she finishes her farming. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sariem is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase piglets and fodder. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder.

loans.name: Coralyn

texts.en:
Coralyn is hardworking and friendly citizen of Dadda. She is 35 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children attend school and need daily allowances and payments for school projects. Her spouse is a jeepney operator. To add to the family's income, Coralyn makes peanut butter, milk and ube (purple yam) candies. She offers her products to the nearby stores and canteens. 

Coralyn has been in this business for over 10 years now. She always dreamed of increasing her sales. That is why she is borrowing a loan of PHP 50,000 to add to her revolving capital. She will buy skimmed and condensed milk, sugar, flour and plastic wrappers to use in her food selling business. The additional ingredients she will buy out of her loan will help her diversify her business and produce more delicious products to sell. Coralyn will be very happy and proud to see all her children become professionals in their chosen careers someday.

loans.use: to buy skimmed and condensed milk, sugar, flour and plastic wrappers uses in her food selling business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, de 43 años, es una mujer muy amable y sobre todo muy trabajadora.  Es conviviente con su pareja con quien tienen  01 niña de 07 años de edad,  por quien trabajan duro día a día para brindarle lo mejor, tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su parea y su niña. El trabajo de Graciela consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, contando con su propias maquina de coser, ella realiza su propia creación y también refacciona las prendas de sus clientes que van con seguridad que les harán un buen trabajo. Lleva más de  07 años en éste trabajo y tiene un taller muy rustico y pequeño en su casa, trabaja sola y con los gastos del hogar le ayuda su pareja que trabaja en otras actividades.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene sus servicios y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta de su trabajo pues está en su hogar y puede realizar una actividad que la mantiene ocupada y le permite sentirse una persona productiva, además le permite tener ingresos y cumplir la función de ama de casa y madre, le va muy bien ya que tiene clientes que se gano por el buen trabajo que realiza, ella tiene en mente poder poner una piscigranja en donde empezar a sembrar peces para su posterior venta. Este es el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, espera que le vaya bien ya que hasta ahora siempre fue una socia muy cumplida que siempre se caracterizo por la puntualidad, esta muya agradecida con lo que le dan ya que le sirve de mucho cuando tiene mayor cantidad de materiales con que trabajar.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, ella comprará materiales de costura como  tela, algodón, hilos y otros materiales para que pueda seguir con su labor y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela is 43 years old. She is a very kind person and above all hardworking. She lives with her partner with whom she has one daughter who is seven years old, for whom she works hard every day to provide the best. She has her own home where she lives with her partner and their daughter.

Graciela’s work consists of making clothing for women, men and children. She uses her own sewing machine. She makes her own creations and she also alters clothing for her customers, and they go with the security that she will do good work. She has been doing this work for more than seven years and she has a very basic and small workshop in her home. She works alone and she helps support her partner with the household expenses and other activities. She considers it profitable because of the demand for her services and the good income it allows.

She likes her work as it is done at home and she can do something that keeps her busy and permits her to feel productive. Also, it permits her to have income and fulfill the function of housewife and mother. It is going very well as she has customers that she has gained through the good work she does. She has in mind of putting in a fish farm where she can begin to raise fish for later sale.

This is her twelfth loan through MFP. She expects to do well since so far she has always been a responsible member that is always characterized by her punctuality. She is very grateful with what you have given her as it helps her a lot when she has a large quantity of material to work with.

With the requested amount of 1,000 soles, she will buy sewing materials such as fabric, cotton, thread and other supplies so she can continue with her work and be able to give better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cotton, thread and other supplies for her home-based seamstress shop where she creates and alters clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga, a widower from Dadda, breeds and raises hogs to fatten and re-sell at a profit. She is 61 years old and has had four children. She generally receives P3,000 for each hog she sells. She wants to raise healthy hogs so she can sell them profitably. She is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy hog vaccines, medicines and feed to ensure good nutrition. She would like to keep improving her sales, for the overall well-being of her family, and to save funds for use in times of emergencies. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy hog vaccines, medicines and feed to ensure good nutrition

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
This is Benedicta, age 50, and resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Amando, a carpenter, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while also operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Benedicta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Benedicta hopes to give her children a good, quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and other products to resell

loans.name: 09.01.01 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Viễn has a retail business selling construction materials. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to resell.

Viễn is 62 years old, and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 09.01.01 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group. Viễn lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up.

This is Viễn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Viễn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Viễn faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Viễn hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase contruction materials to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 43 years old. She has two children between the ages of 17 and 22. All go to school. Rose sells beans, rice and cooking oil and has spent five years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more beans and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs such as rice and beans for sale

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 59 years old and married and has one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelia has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from fishing and food vending.

Nelia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion, an industrious wife, operates a retail store in the village where they live. She is 58 years old and has had six children. In addition to the retail store, she raises hogs as an additional source of income. Encarnacion would now like to increase the variety of merchandise she offers so she can improve her daily income. She is borrowing P17,000 to buy coffee, milk, sardines, noodles and soap to sell in her store. 

Providing good service and affordable prices to customers will enhance the income from the business. This will lead eventually to progress in the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee, milk, sardines, noodles and soap to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John es una persona muy trabajadora que ha tenido que luchar fuertemente contra grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Hace un tiempo su esposa y madre de sus 6 hijos murió en un accidente y a John le ha tocado hacer un gran esfuerzo en esta responsabilidad para poder sacar su familia adelante. La dificultad más grande es que su hija menor tenía tan solo unos pocos meses de nacida luego del fallecimiento de su madre. Para generar los ingresos de su hogar ha trabajado en diferentes negocios, y como en ninguno ha podido generar los suficientes ingresos para su hogar, actualmente está comenzando a trabajar en la venta de accesorios para celulares y autos. Buscando aumentar su surtido, John busca un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de productos y así aumentar sus ventas.

Su sueño es poder mejorar sus ingresos, superar las grandes dificultades económicas y sociales que tiene en su familia y sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos. También tiene el anhelo de en un futuro poderse conseguir su casa propia.
texts.en:
John is a very hardworking person who has had to fight hard against a lot of adversity in his life. Some time ago, his wife and the mother of his 6 children died in an accident and John l has had to really work hard with his responsibility to get his family ahead. His biggest difficulty is that his youngest daughter was only a few months old when her mother died. To generate income for his home, he has worked in different businesses. Since none of them has been able to generate enough income for his home, now he is starting to work selling cellphone and car accesories. Seeking to increase his stock, John is looking for a loan to buy a wider variety of products and increase his sales.

His dream is to increase his sales and over come the financial and social problems he has in his family and get his 6 children ahead. He also wants to be able to own his own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of products and increase his sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials needed for manicures

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is a married lady aged 40 years old. She is blessed with six children aged between four and 15 years old. She operates a tailoring shop and has been running the business for six years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.


She has borrowed a first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase more fabrics for the business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school -going children. Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
As a married father of four children, Ruben works hard to support his family.

He has a fishing business in the Philippines, and he also earns additional income from raising pigs and running a general store. 

Ruben is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for his fishing business.

Ruben has been sustaining his business activities through his past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 30. She is married and has two children, age 4 and 7 years. 

She has sold beans and other vegetables for six years. 

She wants this loan to buy more beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ligia Amparo

texts.es:
Ligia anteriormente trabajaba como empleada en un almacén de venta de ropa y como los horarios eran muy largos estaba teniendo una muy calidad de vida, tanto que esto le trajo algunos inconvenientes de salud de los cuales aún se está recuperando. Gracias a unos ahorros que tenía y un gran esfuerzo que hizo, montó su propio negocio de venta de ropa desde hace unos pocos días; ahora tiene una mejor calidad de vida y goza también de unos mejores ingresos. Sin embargo, como no cuenta con mucho capital, ha tenido que retrazar la entrega de algunas ventas a sus clientes, pues no cuenta con suficiente dinero para surtir; es por esto que Ligia busca un préstamo para comprar prendas de vestir y responder a las ventas de su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un gran negocio y poder generar empleo para muchas personas. Además incrementar sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar y ofrecerle así a su esposo y sus hijos mejores oportunidades económicas en el hogar.
texts.en:
Ligia previously worked as an employee in a clothing store selling clothes and as the hours were very long it brought some health issues to her quality of life from which she is still recovering.

Thanks to the savings that she had and with great effort she set up her own business of selling clothing with fewer days and now she has a better quality of life and she enjoys a better income. However, since she does not have a lot of capital, she has had to delay the deliver of some sales orders to her customers because she does not have enough money for stock, which is why Ligia is seeking a loan in order to buy clothing and respond to her business sales.

Her dream is to have a large business and to be able to create jobs for many people. Also, to increase her income in order to have a better quality of life at home and to offer her husband and their children better financial opportunities at home.

loans.use: to buy clothing in order to respond to the requests of her customers

loans.name: Nueva Luz Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel Reyna  ella es casada y tiene 31 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas,entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente aunque este horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener en el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatillas, venta de ropa, venta de huevo sancochado, venta de golosinas, tienda de abarrotes, restaurante, venta de muebles.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “NUEVA LUZ” communal bank. This bank is located in the distrcit of Cuzco, in the province and department of  Cuzco. 

The member named Isabel Reyna is 31, married and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, a small grocery store. She sells different products such as rice, milk, snacks, sodas and more. She has had this business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She works at her business Monday through Sunday from 6:00am to 9:00pm approximately, although this schedule can vary according to the activites she may have during the day. She is a responsible and hardworking person and that is how she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business. 

The other members have businesses such as selling slippers, selling clothes, selling parboiled eggs, selling snacks, a grocery store, a restaurant and selling furniture.

Isabel Reyna is thankful to the people who are a part of her dream in this way and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business.

loans.name: Rosalba De Jesus

texts.es:
Rosalba ayuda a la economía del hogar con su trabajo de la producción de leche con una vaca que tiene ubicada en su residencia. Como no cuenta con mucho capital, Rosalba no ha podido aprovechar que sus clientes le pidan más leche, pues no tiene como comprar otra vaca. Pero ahora que tiene la oportunidad ha decidido buscar un préstamo para comprar una vaca y aumentar su capacidad de producción de leche.

Su sueño es poder seguir con esta actividad y mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosalba helps the financial state of her home with her milk production business.  She has a cow in her home.  Because she doesn’t have much capital, Rosalba has not been able to take advantage of the fact that her customers have been requesting additional milk.  She is not able to buy another cow.  Now she has the opportunity and has decided to request a loan so that she can buy a cow and increase her milk production capacity.

Her dream is to continue with this business activity and improve her income, so that she can improve the quality of life in her home.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lorda

texts.en: This time, Lorda is borrowing Php 20,000 to purchase feed, vitamins and fishing equipment.  The fishing business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA partner, continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom is 54 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and food for more than three years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 each day. Sokhom is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for passport fees. This money will help her go to work in Thailand legally. In the future, she would like to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for passport fees

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty started her livestock business at the age of 22 years old. Now, she is 46 years of age and married, having  two children. She has also two hectares of corn field and one hectare of rice field. She and her spouse had work hard to make a living.

Betty is raising three swine for fattening. Now she plans to buy necessary vitamins and sacks of livestock feed to nourish the growth of her swine until their maturity. Since her previous loan had a great impact in making her livestock business, she is now asking for a bigger loan amounting to PHP10,000. She knows that this loan amount and her patience would make her dream come true. In addition, she could uplift their lifestyle out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy necessary vitamins  and sacks of livestock feed for her pigs

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown children from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Martina makes baskets to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She buys dried buri (a type of palm tree) and weaves them into baskets. 

Martina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services offered by the organization to micro entrepreneurs like her. At this time, she is requesting a loan worth 10,000 PHP to buy materials such as buri for basket weaving.

In the future, Martina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials such as buri for basket weaving

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtara is a 52-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. She lives in a large, conventional family with her husband, her children and other relatives.

She is doing a business of selling wood, which is used in various purposes like furniture, papers and baskets. She has been efficiently doing this with her husband for many years. (The man shown in the photo is Mukhtaran’s husband.) She and her husband sell wood door to door and in fruit markets. She is an enthusiastic woman who also makes wooden baskets at home.They serve well in their community.

She needs to have an increase in her earning to carry out everyday expenditures of her family. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PKR 30,000. She will be using the loan to buy different types of wood to cater to more customers. She wishes to use part of the profits on building a separate room for her children.

loans.use: To buy different types of wood to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Yessenia Alejandra

texts.es:
Yessenia es una joven muy emprendedora que al ver que necesitaba recursos para aportar en su hogar comenzó a buscar diferentes alternativas para generar ingresos. Fue así como comenzó con la actividad de venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogos, y con esta contribuye económicamente en su hogar para que su pareja y sus 2 hijos de 5 años y 7 meses de nacido puedan tener una buena calidad de vida. El negocio lo inició hace muy poco, pero con gran esfuerzo ha venido superando la dificultad de capital que tiene y esto ha permitido ir mejorando en ventas. Como sus clientes le están pidiendo mayor surtido, Yessenia busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los encargos de los clientes y también comprar ropa para comenzar a ofrecer a sus clientes.

Su sueño es salir adelante con este negocio y trabajarlo muy juiciosa para que le genere buenos ingresos. Además, anhela en un futuro poder conseguirse su casa propia donde pueda vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Yessenia is an entrepreneurial young woman who began looking for different alternatives for generating income when she saw that she needed additional money in her home.  She began selling different personal products via catalogs and in this way contributes to her household finances so that her husband and two children, ages 5 and 7 months, can have a good quality of life.  She started the business with great effort and has been overcoming her lack of capital and this has allowed her to improve her sales.  Because her customers are requesting a greater variety, Yessenia is asking for a loan so that she can buy personal use products to meet her customers’ demands.  She also wants to buy clothing and offer it to her customers.

Her dream is to get ahead through this business and work it judiciously so that it generates good income.  In the future she also wants to have a home of her own for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
Jairo trabajó durante casi toda su vida en la actividad de la construcción, pero ya por su edad no podía seguir trabajando en esto y por eso decidió buscar una alternativa diferente para generar los ingresos del hogar. Fue así como inició una tienda general con unos pequeños ahorros y comenzó a trabajar por su propia cuenta y con mejores condiciones laborales. Pese a que no tenía mucho dinero para surtir la tienda, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir poco a poco sacando el negocio adelante y así genera los ingresos que necesita en su hogar donde convive con su esposa y algunos de sus 9 hijos. Para mejorar sus ventas, Jairo acude a un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, también para renovar algunas mesas y sillas de la tienda.

Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida del hogar, aumentando sus ingresos para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jairo worked most of his life in construction, but due to his age couldn't continue in it. That is why he decided to seek and alternative to generate income for his home. That is how he started a general store with some small savings and started to work on his own with better working conditions. Despite not having a lot of money to stock his store, his hard work has allowed him to get his store ahead little by little and generate the income his home needs, where he lives with his wife and 9 children.To improve his sales, Jairo has asked for a loan to buy basic family products and stock his business to offer a wider variety of products to his customers as well as replace some tables and chairs in the business.

His dream is to get his business ahead and improve his family's quality of life, increasing his income to have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy basic family basket products and stock his business to offer a wider variety of products to his customers, as well as replace some tables and chairs in the store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is divorced and she has the task of raising two children. She is determined to make sure that she prospers in life. 

She is involved in the selling of fruits and vegetables. In addition to this activity, she also sells kerosene. Fatuma has an experience of four years in these businesses. 

Since she has no other support, she decided to visit Yehu offices to ask for  loan in the amount of KES 10,000 to invest in her businesses. With this loan, she wants to purchase a gallon of kerosene and more fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a gallon of kerosene and more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Costique

texts.en: Costique is 32 years old. He is married and has two children, 3 and 7 years old. He sells utensils and has been in the business for 7 years. He wants this loan to add more utensils such as glasses, saucepans and plates for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making local delicacies

loans.name: Yineth Paola

texts.es:
Yineth es una joven emprendedora de 24 años de edad que comenzó a estudiar desde muy joven, lo que le ha permitido desde hace un año montar su propio salón de belleza. En un principio el negocio lo inició con una amiga suya, pero debido a que los ingresos no le estaban siendo suficientes, decidió independizarse y hace unos pocos días comenzó a trabajar sola en el salón de belleza. La gran dificultad que tiene es que es madre soltera cabeza de hogar de su hijo de 3 años y esto trae grandes dificultades económicas. Buscando superar sus dificultades de capital, Yineth busca un préstamo para comprar artículos de peluquería como shampoo, masajes, cabello sintético, entre otros y poder tener unos mejores servicios para sus clientes.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran salón de belleza muy reconocido y que este le permita sacar adelante a su hijo, brindándole una buena calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica en su hogar.
texts.en:
Yineth is an enterprising young woman of 24, who began going to school when she was very young.  This allowed her to open her own beauty salon a year ago.   At first she started the business with a friend, but she decided that the income was not enough, so she went out on her own.  She started working alone in the salon a few days ago.  The greatest difficulty she has is that she is a single mother of a three year old son and this brings financial hardship.  Yineth is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as shampoo, rubs, faux hair, and other things, so that she can offer better services to her customers.

Her dream is to have a great, well-known salon which will allow her to move her son ahead, giving him a better quality of life and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie lives in Kakata  town. She is 35 years old and has 3 children between the ages of 12 and 17 who are in school and live at home. For the past ten years Annie has been selling palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice. She started this business with help from her mother. One thing she enjoys is that she is always  busy and her business is going fast. She is requesting a loan to purchase a palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice  for her business. She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice  for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is aged 32. She is married and has 4 children aged between 4 and 12 years. She has owned a canteen for three years. She wants this loan to add more sodas, fresh milk and cakes for sale in that canteen. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more fresh milk, sodas, and cakes to sell

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Basma prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Basma is a 27-year-old married woman who has two family members, from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy new furniture. In the future she wants to improve her living standard. 

Since Basma is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ubumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Etienne fait partie du groupe  Ubumwe II  et  habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 28 ans et est marié à Jeanine,  une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 2 à 6 ans, dont  1 étudie.

Il  est  commerçant de bière de banane dans son bar  depuis 10 ans. 

Il  est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour la préparation de la bière, à  vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir une parcelle, une moto;il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Etienne is a member of the Ubumwe II group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 28 years old and is married to Jeanine, a farmer. Together they have 3 children, aged from 2 to 6 years old, one of whom goes to school. 

Etienne has been selling banana beer in his bar for 10 years. He is on his 7th loan with Turame. 

With this Kiva loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make into beer, [which he will] sell to earn more [income]. 

In the coming years, he would like to have a plot of land and a motorbike. He would also like to see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy a large number of bananas to make into beer

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena tiene hace 4 años un negocio de venta de carnes y de ropa, y con este genera los ingresos que necesita para sostener su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad; pues es madre soltera cabeza de hogar ya que su esposo murió hace un tiempo y por esto está a cargo de todas las obligaciones de la familia. Como con este negocio no ha podido generar los ingresos suficientes para el hogar, ahora ha venido montando un proyecto con el que espera pueda mejorar la situación económica de la familia. Para esto, Luz Elena busca un préstamo para comprar gallinas ponedoras y así montar su propio negocio para sacar su hogar adelante.

Su sueño es tener un gran negocio con el que pueda tener mejores ingresos y gracias al cual su familia tenga la posibilidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Elena has had a business for four years selling meat and clothing, and this generates the income she needs to sustain her household where she lives with her two children who are 7 and 9 years old. She is a single mother, head of the household, as her husband died some time ago and she has responsibility for all the family bills.

As this business has not generated enough income for the household, now she has now decided to start a project hoping she can improve the family financial situation. To do this, Luz Elena is seeking a loan to buy laying hens and thus starting her own business to move the family ahead.

Her dream is to have a large business that may have higher earnings and thanks to it having the possibility of her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy laying hens so she can begin her own business in order to support her family as a widowed mother of two children

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is married and has three children. She has adopted two more children to her family. She is 39 years old. She sells used shoes and has spent seven years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more used shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to resell

loans.name: Jamilan

texts.en:
Ms. Jamilan is a 55-year-old energetic woman. She has efficiently run a business selling milk and rearing cattle for many years. She purchases small cubs and sells them near the Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan). She earns a good profit from this business. 

According to Jamilan, she faced many problems during her married life. Her husband is a labor person. He was not able to cover the expenses of the family members alone. She took initiative to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation. Now, she is very satisfied and has requested a repeat loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy one cow to increase the sales of milk in her community. She intends to use the profits for her children’s well-being and house renovation.

loans.use: to buy one cow to increase milk sales

loans.name: Rihid

texts.en:
Rihid is 47 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri, Uganda. He is married and has four children, with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Rihid has been working hard to manage his spare parts business, which sells tires, lubricants, and other car parts. 

To help expand his business, Rihid has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more parts for cars like tires, glue, and lubricants, and will help Rihid to generate greater profits and improve the education level of his children. Rihid hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another outlet. 

Rihid is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rihid who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more parts for cars like tires, glue, and lubricants

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
This is Mercidita, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Enrique, a farmer, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Mercidita operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, a variety of hanging plants, and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mercidita dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 21, lives in the town of Kwale with her parents. She buys and sells women's and men's clothes. She has a variety of shirts, dresses, blouses, and more. She has had her business for over two years after high school, and this has gifted her with a lot of sales experience. This allows her to get very good income. 

She sells in a very strategic place that is very busy. She has obtained a lot of clientele. Fatuma is an enterprising lady who is devoted to her work. She gets up every day with the inclination to strive for a more prosperous future. She knows that it is only this way that she will be successful. 

In the past weeks demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment. That is why she is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy more bales of clothes for reselling.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS,la socia continua trabajando para una institucion publica,ella trabaja de lunes a sabado ,la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando en esta institucion el cual le va bien gracias al empeño quele pone cada dia a su trabajo,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su fmailia,la socia solicita el credito para pagar los estudios de su hijo.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo que le otorgarán y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the MADRES TRABAJADORAS community bank.  She works, as before, for a public insitution.  She works Mondays to Saturdays.  She has worked for the institution for a number of years and is considered a valued employee because she is responsible and hard-working.  The job is her means of supporting her family.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to pay her son's school costs. 

Our member is comfortable with the terms of the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to pay her son's university costs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married with three children. Only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (daughter-in-law). She has a business of selling green bananas. She sells to all categories of people, but on wholesale only. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She has been in this green banana business for seven years. She generates additional income from rental houses. Her monthly business costs include transportation and loss from thieves. She is aspiring to buy a delivery van to ease her transportation and also to build more rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and her family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas

loans.name: Felecial

texts.en:
Felecial is 45 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and has five children between the ages of 12 to 29, all of whom attend school. She stopped her own education at 10th grade. 

For the past three years she has been selling clothes in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has makes lot of profit, and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business. She plans to build a house and send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 35. She is married and has three children aged between 9 and 15 years, and all go to school. She sells clothes and has spent four years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more sweaters because it is the rainy season, also T-shirts and skirts for girls for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children attending schools.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip is 55 years old and blessed with four children. He is a carpenter and operates a timber yard in Narok town. He has been running this business for the past 10 years, making a monthly income of KES 25,000.

Phillip has borrowed his first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to buy more timber for carpentry work. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His future dream is to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more timber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Liezl Mae

texts.en: Liezl Mae is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Liezl Mae has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Liezl Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Liezl Mae hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha is 41 years old. She is married with five children aged between 7 and 15 years. She sells cooking oil and yeast. She has spent five years in the business. She wants this loan to add more yeast for bread makers and cooking oils for sale. The profits from the business will be used to for paying school fees.

loans.use: To buy more yeast and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Marleny Paticia

texts.es:
Marleny comenzó con la actividad de la confección desde hace unos 3 años, cuando fue abandonada por el padre de su hijo de 6 años de edad y se vio en la obligación de generar los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento del hogar. Trabajó para una empresa de confección durante los últimos años pero como le pagaban muy poco y muy tarde, no le estaba dando resultados en su hogar para sostener su familia. Fue por esto que decidió montar su propio taller de confección y con unos ahorros que tenía compró su primera máquina de coser y poco a poco fue confeccionando pijamas para venderlas por su cuenta. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos, ahora va a comenzar a prestar el servicio de confección a terceros con un contrato con una muy buena empresa, es por esto que necesita un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana e insumos para comenzar la confección.

Su sueño es acreditar el negocio, ampliarlo y mejorarlo para que mejoren sus ingresos y su hijo pueda tener una educación escolar de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Marleny began sewing about three years ago when she was abandoned by the father of her six-year-old son and she needed to generate the income necessary to support her household.  She had worked for a sewing company in the final years but they paid her very little or very late, so she wasn't getting enough to support her family.

For this reason she decided to start her own tailoring shop.  She bought her first sewing machine with some savings and little by little started making pajamas to sell on her own.  Thanks to the good quality of her work, now she has a contract with a very good company to start providing third-party services.

This is why she needs a loan to buy a flat-bed sewing machine and supplies to begin sewing.

Her dream is to have her business accredited and improve it so her income improves and her son can have a better education.

loans.use: to buy a flat-bed sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
Marino, de 34 años, es un hombre trabajador y amable. Es conviviente con su pareja con quien es padre de un hijo de 6 años. Vive junto a su pareja en su casa propia en donde algunas veces llegan a sus hermanos quienes colaboran todos juntos para los gastos fundamentales del hogar, el trabaja mucho para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y su familia. El trabajo de Marino consiste en el cultivo de productos regionales, entre ellos cacao, siendo un cultivo alternativo al cultivo de hoja de coca, además de  algunos cítricos, también tiene algunas cabezas de ganado los cuales compra y vende, todas estas actividades los realiza en su terreno propio que está ubicado a pocos kilómetros de su casa en un caserío.  Lleva en ésta actividad más de  03 años, trabaja solo pues sus hermanos tienen su propio terreno y su propia vida, en algunas ocasiones contrata algunos peones para ayudarlo solo en época de siembra y cosecha.
Considera rentable su actividad por la demanda que tiene sus productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo pues está siempre al aire libre y dispone de su tiempo como  mejor le parece, además dice que no hay nada mejor que ser independiente.  Está en época de cosecha,  sus productos llevará a vender entre los compradores de la ciudad, espera poder mantener su negocio y ampliar su cultivos. Este es el  préstamo número 04con la institución MFP, le va muy bien en el grupo, es un socio colaborador  y siempre resulto ser buen pagador de sus cuotas, agradece mucho la oportunidad que le dieron para crecer con su trabajo y espera poder seguir haciéndolo por mucho más tiempo.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 empezará el proceso de cosecha, ya que contratará a algunos trabajadores para que le ayuden en éste trabajo, además de invertir en abonos para sus sembríos de cacao.
texts.en:
Marino, 34 years old, is a hard working and friendly man. He is living with his partner with whom he is the father of a son who is 6 years old. He lives with his partner in his own home where sometimes his siblings pitch in with the household expenses. He works hard to provide a better quality of life for his son and family.

Marino’s work consists of growing regional products, including cocoa, and the alternative crop of coca leaves, and also some citrus, and also he has some head of cattle which he buys and sells, and all of these activities he does on his own land which is located a few miles from his village home.

He has been doing this activity for more than three years, working alone as his siblings have their own land and their own lives. Sometimes he hires laborers to help him during planting and harvesting. He considers it profitable because of the demand he has for his products and good income it leaves him.

He likes his work as he is always outdoors and he has time to do what he wants, and he says that there is nothing better than being independent. It is harvest time, his products will be taken to be sold among the buyers in the city, and he hopes to be able to keep up his business and expand his crops.

This is the fourth loan through MFP, and it is going very well in his group. He is a contributing member and always made his payments. He is grateful for the opportunity given him to expand his work and he hopes to be able to continue doing it for a long time.

With the requested amount of 1.000 soles he will begin the harvesting process, as he has already contracted some workers to help him in this work, and he will invest in fertilizer for the planting of cocoa.

loans.use: to contract laborers for the harvesting season and to buy bags of fertilizer for his cocoa plants

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania como venta de textiles y mantas,al socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella tiene tierras de cultivo donde siembre papa,maiz y trigo y en el negocio de artesania lo vende en su tienda,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar mantas y textiles.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
Our member makes her living, as before, selling blankets and other textiles.  She still works her farm, as well, growing potatoes, maize and wheat.  She sells the textiles in her own store.  She has owned the business for 8 years and says that she would like to grow it with sales of other crafts products.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy blankets and other textiles.

Our member is grateful for your loan and says that she is commited to repaying it in the agreed-upon time, just as she has with past loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr:
Bienvenue fait partie du groupe Baraka et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 30 ans et est marié à Nadia,  une  commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4enfants, âgés de 1 à 11 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Il est  commerçant de  téléphones portables et de chargeurs depuis   5 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de téléphones portables, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait importer les produits de Dubaï et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bienvenue lives in Bujumbura and is a member of the Baraka group. He is 30 years old and married to a shopkeeper named Nadia. They have four children, ages 1 to 11, three of whom go to school.

He has been selling cellphones and chargers for five years now.

This is his fifth loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy lots of cellphones intended for resale in order to earn more money.

In the coming years, he would like to import products from Dubai and see his children learning in school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy lots of cellphones intended for resale in order to earn more money

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 42 years old and from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and her husband works in the field as a farmer. She has two children, ages 14 and 18. Jocelyn is helping her husband by farming vegetables on her land. She grows string beans and okra for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticide to further sustain her farm. She hopes to grow healthy vegetables that will help her generate better revenue. Any additional income will be used for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Afisa

texts.en:
Afisa is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri, Uganda. She is single and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Afisa has been working hard to manage her general store, which sells sugar, soap, rice and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Afisa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to procure more items like maize flour, rice, sugar, and other commodities, and will help Afisa to generate greater profits and allow her to educate her children better. Afisa hopes that in the future she will be able to continue to grow her busines. 

Afisa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Afisa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to procure more items like maize flour, rice, sugar, and other commodities

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She also gets additional income from her bar shop from home. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal, crates of soda, beer and a jerrican of local brew. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a delivery van to aid in transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kerleah

texts.en: Kerleah is 41 years old and lives in Kakata. She is married and her husband is a pastor; they have six children ages 8 to 22 that live at home and go to school. For the past fifteen years she has been operating a table where she sells slippers, rice and soap. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because she has lots of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers, rice, and soap for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, rice, and soap for her business,

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
This is Carol, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnold and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Carol has a bean curd pudding business and goes around in the community to sell it. "Taho" in Tagalog, bean curd pudding is famous in the Philippines and normally is sold in the morning. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Carol hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the ingredients of bean curd pudding.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Ms. Sakina is 33 years old and the mother of five children. She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. For 20 years, she has been in the business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has five buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, Sakina shared the feeling of achievement that she gets by fulfilling the needs of her family. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Naipa

texts.en:
Naipa is a widow and mother of four grown children from the Christian village of Fassuta in northern Israel. She has a general store that sells women’s clothing, gift items and household supplies. Over a year ago, Naipa undertook major renovations and expansions for her store. She succeeded in expanding her clientele and is reaching the goals of her original business plan. Naipa needs this loan to increase her stock in order to meet customer demands. After the renovations and success of her business’s expansion, she needs to keep up with demands while strengthening her store. She has significantly improved her business management tactics and skills, and the results have been observed.

Naipa took this loan for cash flow to purchase stock for her store’s expansion. Naipa wants to keep strengthening her store, continue her effective business management and ensure a secure income for her future.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her store’s expansion

loans.name: Pascasie
