texts.en: Pascasie is 28 years old. She owns a boutique where she sells different items and has spent 6 years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more maize flour, rice and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build her house she always dreams of.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, rice and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a 54-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with one adult son. Josefina operates a sari-sari store for income. This business started in 2000, earning her 5,000 PHP per month. Josefina plans to improve her business. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, canned goods, toiletries and seasonings. She hopes to attract more customers once she can replenish her stocks on time. Her profit will help her family in terms of healthy diet and household basic needs.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, toiletries and seasonings

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 48 years old. He is married and has three children between six and 15. He has spent 18 years in the fruit business. He wants this loan to buy more fruit such as tree tomatoes, oranges and passion fruit. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is 51 years old and from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married to a farmer. They have three children aged 7, 15 and 20. She relies on growing vegetables like eggplant and string beans for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticides to protect her crops from diseases. These will help her get a better return on her investment. She hopes that with this loan she can further expand her business, making the most profit and providing for her family's daily needs, education fees and income out of her harvest. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm to cultivate so she and her family can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticides.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia vende lo que son zanahorias, lechuga, tomates entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the MADRES TRABAJADORAS community bank.  She operates, as before, a vegetables sales business.  She sells carrots, lettuce, tomatoes and other produce.  She has operated the business for several years and says that it is successful because she has worked hard, day in and day out, to make it a success.  She operates the business in one of the markets in Cusco.  The business, she says, is her means of helping her family get ahead.

Our member is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of carrots.

Our member is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of carrots for her vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de picanteria que es como un restaurant que preparan comida tipica como cuy al horno,caldos entre otros platos,la socia tambien prepara frutillada que es una bebida a base de maiz y fresas,la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de picanteria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productios para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras y tambien maiz y fresas para la frutillada.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Asunta continues to run her picanteria, which is like a restaurant that prepares everyday food, such as roasted guinea pig and stews.  She also makes frutillada, which is a drink made from corn and strawberries.  She works form 10 am to 6 pm.  She has had this business for four years, and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant.  

She is seeking a loan to buy ingredients, such as meat, chicken, and vegetables, as well as corn and strawberries for the frutillada.  Asunta is happy with the loan she has received and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as meat, chicken and vegetables, as well as corn and strawberries for the frutillada (a local drink).

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Restituto is a 49-year-old married man from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. He weaves baskets and sells them to the market. Also, he is engaged in buying and selling of firewood. These are the sources of his income.

Restituto is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy materials for basket weaving, such as buri, and to buy firewood. In the future, Restituto hopes to expand his business to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving, such as buri, and to buy firewood

loans.name: Bukeru

texts.en:
Bukeru has been busy growing his business since his last Kiva loan!

To continue expanding his food stall further, Bukeru has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like passion fruit and other vegetables to sell, and will help Bukeru to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living with the additional profits. Bukeru hopes that in the future he will have a large grocery.

loans.use: To buy additional food items like passion fruit and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Youngor

texts.en:
Youngor is 45 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and has five children, ages 10 to 30 years old; three live at home and two are married. 

For the past 12 years, Youngor has been selling soap, rice, cold water and pepper in the local market. She started this business with a loan from her mother. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers and makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase soap, rice, cold water and pepper for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase soap, rice, cold water and pepper for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal from home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She also gets additional income from roasting maize. She works seven days a week. Margaret has requested a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspiration are to build her own rental rooms and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medicine.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul, aged 27, is single. He owns a studio which he has run for the past three years. He wants this loan to buy more equipment such as a sound system, desktop and a video coverage camera for use in his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy a sound system, desktop and camera to use in his business.

loans.name: Lango

texts.en: Lango is 32 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and has six children between the ages of 5 to 17. All of them attend school. For the past nine years she has been operating a table where she sells palm oil, rice, soap, and other items. Sometimes she has few customers, but most of the time she makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, soap and other items to expand her business. In the future she hopes to expand her business into a store.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, soap and other items.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is a 30-year-old mother of four children, ages 1, 8, 9 and 11. She and her family live in San Miguel, Bohol. She currently runs a hog-raising business; she finds it profitable and improving. She works hard in her business, hoping that it will help her sustain and meet her family's financial needs for daily living.
Presently, Minda needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 6,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and hog feed. She is certain that through this loan she can buy what she needs to grow and develop her business. 
Minda is looking for a better future for her business and she hopes that one day it will expand into a higher-yielding investment. With the income from the business, she can provide a better future for her children and put some money aside for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and hog feed.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima lives with her family: her husband and six grown children. She sells makuti (thatching materials made from palm fronds) in the communities in the area where she lives. She is very hardworking and enterprising.
She has lots of self-confidence and is always seeking new opportunities to supplement her husband’s income which isn’t sufficient to cover household costs. 
Mwanalima’s dream is to increase her inventory so that she is able make more sales and earn more money. She will then be in a position to help her family even more. That is why she decided to approach this institution to ask for a loan to buy more makuti so as to meet the demands of her customers, especially this rainy season.

loans.use: to buy more makuti for sale.

loans.name: Sogharan

texts.en: Ms. Sogharan is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past five years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband owns a business of milk production. She is the mother of two children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She has been associated with the Kashf foundation for five years. She wishes to utilize part of her profit on the betterment of her family and dreams to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of rice and flour at lower rates.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Geogiette

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Geogiette from Kandeh town in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is the married mother of one child who is 6 years old. She began this business to raise income to take care of their home. Her husband's income is not enough to support their home. 
 
Geogiette runs a food stand within a busy market area. She sells okra, peppers, maggie and palm oil. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works 15 hours a day 7 days per week. Her husband also earns money to help support their home. She says that her business is growing every day.

Geogiette has requested a loan in order to buy more okra, peppers, maggie and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more okra, peppers, maggie and palm oil.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child who goes to school. She has one additional family member (younger sister). Peace operates a retail shop. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She also gets additional income from farming. Peace has requested a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy 50 kg of flour, a jerycan of cooking oil, a bag of rice and 50 kg of sugar. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and to buy a deep freezer so as to start selling cold drinks. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity, but no running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy 50 kgs of sugar, a jerycan of cooking oil and a bag of rice.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is 51 years old. She is a widow with 11 children aged between 19 and 31. Only the youngest goes to school. She sells rice and sugar and has spent six years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more sugar, rice and maize flour for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en: Jartu is 29 years old and lives in Kakata town. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have three children between the ages of two and eight. Three of them are in school and all of them live at home. For the past six years Jartu has been involved in business; currently she sells palm oil, bananas, peppers, etc. in the local market. One of her main challenges is the high price of goods. She doesn’t have enough income to buy more stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, bananas, peppers, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, bananas, peppers, etc..

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is aged 48. She is married and has two children aged 21 and 23 years; they all go to schools. She sells fruits and has spent 18 years in the business. She wants this loan to buy more fruits such as passion fruit, pineapples and tree tomatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación pequeña y con el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de periódicos desde muy tempranas horas en la calle aguantando los cambios de temperatura  por que no cuenta con un puesto fijo trabajando por más de seis horas, pues  debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la adquirir periódicos por mayor cantidad de las compañías que los editan para de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Elizabeth es tener su casa propia para brindar más comodidad a su familia y también mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has two school age children.  They live in her parent’s house, occupying one small room with a dirt floor.  The house is in Villa Fátima in the city of La Paz.

She currently sells newspapers.  She starts on the street during the very early hours, and she withstands the temperature changes because she does not have a fixed stand.  She works for over six hours because she needs to cover the family’s food expenses.

The loan that she needs is to get a larger quantity of newspapers from the companies that publish them.  This way she will improve her income.

Elizabeth’s dream is to have her own house in order to make her family more comfortable and to have a better quality of life.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of newspapers to sell to the public.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 30 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y pujante. Es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene  02 hijos que son su mayor alegría.  Viven en casa de su cuñado junto a sus suegros, trabaja mucho para poder dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Jessica es muy variado, se dedica a la agricultura y tiene un terreno propio con sembríos de cacao, siendo éste un cultivo alternativo al cultivo de hoja de coca, y al mismo tiempo tiene un negocio de alquiler de video juegos en casa de su cuñado, en el trabajo de video juegos lleva ya haciéndolo por 04 años, mientras que en el sembrío de cacao lleva recién un 02 y lo hace en su propio terreno que tiene a unos kilómetros de la casa que habita.  Realiza esta actividad sola, ya que su pareja trabaja haciendo otras actividades. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede estar en su casa casi todo el tiempo del día, así puede ver a sus hijos ya que necesitan de su cuidado por que aun son muy pequeños, hasta ahora todo le va bien y espera poder seguir así hasta más adelante y crecer junto a su negocio. Este es el  préstamo número 09 con la institución MFP, espera que le siga yendo bien, ya que siempre fue una muy buena pagadora en su grupo y es muy conocida ahí por su grado de responsabilidad, esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para poder tener mayor capital para su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, realizará el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de cacao, contratará algunos trabajadores para poder realizar la limpieza, además llevará a realizar la reparación de algunos de sus video juegos.
texts.en: Jessica, 30, is tenacious, hard-working woman.  She and her husband have 2 much-loved children.  They live with her husband's family in a house owned by her brother-in-law.  Jessica works hard at many jobs to maintain a good quality of life for her family.  She is a farmer and owns land where she grows cacao and cocoa leaves.  She also operates a video games rental store from a space in her brother-in-law's house.  She has operated the video rental business for 4 years and the farming business for 2.  Her farm is a few kilometers from the house where she lives and it is hers alone because her partner works other jobs.  She says that she is pleased with her progress because the businesses are profitable now.  The businesses suit her, as well, because her children are still small and she can be home to care for them during most of each day.  For the future, she hopes to grow the businesses.  This will be Jessica's 9th MFP loan and she expects to do as well with this loan as she has with past ones.  She has repaid her past loans and the other members of her community bank consider her to be highly responsible.  Jessica says that she is grateful for your loans and that she will use part of the 4000-soles loan to hire farm laborers for her cacao business and the rest for her video games business.

loans.use: to pay expenses for farm and video game rental businesses.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata, es casada y tiene cinco hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona San Roque de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la confección de ropa de señoras de pollera y posteriormente los vende de forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo, trabajando por más de ocho horas al día debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar tela e hilos por cantidad y elaborar sus prendas en mayor volumen y de esta manera tratar de mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Fortunata es mejorar sus ingresos y construir más habitaciones para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Fortunata is married and has five school age children.  They live in their own house, occupying one room with brick walls and a dirt floor.  The house is in the San Roque area of the city of El Alto.

She currently gets income from making clothes for the women who wear typical skirts.  She later sells the clothing in an itinerant manner because she does not have a fixed stand.  She works for over eight hours a day because she needs to cover her family’s food expenses.

She needs the loan to buy fabric and thread in bulk.  This way she will try to improve her income.

Fortunata’s dream is to improve her income and to build more rooms so that her family will be more comfortable.

This is the first loan she has requested with IMRPO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to continue making traditional skirts.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De La Q Group

texts.es: La Sra. Luz Carmen tiene 38 años de edad, es separada y tiene 3 hijos menores de los cuales 2 están en la escuela. Se dedica a la venta de cerveza, gaseosa y abarrotes el cual ya tiene un año en este negocio, además para poder obtener más ingresos trabaja eventualmente haciendo servicios de limpieza. Actualmente con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Luz puede cubrir los gastos de alimentación de su familia y los pagos de servicios de luz y agua de su casa. Ella comenzó con la idea de construir su casa y cubrir la terapia de su menor hija. Su plan para el futuro es agrandar su negocio para poder abrir uno nuevo y también que sus hijos tengan una profesión. Gracias al préstamo que se le otorgó pudo aumentar su mercadería con productos como: arroz, azúcar y demás víveres. Luz Carmen pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Las Emprendedoras De La Q”, el cual está conformado por 5 personas en donde ella ocupa el cargo de presidenta desde que se formo el grupo.
texts.en: Sra. Luz Carmen, 38, is separated from her husband.  She has 3 young children, two of whom are in school.  She operates a corner shop where she sells beer, soft drinks and everyday staples.  She has operated the business for a year and supplements her income with cleaning jobs.  Luz can cover the costs, with much hard work, of food for her family and basic utilities such as electricity and water.  She started the business because she wanted to build a house and pay for therapy services for her youngest daughter.  For the future, she wants to grow her business and start new ones.  She also wants to help her children study and work for paid careers.  Luz Carmen will use this loan to stock her corner shop with merchandise--rice, sugar, etc.--that she will resell.  The "Las Emprendedoras de la Q" community bank has 5 members and Luz Carmen has served as group president from the time it was formed.

loans.use: to stock her corner shop.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, es divorciada, tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en una casa en anticrético ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Chacaltaya de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada de seguros y también como promotora de cosméticos por más de diez hora al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar los trámites de la universidad para un curso sobre seguros, ya que es requisito en su trabajo y no le alcanza con lo que gana.
El sueño de Doris es mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos ya que no tiene más ingresos.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Doris is divorced, and she has two school age children.  They live in an ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] house.  They occupy three rooms of the house, which is in the Chacaltaya area of the city of La Paz.

She currently works for a private insurance company.  She also works as a cosmetic sales promoter for over ten hours a day.  She does this because she needs to cover the expenses for education, food, and basic services.

The loan that she needs is for the university costs for an insurance course, which is a work requirement.  She does not have enough to pay for this with what she earns.

Her dream is to improve her income in order to be able to pay for her children’s university studies.  She does not have other income.

This is the third time she has worked with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the university costs for an insurance course.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru: Собир в нашей организации кредитуется первый цикл. Он добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек и проживает в сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Собир женат и на воспитании имеет 1  несовершеннолетнего ребенка. Он занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, ячмень. В ведении данного бизнеса ему помогает жена. Раньше Собир ездил в Россию на заработки, но в России тоже не имел постоянной место работы. Уже более 5 лет он занимается животноводством и земледелением. На полученный доход от бизнеса он улучшил условию своего домохозяйство. В этом году Собир посеял на 2 гектара земли ячмень, однако из-за неблагополучной погоды, Собир не смог получить намеченный урожай. Поэтому он обращался в нашу организацию с целью получения займа для покупки скота и расширить свой бизнес по животноводству.  Собир надеется на Вашу благотворительность.
texts.en:
Sobir is on his first loan cycle with our organization.  He is an honest and hardworking man and lives in a rural area which offers optimal conditions for such activities as animal husbandry and crop production.

Sobir is married and has one child who is still a minor.  He raises livestock and grows crops, mainly wheat and barley.  His wife helps him with his work.

Sobir used to travel to Russia to find work, but he did not have a permanent job there.  He has now been involved in animal husbandry and crop production for more than five years.  Thanks to his income, he has been able to improve the living conditions of his household.

This year, Sobir sowed barley on two hectares (4.94 acres) of land, but because of bad weather, crop production was lower than anticipated. This is why he has turned to our organization and requested a loan to buy some livestock and expand his animal husbandry business.

Sobir is relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Josephine from Kandeh town in the southern area Bo District. She is a single mother of one child, age 8 years, and her child is currently attending school. 

Josephine runs a retail store at her house. She sells cigarettes, soap, toothpaste and sugar. She has been running this business for over four years. She works at the business from 7 am until 6 pm, seven days per week. Her business is the only income she has. Josephine says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to improve her business and the low purchasing power of customers. 

Josephine has requested a loan in order to buy more cigarettes, soap, toothpaste and sugar. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her child. In the future, she wants to expand her business. She thanks lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy more cigarettes, soap, toothpaste and sugar

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende lo que son naranjas, mandarinas, platanos, granadillas  entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de naranjas  al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cleofe belongs to the 'MADRES TRABAJADORAS' communal bank. She continues with her fruit business, selling oranges, mandarins, bananas and passion fruit, amongst others. She has been working in this business for years and it is going well thanks to the effort which she makes daily. Cleofe sells in one of the markets in the city of Cusco. She is a responsible and hard-working person and this is her way of supporting her family. 
Cleofe is requesting the loan to buy oranges wholesale. She is grateful for the loan and promises to fulfil her repayments.

loans.use: to buy oranges wholesale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mariama. She is married and has one child aged 15 years. She also has one additional dependent that lives with her. In 1994, Mariama established her textiles business. She began her business to get income in order to sustain her life. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy six bails of cotton at Le 700,000, and the remaining Le 300,000 will be used for transportation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 800,000. In the future, Mariama plans to rent a shop and began to sell wholesale. Mariama is honest and hardworking, and she thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy six bails of cotton and help with transportation.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 38-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working since 2008 in the business of selling charcoal and sweets. His work is mobile. He uses his van to sell his products by passing through several villages in his area. He used to work in agriculture, but he preferred to move to a better income business in order to cover almost all of his family' needs.

Wael is a hard worker. He is well known in the region as the non-stop working man. He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the third time in order to pay for his children's tuition fees and school supplement. His previous loans improved his monthly income a lot, which reflected positively on his social and financial situations in a very impressive way. Wael hopes to keep expanding his business capital to increase his customers and monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for his children's tuition fees and school supplement

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de platanos y ocas (es parecido a la papa) al horno,ella vende en una carreta en forma ambulatoria desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene en este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las ocas y platanos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar platanos y ocas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sofia continues to work selling baked bananas and ocas (similar to a potato). She works as a street vendor from 9.00 am until 4.00 pm, selling from a cart. She has been working in this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Sofia wants to use this business to get ahead and her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the ocas and bananas. She is requesting the loan to buy bananas and ocas wholesale. 

Sofia is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to meet her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy bananas and ocas wholesale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 49 years old, and she lives together with her husband and four children, ages 19 to 26. Currently, her children are attending school. For the past three years, she has been selling bread in her community. One of her main problems that she faces is that sometimes customers take bread on credit and don't pay on time. Making her popular is why she likes her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread for her business. She plans to build her house and educate her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 55-year-old Marie from Kandeh town in the southern area Bo District. She is married with five children between the ages of 18 and 30 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Marie runs a wood and gari store. She sells wood and gari. She has been running this business for over 20 years. She works at the business from 7 am until 6 pm, seven days per week. She also receives income from her elder daughter. Marie says that her business is doing well because the whole community knows that she sells wood and gari at her house.   

Marie has requested a loan in order to buy more wood and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to renovate her house and improve her level. In the future, she wants to expand her business. She thanks lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy more wood and gari

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es separado de la madre de sus 4 hijos y todos ellos están a cargo suyo, por esto tiene que trabajar fuertemente para sacar su familia adelante y brindarle una buena calidad de vida en el hogar. Para generar los ingresos que necesita en su hogar, Jorge tiene un cultivo de verduras y adicional a esto tiene en su casa una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para sacar su tienda adelante y es por esto que para superarla busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su negocio.

Jorge espera que de esta manera pueda mejorar la condición económica de su familia y también tenga la oportunidad de que sus 4 hijos tengan una mejor educación. Su sueño es poder trabajar hasta que la salud se lo permita.
texts.en:
Jorge separated from the mother of his four children and they are all dependent on him, this is the reason why he has to work really hard to get his family ahead and provide them with a good quality of life at home.  To generate the income needed at home, Jorge grows vegetables and has a convenience store in his house where he offers basic need products.  His main challenge is the need for working capital to keep his store going and this why he requests a loan to buy basic necesessity products to stock his store.

Jorge hopes that this way he can improve the financial conditions of his family and that his four children have the opportunity to better education.  His dream is to be able to keep working with good health.

loans.use: to buy basic need products for his convenience store.

loans.name: Maria Viglenice

texts.es:
Maria vende productos de uso personal desde hace unos 8 años cuando fue abandonada por su esposo y tuvo que responder por los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 6 hijos. Las grandes dificultades económicas que ha tenido en su hogar han hecho que la calidad de vida de sus hijos se vea fuertemente afectada, pero Maria espera que con su esfuerzo pueda mejorar esta situación y sacar a su familia adelante. La mayor desventaja que tiene es que en el sector hay bastante competencia de la venta de estos mismos productos y Maria no cuenta con mucho capital para poder diferenciarse. Buscando mejorar el surtido que ofrece a sus clientes, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, entre otros y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder conseguirse su casa propia y montar el negocio allí. Además aspira a poder mejorar la condición actual de su hogar y ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación escolar.
texts.en:
Maria sells personal use products, she started 8 years ago when she was abandoned by her husband and she had to be responsible for the home expenses where she lives with her six children.  The great economic difficulties that she has faced at home have strongly affected the quality of life of her children.  However, Maria hopes that with her efforts she can improve the situation and get her family ahead.  The main disadvantage is that there is a lot of competition selling the same products and Maria doesn't have much working capital to differentiate herself from the competition.  Looking to expand the variety of products that she offers to her clients, Maria requests a loan to buy personal use products such as perfume, deodorant, lotion and other products to offer more variety of products to her clients.

Her dream is to be able to buy her own house and open the business there.  She also hopes to improve the quality of her current home and offer her children a better quality of life and education.

loans.use: to buy personal use products such as perfume, deodorant, lotion and other products to offer more variety of products to her clients

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 35-year-old married man with three children, ranging in age from three to seven years. Ronald sells plantains, which are made all over the country into many people's favorite dish, matoke. He sells his produce to neighbors as well as people from some other nearby towns. But in the future he wishes to transport and sell his products all the way to the capital city of Kampala. 

Right now, the biggest struggles he encounters in his business are that the dry season is difficult on plants and decreases the quality of his product and the wet season can make the roads impassable. Sometimes it's hard to win! But Ronald keeps working hard and continues being a strong businessman. His loan of 1,000,000 UGX will help him buy more bulk plantains and potatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more plantains and potatoes

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Fatima prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her daughter. 

Fatima is a 46-year-old married woman who has four family members from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors. She would like to expand her project in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, el socio trabaja brindando el servicio de taxi, el tiene su carrito siendo el mismo socio quien lo trabaja todos los días tanto en las mañanas como en las tardes  a veces sale por las noches pero  mayormente lo hace por el día, el socio lleva años en este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.
El socio solicito el préstamo para realizar el manteniendo general de su carro como cambio de aceite. 
El socio está contento con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Madres Trabajadores (Hardworking Mothers). He offers a taxi service, and he has his small car. He is the same member who works every day in the mornings and evenings. Sometimes, he goes out at night, but usually he works during the day. 

This member has been doing his work for years; it goes well for him, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. He is a very optimistic person, with many hopes to get ahead for his family. 

He is requesting the loan to carry out the general maintenance of his car, such as changing the oil. 

This member is satisfied with the awarded loan, and he is grateful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to carry out the general maintenance of his car, such as oil changes.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
From the town of Bien Unido, Bohol, Myra is 19 years old, single, and raising a nine-month-old baby boy. Engaged in fishing and catching crabs for an income, she works hard to meet the needs of her child.

Myra is requesting a loan to buy a fishing net and crab traps to sustain her business. She hopes to earn a better income in order to provide the basic needs of her baby such as diapers and milk. In the future, Myra hopes to have other business options for increased profitability.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and crab traps.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene desde hace 30 años una venta de verduras en una parte del parque principal de su municipio, y con este es que genera los ingresos que necesita para sostener los gastos de su hogar y brindarles una buena calidad de vida a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Como en el momento está atravesando una gran dificultad económica que tiene a su familia pasando por una muy mala calidad de vida, Alberto tiene que acudir a un préstamo para comprar las verduras que necesita para surtir su negocio y seguir vendiendo a sus clientes.

Alberto espera poder superar esta crisis y mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar. Además en un futuro aspira a que sus 3 hijos terminen la educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Alberto started selling vegetables 30 years ago at the main park of his municipality.  With this business he generates the income necessary to cover his home expenses and provide for a good quality of life to his wife and three children.  Because he is currently going through financial difficulties that has his family suffering from a bad quality of life, Alberto needs to request a loan to buy the vegetables he needs to stock his business and continue selling to his clients.

Alberto hopes to be able to get through this crisis and improve the conditions of his home. In addition, he hopes that in the future his three children can finish university education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to stock his business and continue selling to his clients.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Massah from Kaneh town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is a married mother of five children between the ages of 4 and 18 years. Four of her children are currently attending school.

In 2000, Massah established her business to generate income to support her family. Working 14 hours each day, she says that her venture is doing well; she has a variety of items on her table, and more customers are coming regularly.

Massah requires a loan in order to buy more dry fish, onions, tomatoes and pepper. She hopes that the extra income arising from this loan will allow her to educate her children and start a savings account. In the future, Massah plans to expand her enterprise. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more dry fish, onions, tomatoes and pepper.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golisinas como chupetes,caramelos,galletashabas saldas entre otras golosinas,la socia tiene una carreta donde vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar dulces,galletas,habitas y caramelos y tambien comprar una carreta nueva.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member works selling candies, such as lollipops, sweets, cookies, and fried broad beans, among other types of candy. She has a vendor’s cart where she makes sales from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has 8 years in this business and it’s going very well for her. 

This member’s dream is to have a grocery store. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase sweets, cookies, broad beans and candies, and also to buy a new cart.

This member is satisfied with the awarded loan, and she is committed to paying off her loan installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, cookies, broad beans, and candy, and also to buy a new cart.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
La socia “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y también otros productos como menestras, fideos, golosinas, cerveza entre otros. La socia tiene años en este negocio el cual le brinda muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales ya que mediante este negocio la socia saca a su familia adelante, a la vez la socia continua con la venta de gas, la socia trabaja desde las 05:00am hasta las 07:00pm , la socia es una persona responsable.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como cerveza.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado  y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
The borrower, from the Madres Trabajadoras communal bank, continues dedicating herself to the grocery store business selling staples such as rice, sugar, milk and also other products such as vegetables, pasta, snacks, beer and more. She has been in this business for years which gives her a lot of satisfaction both financially and personally as through this business she supports her family, and she continues selling gas, working from 5:00AM until 7:00PM. She is a responsible person.

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as beer. She is happy with the granted credit and is grateful to the Kiva loaners.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beer and other items to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Ms Munira is a 43-year-old married woman. Kashf Foundation found Munira in a terrible state; she and her children lived in a ramshackle one-room house in Kamalia. Her husband worked as a carpet weaver for a miserly businessman in town who barely paid him his dues. Her children slept without their meals, and sending them to school was out of question.

It was under such depressing circumstances that Munira took her first loan of Rs 10,000 to purchase a carpet-making machine. Ever since, she, along with her five children, have helped her husband in carpet-making. Her relation with Kashf Foundation has altered her social circumstances considerably. Through persistent hard work and determination, Munira is now able to feed her children well and even send them to school.

She has requested a loan of Rs 15,000/- and intends to purchase another machine and raw materials such as reels of threads and wool so they can produce more carpets.

loans.use: to purchase another machine and raw materials such as reels of threads and wool.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Abeer prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her brother. 

Abeer is a 27-year-old married woman who has three family members from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to repaint her home and she wants to do maintenance on the home. She hopes in the future to buy new furniture to improve her living standard. Since Abeer is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un carro donde hace servicio de taxi,el hace servicio de taxi en la ciudad de cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio se dedica a este negocio 10 años y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is still working in the transportation business. He has a car that he uses as a taxi, servicing the city of Cusco. He works from 5:00AM until 6:00PM. He has been in this business for ten years and it is going very well. His dream is to have a new car. He is asking for a loan in order to buy tires for his car.

He is happy about the loan and he promises to complete the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car that he uses as a taxi

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is a 26-year-old married man and a father of three young children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Noel has been engaged in the fishing business for more than six years now. Noel is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. In the future, Noel wants to make his business successful. Also, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for his boat

loans.name: Koser

texts.en: Koser is a 29-year-old married woman and lives in Kamalia along with her husband and six children. She took out a loan of Rs 10,000 from Kashf a year back and reported to have used it for purchasing a carpet-making machine. Koser wishes to send her children to school and save for her daughters' dowry. Talking to a loan officer, Koser said that when she got married, her in-laws insulted her for not bringing in enough dowry and she doesn’t want her daughters to be humiliated the same way. She said she wishes to expand her current work by bringing in more machines as well as material. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy raw material such as bundles of wool and threads in order to increase her sales of carpets. She wishes to utilize part of the profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as bundles of wool and threads.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 25 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Flavia has been working hard to manage her clothing store, which sells dresses, skirts and tops. 

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more trousers and shirts, and will help Flavia to generate greater profits and pay for medical bills. Flavia hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a family house. 

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Flavia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and shirts to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende la comida en el final de un paradero de autobús, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus vecinos y personas que desean, la socia es una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por sus hijos. 

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz ,aceite y menestras.

La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado  y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Madres Trabajadoras. She works selling food. She sells the food at the final stop on a bus route. She has years in this business which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day to her business. She walks about selling to her neighbors and to other people who desire it. She is an enterprising woman very eager for her family to get ahead. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as rice, oil and beans. She is happy with the granted credit and is grateful to the Kiva loaners.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil, and beans to use to prepare meals that she sells at a bus stop and by walking about

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio tambien sigue haciendo servicio a turistas a lugares como Ollantaytambo,chinchero y machupicchu,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos de carro como llantas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the transportation business. He has a taxi service on the various streets of the city of Cusco. He works from 7:00AM until 6:00PM. He also continues his tourist business in places such as Ollantaytambo, Chinchero, and Machu Picchu. He has been in the business for five years. His dream is to have a new car. He is asking for a loan to buy spare car parts and tires.

He is happy for the loan and promises to complete his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts and tires for use in his taxi and tourist business

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Musu from Torkpoitown Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between the ages of 4 and 16 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

Musu runs a palm oil business.  She sells wholesale palm oil within a busy market area. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business 11 hours a day and 7 days per week. Her other source of income comes from small-scale farming in the village. Musu says that the main challenge to her business is customers want credit to buy the palm oil, but fall to pay back on time.

Musu has requested a loan to buy gallons of palm oil. The extra income will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children up to university level, because she did not go to school. In the future, she plans to open a palm oil store. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells second-hand shoes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week.  She also gets additional income from rental houses. 

She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand shoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspirations are to educate her children to the university level and also to  build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia se dedica a la venta de mates naturales que la misma socia prepara como también agua de manzana y maíz morado, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria todos los días tanto en las mañanas como en las tardes, y en las noches  no ya que se dedica a cuidado de sus hijos, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona bien alegre y de esta manera saca a su familia adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como manzanas,maiz,y algunas hierbas naturales.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado  y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Madres Trabajadoras. She works selling natural mates (beverages) that she prepares herself such as apple water and purple corn. She sells as a street vendor every day in the mornings as well as the afternoons, and in the evenings not dedicated to caring for her children. She has been in this business for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day to the business. She is a very friendly person and this is the way she supports her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as apples, corn and some natural herbs.

She is happy with the granted loan and is grateful to the Kiva loaners.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as apples, corn, and some natural herbs to make natural mates (beverages) that she sells as a street vendor

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus vecinos y personas que desean, la socia elabora distintos platos como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros, la socia es una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por sus hijos. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite y menestras para su negocio.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado  y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Madres Trabajadoras. She works selling food. She has spent years in this business which is going well thanks to her effort that she puts in each day. She is a street vendor selling to her neighbors and to people who want it. She makes various dishes such as chicken with rice, stir-fry, and soups among other items. She is an entrepreneur with a lot of desire to get ahead for the sake of her children.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as rice, oil and beans for her business.

She is happy with the granted loan and she is grateful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil and beans for her business as a street vendor selling dishes such as chicken with rice and more.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, además de ser muy amable y jovial. Está casada con Roberto quien es artesano y padre de sus 2 hijos Wilson de 27 años y Neri de 20 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su esposo, sus hijos y 2 nietos, instalados en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Elena  es la venta de abarrotes en general, para eso estableció una bodega en su propia casa y lo complementa también con la venta de yucas. Atiende amablemente a sus clientes desde muy temprano y afortunadamente le va muy bien. Empezó con un apoyo financiero de MFP, comprando sus productos en pequeñas cantidades. Ya tiene un año dedicándose a este trabajo y ha logrado crecer a base de mucho esfuerzo y en todo este tiempo ha podido consolidar una buena clientela. Trabaja sola aunque en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hija. Considera que su negocio es rentable por las ganancias que a diario obtiene por todas sus ventas. Su negocio le permite estar en casa para poder atender a sus nietos ya que los quiere mucho y vela por ellos, además los ingresos económicos que obtiene le sirven para comprar todo lo que hace falta en su hogar. Por tanto tiene deseos de  crecer y ampliar su bodega hasta convertirla en un bazar donde pueda vender diversos productos que el cliente solicita. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, aceites y otros. También comprará sacos de yuca porque la temporada de ventas de este producto promete buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Elena is 57 years old and is a happy and hard working woman, as well as friendly and cheerful. She is married to Roberto who is an artisan and the father of her two children, Wilson who is 27 and Neri who is 20 years old. She lives with her husband, children and two grandchildren all in their own house. 

Elena's business is the sale of general groceries, for which she established a store in her own house. She also complements her sales with the sale of cassava. She attends to her customers in a friendly manner from early in the morning and it is fortunately going very well for her. She began with the financial support of MFP by buying her products in small quantities. She already has a year of experience with this work and has grown her base with much effort and in all this time she has been able to consolidate a good clientele. She works alone but at times receives her daughter's help. She considers her business profitable for the daily earnings that she receives from her sales. 

Her business allows her to be at home to care for her grandchildren because she loves them very much and watches over them. In addition, the earnings that she obtains allows her to buy anything that is needed for her home. She has hopes to grown and expand her store to convert it into a business where she can sell diverse products that her clientele requests. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is thankful to all those who have made these credits possible so she can continue her work with improved results. On another hand she is committed to fulfilling her payments punctually like she has done with previous loans. She will also buy sacks of cassava because the season for this product promises good earnings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oils and sacks of cassava.

loans.name: Karine

texts.ru:
Карине занимается продажей одежды и обуви в городе Капане в арендованном помещении на протяжении 12 лет. Товары для своего бизнеса Карине приобретает в Еревана один раз в месяц. Карине очень любит свой бизнес и работает без выходных. У нее много постоянных клиентов. Доход от бизнеса Карине является основным источником дохода для ее семьи. Также благодаря доходу от бизнеса, Карине платит за обучение сына.  
Карине 45 лет, она проживает в городе Капане. Карине окончила Капанское медицинское училище, но по своей специальности не работала. Карине замужем и у нее трое детей: две дочери и сын. Дочери замужем и проживают отдельно от родителей. Сын учится на платном отделении Горисского государственного университета. Муж Карине работает  водителем.  
Карине необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для приобретения осенней одежды и обуви для своего бизнеса. Карине получала кредит от организации Нор Оризон трижды и всегда выплачивала кредит вовремя.
texts.en:
Karine has been selling clothing and footwear in a shop she rents in the city of Kapan for the past 12 years. Once per month, she purchases the merchandise for her business in the city of Yerevan. Karine loves her business and works without holidays. She has many regular customers. Her business profits represent the main source of income for her family. Karine also uses this money to pay for her son's education.

Karine is 45 years old and lives in the city of Kapan. She graduated from the Kapan Medical College but has never worked in her profession. Karine is married and has three children: two daughters and a son. Her daughters are married and live apart from their parents. Karine's son is a paying student of the Gorissk State University, and her husband is a driver.

Karine needs a loan of 500,000 dram in order to purchase fall clothing and shoes for her business. She has previously taken three loans from Nor Horizon and has always repaid them on time.

loans.use: to buy fall clothing and shoes for her business

loans.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura is married and has four children, ages 22, 21, 18 and 16 years old.  He is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to his children. 

Jura began his own business dealing in animal husbandry when his children were little. He is requesting a loan of  USD 2,000 to increase the number of animals he has for sale. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Малохат  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  сухофруктов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Malohat is a very hard-working woman. She is 47 years old, married, and raising 1 child. As a migrant worker in Russia, her husband earns a meagre salary that is insufficient to provide the family with all necessities of life. Therefore, Malohat has decided to help her husband for the benefit of their family. To this end, she took the course "Succeed" organized by the Association of Businesswomen and obtained her graduation certificate. Now, she would like to launch her own business of buying and reselling dried fruits. She is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to purchase dried fruits and get her business off the ground. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for launching her new business

loans.name: Pukhraj

texts.en:
Pukhraj is a 34-year-old housewife and mother of three. Her husband has successfully run a small general store in her community for the past five years. The man in the photo is Pukhraj’s husband.  He offers various items of goods for daily use. He has good communication skills and counts a good client list. 

Pukhraj, on behalf of her husband, is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 for the growth of his business. This will enable him to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. Then he will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. He wishes to use part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a drip irrigation system for her grape plants

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”, la socia se dedica al negocio de llamadas telefónicas, ella realiza llamadas tanto locales como nacionales, la socia realiza esta actividad de forma ambulatoria y mediante este negocio ella puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos ya que su trabajo es independiente, esto es uno de los motivos que hace que le guste más lo que realiza, la socia cuenta con un  carro el cual brinda el servicio de taxi siendo su esposo quien maneja el carro.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro como el cambio de aceite.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank "MADRES TRABAJADORAS".  She makes a living selling calling services both local and international.  She does this going from town to town and because of this business she is able to spend more time with her children as it is her own business.  This is one of the motivations she loves most about what she does.  Her family also relies on their car which serves as a taxi business - her husband being the driver.  She is seeking a loan to do maintenance on the car like an oil change.  She is grateful for this loan and promises to repay in a timely manner.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her car like an oil change.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: La señora  Vicenta tiene 56 años de edad,   tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive en la provincia cercado de Cochabamba en la zona central, perseverante con sus metas, Hizo estudiar a sus tres hijos logrando sacarles adelante cursando diferentes carreras en  la Universidad, todo eso logro gracias alquilar sus cuartos de su casa q son 3, además se dedica a vender refrigerios como ser refrescos, hamburguesas en un feria de venta de autos. Su esposo Alberto se fue a Europa del cual no sabe nada porque les abandono hace 10 años, el motivo del presente crédito es la de ampliar la construcción de sus cuartos para poder alquilar y tener más ingresos ya que a medida que pasa el tiempo su edad ya no le permite seguir realizando esta actividad.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 56, has three children that are now independent, she lives in the province of Cochabamba in the central zone.  Persevering to achieve her goals, she got her three children to finish university degrees by renting out 3 rooms in her house, she also sells lunch food such as pop and burgers at a car sale fair.  Her husband Alberto abandoned the and went to Europe and she hasn't heard back from him in 10 years.  

The reason to request this loan is to expand her house and the rooms so she can continue to rent them and have more income because as she ages she won't be able to continue with her activity.

loans.use: to expand her house.

loans.name: Nenneh

texts.en:
Nenneh, a 45 year-old married mother of four children, ages 5 to 25 years, runs a food stand business in Torkpoi town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. In this business for 15 years, she sells flour, pepper, rice, oil and okra within a busy market. Her main challenges are high rates of theft and price inflation. Nenneh also receives income from her husband, a tailor whose income is not enough to support the home.

Nenneh is requesting this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy food commodities like bagged rice and oil. She says that the resulting extra income will help her to continue to educate her children and improve her living standard. In the future, she would like to open a shop. Nenneh is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy food commodities like bagged rice and oil.

loans.name: Idd

texts.en:
Idd is 28 years old and a responsible father and husband.  He has two young children who attend a local primary school. 

He has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the neighborhood. He has been doing this work since last year to help his family get ahead.

He wants to increase his sales and thus be able to give his children everything they need. This is his main reason for seeking a loan from Yehu. He will use the funds to purchase a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, kales, potatoes, bananas, etc, which he hopes will help him increase his earnings. 

This will be very beneficial to his family, considering that his business is their only source of income.   They all work in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables, like tomatoes, kale, potatoes, and bananas.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, a 40-year-old farmer from the rural area around Lyantonde, Uganda, has five children under the age of 11. Since 2001, he has been rearing goats to earn profits to provide for his family. He also works as a butcher to ready the goats for his clients.Jackson finds that weather is his biggest challenge; when it doesn't rain enough, his goats don't have enough to eat.

Now requesting this loan to buy more baby goats to raise, Jackson's dream is to have a large farm with lots of land for his goats to graze on.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and lives in the Buchanan. She’s married, with six grown children between the ages of 18 and 35. Her husband is a contractor.

She has been involved in business for the past 10 years.  Martha says she has been receiving help from her husband to expand her business. Presently she is selling short bread,  She enjoys the flow of her customers.

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and butter for her business.   Her plans are to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and butter for her business.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Gerardo tiene 46 años de edad concubinos con la Sra. Segundina mas de 15 años tienen 5 hijos menores viven en la casa de su familiares solo pagan de luz y agua, de la ciudad de Cochabamba están a 52 km, Don Gerardo es chofer empleado trabaja en sindicato de auto transporte, recientemente se compraron un vehículo y para comprar Línea de autotransporte le falto dinero por este motivo solicito un préstamo, a la vez son agricultores producen papa, papaliza, haba y cría ganado vacuno, Don Gerardo es una persona humilde trabajador y responsable, Don Gerardo está muy contento de haber comprado la línea de autotransporte trabajara con su vehículo y tendrá ahorro para el estudio de sus hijos y para construir su casa eso es su mayor sueño tener casa propia.
texts.en: Gerardo is 46 and has lived with his common law partner Segundina for more than 15 years, they have five young children, they live in the house of one of their family members, they only pay for power and water, the city of Cochabamba is 52km away, Don Gerardo has a job as a driver and is a member of the Transportation Union.  They recently bought a vehicle and to be able to buy it he requested a loan, they are also farmers of potato, beans and they raise cattle, Gerardo is a very humble, responsible and hardworking person, Don Gerardo is very happy that he bought this vehicle to work with and he will have savings for her children's education and to build his house, which is his biggest dream to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to work with a transportation company.

loans.name: Marioly Cristina

texts.es: La señora  Marioly  tiene 33 años de edad, no  tiene  hijos, vive en la provincia cercado de Cochabamba en la zona sud, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus padres Juan Manuel y Ana María los cuales son personas de la tercera edad, el padre tiene 60 años y la madre 59 años. La actividad económica de los padres era la carpintería, de ahí Marioly desde los 5 años ayudo a sus padres, a medida que crecía Marioly sus conocimientos de la carpintería también aumentaron, Marioly en la actualidad heredo todas las herramientas de sus padres, ahora ella trabaja en la carpintería realizando todo tipo de muebles como ser roperos, catres, ventanas y puertas para construcción, y todo trabajo en madera.  Marioly mantiene a sus padres los cuales se encuentran enfermos ella compra medicamentos y varios constantemente para que se sanen, pero gasto gran parte de su dinero destinado a la compra de madera motivo por el cual es el presente crédito, ya que se le presento un nuevo contrato de la cual requieren muebles para llevar al occidente del país.
texts.en: Marioly is 33, has no children and lives in the province of Cochabamba in the south zone,  she rents a house with her parents Juan Manuel and Ana Maria who are seniors, her dad is 60 and her mom is 59.  The economic activity of her parents was carpentry, which Marioly learned since she was 5 years old to help her parents, as she was growing up so was her knowledge of carpentry.  Marioly now has all the tools from her parents and she works in carpentry making all sorts of furniture such as dressers, beds, windows, doors for construction and any type of wood work.  Marioly supports her parents who are ill, she buys medicine and whatever is needed so that they get better, but she spent a lot of money that was going to be used to purchase wood, reason why she requests a loan and she has a new contract for furniture that will be taken to the western part of the country.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene 38 años, vive con su  esposa, tienen 4 hijos que dependen de ellos. Dos hijos ayudan a su padre en la siembra de maní y maíz,  ya que no le alcanza el dinero para pagar ayudantes. Su otra hija se encuentra estudiando en otro Municipio, ubicado a 7 horas de Monteagudo, donde trabaja medio tiempo de empleada para poder cubrir sus gastos  ya que su padre no puede mandarle lo necesario, pasa clases por las noches. Su hijo menor estudia en la escuela de la Comunidad. El diario vivir de Juan es muy preocupante ya que los recursos económicos que gana no le alcanza para proporcionar una buena alimentación a su familia y hacer estudiar a sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura y su esposa a la cría de gallinas criollas y cerdos a parte de cuidar los que aceres de la casa. Con el crédito que se le va a otorgar invertirá en la siembra de papa y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 38, lives with his wife and they have four children who depend on them. Two children help him plant peanuts and corn, since they don't have the money to pay helpers. Their other daughter is studying in another municipality, located seven hours from Monteagudo, where she works part-time as a maid to cover her expenses since her father cannot send her what she needs. She goes to classes at night. His younger son studies in the local school. 

Juan's daily life is concerning because his income is not enough to feed his family well and send his children to school. He works in agriculture and his wife raises chickens and pigs as well as taking care of the house. With the loan he receives, he will invest in sowing potatoes and he will be able to make additional income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sow potatoes

loans.name: C1196 Tuvemubukene Group

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 29 years old and is married with three children aged 2 to 5 years old and he takes care of six dependents. He sells various good such as sugar, soap, biscuits, bread, etc. Jean Claude is a leader of this group, which is called "C1196 TUVEMUBUKENE" in the local language. In the photo, he is the one with his hand raised. This is his fifth year in this business and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Jean Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to  buy various good such as sugar, soap, biscuits, bread, etc., for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children and to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy various good such as sugar, soap, biscuits, bread, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Grâce  Berthe Yabo's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Grâce Yabo la responsable est âgée de 22ans. Célibataire sans enfant, elle s'est spécialisée dans la commercialisation des fournitures scolaires, de bureau et des ustensiles de cuisine depuis 2 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de devenir une grossiste.
texts.en: This is a group of two persons taking out a solidarity loan. Grâce Yabo, the group’s leader, is 22 years old. Single without children, she has been selling school and office supplies as well as kitchen utensils for over two years. She stocks up at one of the markets of Benin as well as outside of the country. In order to increase her stock capacity and meet high customer demand, she has requested and obtained a microloan from Finadev.
