Gumercinda makes a living selling natural herbs in different markets in the area where she lives, starting very early in the morning.  She also makes a living selling food, which she does later in the day.  She will use this loan to purchase cooking utensils (pots and ladles).  Gumercinda is very happy about the loan, the interest that has been offered, and the confidence that has been placed in her.  She promises to keep improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils (pots and ladles).

loans.name: Juan Ignacio

texts.es: JUAN TIENE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UN HOMBRE CASADO. EL TIENE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO, UBICADO EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO. DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS EL Y SU ESPOSA ATIENDEN EL NEGOCIO EL CUAL TIENEN COMO SU UNICA FUENTE DE INGRESOS. JUAN DESEA PODER HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO DE TIENDA DE ABARROTES, EL CUAL LE HA DADO BUENOS RESULTADOS Y LE HA PERMITIDO CUBRIR CON SUS NECESIADES FAMILIARES. ACTUALMENTE EL VE LA POSIBILIDAD DE HACERLO CREECER, INVIRTIENDOLE EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTO CON LO CUAL EL PUEDA TENER SU NEGOCIO BIEN SURTIDO Y CON MAS VARIEDAD PARA SUS CLIENTES. POR ESTE MOTIVO EL HA SOLICITADO EL PRESTAMO PARA LLEVAR ACABO UNA MAYOR INVERSION EN SU NEGOCIO Y LE PERMITA HACERLO CREECER PARA AUMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS Y ASI PODER OFRECER UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old and married. He has his own business located in his house. For eight years he and his wife have run the business, which is their only source of income. 

Juan would like to be able to make his grocery shop business grow. So far the business has been successful and has allowed him to cover his household expenses. He now sees the potential to make it grow, by investing in the purchase of more merchandise to ensure his shop is well-stocked and has more variety for his customers. 

For this reason he is asking for a loan to make a big investment in his business which will allow him to make it grow, so that he can increase his income and in this way offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR DEMETRIO,  VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD DE  YUNGUILLAS DE LA  PROVINCIA DE MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,  TIENE UN HIJO, DEMETRIO SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA, EN LA ANTERIOR COSECHA HUBO  DESASTRE NATURAL DE HELADA  Y SUS CULTIVOS BAJARON DE RENDIMIENTO, ESTE DESASTRE LE HIZO FRACASAR EN SUS INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS QUE SE MANTENÍAN CON LA PRODUCCIÓN AGRÍCOLA. CADA AÑO PRODUCEN CEBOLLA, ARVEJA   EN SU PEQUEÑA PARCELA. DEMETRIO ES UNA PERSONA  MUY QUERIDA Y RESPETADA EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE, POR LO DEDICADO A SU HIJO  Y SU TRABAJO QUE A VECES HASTA TIENE QUE TRABAJAR EN JORNAL EN LA AGRICULTURA PARA GANAR ALGUNOS PESOS Y ASÍ MANTENER A SUS PEQUEÑO HIJO, EL  ESTÁ SOLICITANDO EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS SEMILLA DE ARVEJA, SEMILLA DE FREJOL Y ABONO ORGANICO Y DE ESTA FORMA MEJORARA LA CALIDAD Y EL RENDIMIENTO DE SUS CULTIVOS, QUE TRABAJA EN SU PEQUEÑA PARCELA QUE TIENE EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE  PARA MEJORAR SUS INGRESO ECONÓMICO Y  DARLE UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SU HIJO Y QUE EL  PUEDA ASISTIR A LA ESCUELA  EN MEJORES CONDICIONES.  EL CRÉDITO AYUDARA MUCHO A SU HIJO Y A EL.
texts.en:
Demetrio lives in the community Yunguillas, the province of Mizque , in the department of Cochabamba.  He has a son. Demetrio is a farmer. During the last harvest there was a natural disaster.  The crops froze and decimated his output. This disaster caused him to lose his income because he supports himself through the harvest production. Every year he produces onions and peas in his small parcel of land. 

Demetrio is a well-loved and respected person in the community where he lives. He is so dedicated to his child and work that he has to do side jobs in agriculture to earn some money to support his small son. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds for peas, seeds for beans, and organic fertilizer. This way he will improve the quality and performance of his crops. He works in a little parcel of land that he owns by his house so he can improve his income and give a better life to his son so he can attend school. The loan would significantly help him and his son.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for peas, beans, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Está casada con Marco quien es padre de sus 2 hijos Vivian de 14 y Marco de 7 años de edad respectivamente. Junto a ellos habita cómodamente su propia casa que logró comprar con su pareja. La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es la venta de gaseosas, cervezas, hielo y jugos envasados, también pone a la venta productos de belleza que ofrece por catálogo y los vende entre sus amistades, familiares y otros clientes eventuales. Muchas veces vende al contado y otras al crédito, hasta el momento ha tenido buenos resultados y conoce muchas personas. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 4 años y lo hace sola. También cuenta con 2 mototaxis los cuales pudo comprarlos con cierto apoyo crediticio, ambos los alquila diariamente por lo cual recibe un pago fijo. Eventualmente vende comida en la vereda de su casa durante los fines de semana.  Le agrada realizar sus negocios pues puede manejar su tiempo libre para atender a sus pequeños hijos a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación para salir adelante, además se siente feliz por los ingresos económicos que le genera su trabajo con los cuales puede apoyar a su pareja a pagar los gastos de su hogar. Le incomoda cuando sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos, pero eso no la desanima. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir trabajando ya que se siente bien y conforme con sus actividades, pues le da la independencia que ella necesita. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos, está comprometida al pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles refaccionará uno de sus mototaxis para que funciones adecuadamente, también comprará un nuevo stock de cosméticos conformado por perfumes, shampoo, acondicionador, talco, lápiz labial, cremas corporales entre otros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33, and a hard-working, determined woman with a great desire to succeed. She is married to Marco, who is the father of her two children, Vivian, 14 and Marco, 7. She lives comfortably with them in her own home, which she and her partner managed to buy. 

The work Elizabeth does is selling soft drinks, beer, ice, and bottled juices. She also sells beauty products that she offers through a catalog, and sells them among her friends, family members, and to other occasional customers. Many times she sells for cash, and other times on credit. 

Up to now, she has has good results and knows many people. She has been doing this work for four years and does it on her own. She also has two mototaxis, that she was able to buy with some loan assistance. She rents out both on a daily basis, for which she receives a fixed payment. 

Occasionally, she sells food on the sidewalk in front of her home during the weekend.  She likes carrying on her businesses,as she can manage her free time to look after her small children, whom she loves very much and who are her motivation for success. In addition, she feels happy about the income her business generates, and with which she is able to help her partner pay the household expenses. 

It bothers her when her customers are behind in paying their credit, but that does not discourage her. Therefore, she has plans to continue working; as she feels good, and is satisfied with her activities, as they give her the independence she needs. 

This is her 13th loan with the MFP institution, so she is grateful to the people who make her loan possible and give her the opportunity to continue working to achieve her objectives. She promises to pay her installments on time and very responsibly. 

With the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles, she will repair one of her mototaxis so that it runs properly. She will also buy a new stock of cosmetics, including perfumes, shampoo, conditioner, powder, lipstick, body creams and other products.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, shampoo, conditioner, powder, lipstick, body creams and other products.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es: La señora Asunta tiene 41 años está casada con el señora Sergio Alba, tienen tres hijos los cuales estudian en una  escuelita de la misma zona donde viven,  la señora Asunta ha sufrido mucho de niña ya que el padre los abandono a  ella y a su madre, y la madre sola ha logro sacarle adelante y ahora la señora Asunta es quien se hace cargo de la madre y le cuida muchísimo. La señora Asunta y su familia viven en la comunidad de la Maica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, gracias a su trabajo y con la ayuda del esposo tienen una casa donde pueden vivir, la principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, el producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos y el esposo se dedica a prestar servicios de mecánica. El destino del crédito es para la construcción de un galpón para alojar el ganado, ya que en la temporada de lluvia sufren los ganados, esto le servirá mucho para la comodidad y el mejor cuidad de su ganado. Es el tercer crédito Kiva que se le está otorgando y la señora Asunta declara que está muy contenta ya que le ayudo mucho en su en la realización de su actividad. Entre sus sueños y metas esta seguir cuidando a su madre hasta la hora de su muerte y que sus hijos estudien una carrera profesional para que de esa manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Asunta is 41 years old and is married to Sergio Alba. They have three children who are studying in a school in the same area where they live. Asunta has suffered a lot as a child; her father abandoned her and her mother, and her single-mother managed to get them ahead. Now Asunta is the one who takes care of her mother and she cares for her very much. Asunta and her family live in the community of Maica in the city of Cochabamba. Thanks to her work and her husband’s help they have a house where they can live. The main business is the production of raw milk. The product is delivered to a company that produces dairy products and her husband provides mechanical services.

The loan is to build a shed to house livestock because in the rainy season the cattle suffer a lot. This will help them a lot with the comfort and the best care of the livestock. This is the third Kiva loan being given and Asunta says she is very happy as this helps a lot in conducting her business. Among her dreams and goals is to continue taking care of her mother until the time of her death and that her children study for a career so that they can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to build a shed for her cows.

loans.name: Venice

texts.en:
Venice, 31, is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with five children, ranging in age from 8 months to 13.

She has been in the fishing business for 10 years working alongside her husband to support their family. The business is doing well. She only encounters challenges when the weather is not suitable for fishing. 

Right now, Venice is requesting a loan to buy fishing net, nylon and rope that's needed for daily fishing. She hopes that with these ready, she and her husband will be more productive. 

Venice hopes she can expand her ventures and earn as much as she can so that she will be able to save and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon and rope.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chairs, tables and kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from a small village in the Kareli district. She is 25 years old, widowed and lives with her parents, sister and two children (7 and 9 years old). Nana’s children get an orphan pension from the local government. They go to the local school. 

The family runs an animal husbandry business with a calf and a milk cow (whose milk is used for dairy production). Nana produces cheese, which is sold locally. In addition, they grow different kinds of cereals on a family-owned land. Nana is very hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.

Nana requested a loan to rent land. Nana will cultivate the land and sow more cereals. The family will do all the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested production will be sold and this will significantly increase the income of the family. 

With the increased income Nana will improve the living conditions of her family and finance the education of her orphaned children. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to rent and cultivate agricultural land.

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is a 31-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been selling mobile phones since 2011. He worked hard to improve his business and increase his available collection to make sure that all his customers' needs are met.

Housam is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the second time. He wants to buy a car to visit wholesale dealers in addition to his family's requests.

Housam's previous loan was used to increase his business capital, which helped a lot in improving his income. 

Housam's customers enjoy dealing with him because he has everything they need (mobiles, accessories and maintenance) in addition to prepaid mobile cards.

loans.use: to buy a car that will help him visit wholesale dealers.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a 35-year-old married woman with two children ages 5 and 7. She and her family live in Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. Paz is engaged in selling home-cooked dishes out of vegetables and meat. She is happy that she has the means to help her husband who works as a laborer. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables and seasoning. 

With her current number of customers, she knows that more variety of menu will help attract more to her services. Paz is hopeful that, through perseverance and hard work, she can improve her business and earn more for the needs of her children, which is her priority. In addition to this, she wants to continually send her children to school and do some reinvesting.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables and seasoning.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is a 43-year-old housewife. Her husband has been doing a business of tailoring for many years. The man shown in the photo is Shamim’s husband. He set up his own business four years ago; he makes menswear like shirts, sherwanies (formal wedding dress), dress pants and every type of uniform, etc. He always works hard to support his family. 

Shamim with her family lives in a small village of Faisalabad. She has four children. She requested a loan of amount 30,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs) for her husband’s business growth. In this way, he would be able to purchase raw materials such as threads, fabric, needles, buttons and other relevant accessories that ultimately help in providing better services to his customers without delay. He hopes to earn more income that he wishes to utilize on his family's well-being and for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as threads, fabric, needles, buttons and other relevant accessories.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 32 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s single and has three children between 2 and 12 years old who live at home and are in school. For the past eight years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, fish, etc., for her business. She hopes to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, fish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Flor Angela

texts.es:
Flor trabajó durante 25 años en la actividad de la confección, y luego se retiró de la empresa donde trabajó porque ya no contaba con las fuerzas para ir hasta la empresa todos los días. Por eso fue que decidió montar su taller de confección en la casa con unos pequeños ahorros y esforzarse mucho para sacarlo adelante. Hasta el momento ha podido ir superando sus dificultades de capital, pero como en el momento no tiene el dinero suficiente para una máquina, Flor está en busca de un préstamo para comprar una máquina recubridora para poder tener una confección de mejor calidad. 

Su sueño es poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y también terminar de construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Flor worked as a seamstress for 25 years. She retired from the company where she worked because she did not have the strength to travel to her job each day. For this reason, she decided to establish a sewing workshop in her home with some savings and has worked hard to move her business forward. So far Flor has been able to overcome difficulties with capital, but now she does not have sufficient funds to buy a piece of equipment.

Flor is requesting a loan in order to buy a cover-stitch machine so that she can produce items of better quality. Her dreams are to have a better quality of life and to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy a cover-stitch machine.

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.ru: Холнисо очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 44 года, замужем и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Она имеет более чем 16 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается куплей продажей рыбы. Она продает рыбу на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для того, чтобы купить рыбу для продажи. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kholniso is a very hard-working woman. She is 44 years old, married and bringing up for children. She has over 16 years of experience in this business. She buys fish for resale. She sells her fish at the local market. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS in order to buy fish for resale. She is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedoras con éxitos, don Dámaso  Abba de 56 años el cual se dedica a la comercialización de maíz, frijoles y cultiva estos productos, esta actividad la viene iniciando desde hace 10 años.
El crédito lo utilizara en el acopio de maíz, frijoles, y la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, abonos para la cosechas
texts.en:
This group is formed by three successful entrepreneurial partners. Damaso Abba is 56 and sells corn, beans and also grows these crops, he has done this activity for 10 years.
The loan will be used to buy corn, beans and to buy post harvest fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans and to buy post harvest fertilizer.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina de 50 años de edad, vive en Cochabamba es divorciada de lo cual tiene 5 hijos que 4 dependen de ella, estudio hasta el nivel primario es una persona humilde y trabajadora ella se dedica  a la venta de comida desde tempranas horas se levanta para poder cocinar para poder vender en su negocio le ayudan sus hijos en lo que puedan ya que sus hijos estudia en la Universidad Ricardina  se hace cargo ya que su ex esposo no le ayuda con los gastos familiares, su hijo el mayor le ayuda con algunos gastos que se pueda. El presente crédito que solicita Ricardina es para la compra muebles y mercaderia de comida ya que no tiene capital y necesita para poder ampliar un poco mas su negocio de comida y poder generar un poco mas de sus ingresos y para poder seguir pagando sus estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ricardina is 50 years old and lives in Cochabamba. She is divorced and has five children, four of whom are dependent on her. Ricardina studied through elementary school and is a modest and hardworking individual. She earns her living by selling food.

During the early morning hours, Ricardina wakes up so that she can begin cooking for her business. Her children help her whenever they can since they are studying at the university. Ricardina took charge since her ex-husband does not help with the family expenses. Her oldest son helps with some of the expenses that he is able to pay.

The current loan Ricardina is requesting will be used to buy furniture and food supplies since she does not have the capital. She needs to expand her business a bit more in order to generate some more income so that she can continue paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy furniture and supplies for her food stand.

loans.name: Ramos

texts.es: Aunque por muchos años Ramos ha tenido una relación muy estrecha con el cultivo de café fue hasta hace 5 años que se comenzó a dedicar a producirlo debido a un terreno que le fue heredado por su padre y su tio. Ramos combina sus labores de cafeticultor con su trabajo en el área de logística en un beneficio de café y para que esto sea posible él contrata a jornaleros que se encargan de ayudarlo a realizar las labores propias del campo y de esta manera también ayuda a la economía familiar de las personas que contrata. La producción anual de Ramos actualmente es de 2.5 toneladas pero sabe que con la extensión de terreno que cuenta es suficiente para llegar a producir hasta 4 toneladas anuales y por eso ha renovado mucha de su planta para que en un lapso de 3 años pueda alcanzar su meta. Él necesita comprar fertilizante y hacer labores de limpieza y conservación de sus parcelas y para eso necesita de un crédito. Ramos quiere hacer que sus fincas produzcan más para que en el futuro se las pueda dejar a sus hijos para que ellos las trabajen.
texts.en:
Although for many years Ramos has had a very close relationship with coffee growing, it was only five years ago that he began to produce it, due to a piece of land he inherited from his father and uncle.

Ramos combines his work as a coffee grower with his job in logistics for a coffee processing plant. To make this possible, he hires day laborers who are responsible for helping him to carry out the farm work; this way he also helps the family finances of the people he hires. 

Ramos' annual production is 2.5 tons, but he knows that with the area of land he has, there is enough to achieve an output of up to 4 tons annually. That is why he has greatly renewed his plantation, so that within a period of three years, he can reach his goal. 

He needs to buy fertilizer and do clearing and maintenance work on his parcels of land, and that is why he needs a loan. Ramos wants to have his parcels  produce more, so that in the future he can leave them to his children, so that they can work them.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and clear his parcels of land.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 44 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa, located in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has 8 children, 4 of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ben has been working hard to manage his clothing store, where he sells items such as dresses, suits and shoes. 

To help expand his business, Ben has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more clothes, suits, sandals and caps. This increased inventory will bring in more customers, which will help Ben to generate greater profits. Ben hopes that he will be able to become a wholesaler in the future. 

Ben is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small-business entrepreneurs like Ben who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who own businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, suits, sandals and caps

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña María Lourdes microempresaria de éxitos que tiene una pulpería desde hace 19 años  en su domicilio. Ella lleva varios créditos con la institución y le han servido para mejorar y ampliar su negocio
Este crédito lo utilizara para compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, pollo, frijoles etc. con el propósito de seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is a successful micro-entrepreneur that's had a convenience store at home for 19 years.  She's had several loans with the institution that have helped her improve and expand her business.
This loan will be used to buy rice, oil, sugar, chicken, beans etc with the purpose to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to by rice, beans, sugar, oil, dog food, chicken, beef.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en: Bindu is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s married to a businessman and has three children between the ages of  12 and 23. They are attending school and live at home. For the past 13 years, Bindu has been selling used clothes. She enjoys the buying, because she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to resell. She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Weyatta

texts.en:
Weyatta is 45 years old and married with three children, ages 14 to 25. She runs a local food stand business in Kandehtown Southern area Bo District in Sierra Leone. As a housewife, she started this business to raise income to take care of the home.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells rice, palm oil, gari and groundnut at the market area. Her business is the only income she has. She describes her main problem as low purchasing power of customers. 

Weyatta requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase rice, palm oil, gari, and groundnut. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her Children. In the future, she would like to improve her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil, gari, and groundnut.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 43 years old, married and lives in Buchanan. She completed her education at grade 12. For the past 10 years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She established this business with small loans from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mowafak

texts.en:
Mowafak is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Mowafak owns a small library. He specializes in photocopying. He established his business in 2007, and he has now one employee and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a generator and make signage for the shop. He also wants to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and make signage for the shop. He also wants to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Luz Benigna

texts.es:
Doña Luz microempresaria de éxito y emprendedora es dueña de una pulpería ,vende leña y ropa nueva desde hace 4 años, lleva varios préstamos y estos le han ayudado a que su negocio vaya creciendo y diversificando sus productos para ofrecerles mejor a sus clientes.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y productos de pulperías como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas etc.
texts.en:
Luz is a successful micro-entrepreneur that has owned a convenience store for four years, she sells fire wood and new clothing, she's had several loans that have helped grow and diversify the business and the products offered to better serve her clients.
The loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing and store products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy varied new clothing and products such as basic grains like rice and beans, sugar, detergent, soap.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children who both go to school. She also takes care of her grandmother, father, and brother. 

Victo sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 2 years and works six days a week. Victo has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. 

Victo's major business challenges are transportation, the ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to rent one large shop where she can operate her business, and to start importing used clothes. She lives in a rented house where her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Ekram

texts.en:
Ekram is a 56-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Since 2005, she has operated a convenience store selling beverages, sweets and many other requested goods, in addition to selling clothes.
In the beginning, Ekram faced slight difficulties since her customers are only her area neighbors which limits her expansion.
Ekram applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital by increasing her store inventory with special offer products in addition to selling a special autumn clothes collection. She hopes that through this loan, she will be capable of improving her business which will increase her income and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to increase her business capital by increasing her store inventory with special offer products, in addition to offering a special autumn clothes collection.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who doesn’t go to school. She has one additional family member, a brother. She sells passion fruit juice, soda and other soft drinks at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years.  She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from farming. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy crates of soda, passion fruit, watermelon and pineapples to make juice. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a deep freezer so as to start supplying more cold drinks to different people and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, passion fruit, watermelon and pineapples to make juice.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 38 years old, and he is a resident of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with two children, ages 6 and 13. Vicente uses his motorcycle to earn an income for his family. He transports passengers with his habal-habal (a motorcycle used to transport passengers). Vicente has been in this business for five years now. 

He is asking for a loan to buy gasoline and a spare tire so he can use his motorcycle effectively. He is determined to send his children to school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and a spare tire.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 11; they all live together and her children are attending school.

For the past six years, she has been selling used clothes. Sometimes her customers buy on credit and refuse to pay. She started this business with 5,000 Liberian dollars, which was given to her by her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She hopes to build a shop and a house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old. She is from Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. She is married with two young sons, ages 4 and 6.

Ana sells vegetables in the city proper in order to generate an income for her family. She also raises chickens for additional revenue. 

Ana is asking for a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables like eggplant, squash, string beans, bamboo shoots and bitter gourd. She works hard so that she can provide for her children's needs. The loan means a lot to her. 

In the future, she hopes to have a better location in the city where she can display her vegetables for better sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like eggplant, squash, string beans, bamboo shoots and bitter gourd.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 33 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has two children aged 13 and 17 who are in school and live at home. 

For the past 13 years, she has been operating a table where she sells used clothes. She has a lot of customers, and she makes a lot of money, which is helping her to look after her children. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is employed. Hamza owns a car repair shop. He specializes in providing spare parts for cars. He established his business in 2000, and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting $2,000 on loan to expand his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to expand his car repair shop

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 46 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They have ten children, ages 7 to 30 years old. Eight children live at home and two are married. For the past five years, she has been operating a little table where she sells pepper, bitter ball, onion, etc. Oretha started this business with 1,500 Liberian dollars. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, bitter ball, onion and other items for her business. Oretha plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, bitter ball, onion and other items for her business

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rió Abajo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno y de esta forma genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia. También se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas y legumbres.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar semillas mejoradas para poder ofrecer mejores hortalizas y legumbres a la venta, ya que desea tener otros ingresos por el cultivo para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Víctor, es construir su casa para brindar más comodidad a su familia ya que sus hijos necesitan su espacio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Víctor is married and has two children who are of school age. They live in their own home that consists of only one room made of adobe walls and a dirt floor. The house is located in the District of Rió Abajo in the city of La Paz.

Víctor currently raises and sells cattle in order to generate income for covering expenses, such as food and basic services for his family. He also grows vegetables and legumes. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy improved seeds so that he can offer better vegetables and legumes to sell. Víctor wants to generate additional profits from his crops so that he can improve his income.

His dreams include building a house that will provide more comfort for his family since his children need their own space. This will also improve their quality of life. This is the first time Víctor has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetable and legume seeds.

loans.name: Zouher

texts.en:
Zouher is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 30 years old. He is married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Zouher owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2004 and now he has two employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting $2,400 as a youth loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store

loans.name: Maria Lucelly

texts.es:
Maria anteriormente tenía su tienda general en otro local que era arrendado, y como hace unos días se lo pidieron, tuvo que dejar todo y comenzar de nuevo con el negocio en un local diferente y ubicado en un sector diferente. Esto le ha traído grandes inconvenientes principalmente en la parte de las ventas, pues el ser nueva en el sector y no conocer los clientes le evitan tener mejores ventas. Sin embargo, con mucho esfuerzo ha venido sacando su negocio adelante y debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de la canasta familiar y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder posicionar su negocio y tener unas mejores ventas para ofrecer en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria previously had a general store at another location that was rented. A few days before her lease expired, she was asked to move everything and had to start her business over in a new location in a different neighborhood. This resulted in great difficulties in making sales since her business was new to the area and she did not know the local customers well enough to improve her sales activity. Nonetheless, she was able to move her business forward through hard work even though she does not have sufficient capital.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy an inventory of household products and offer greater variety to her customers. Her dream is to position her business for better sales so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of household products for her store.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
This is Agatha. She is 50 years old, married, and has two children who are 24 and 27 years old. She runs a pharmacy business in Kandeh town, located in the southern area of Bo District in Sierra Leone.

She has been in this business for 7 years, and sells pharmaceutical products like oral hydration salt (ORS), malaria drugs, and blood syrup. Her business is the only income she has. Agatha's business is doing well; her pharmacy sales help her save her community from cholera disease.    

Agatha requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more medical drugs such as oral hydration salt (ORS), malaria drugs and blood syrup. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children. In the future, she would like to own a big clinic. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs for her pharmacy business

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Corazón de Jesús es un banco comunal conformado por 11 socias y 1 socio que viven en diferentes lugares de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que es una mezcla de una arquitectura antigua y moderna, está rodeada por varios paisajes que le dan un toque especial gracias a su geografía accidentada, en esta parroquia se puede observar la colorida vestimenta de su gente ya que en especial las personas mayores mantienen la vestimenta tradicional que es una pollera (vestidos), blusa y sombrero. Su gente es trabajadora como nuestras socias que laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades económicas como son la crianza de animales, la agricultura, el comercio y muchas han migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos siendo su mayor orgullo conservarlas.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosario, conforma el banco comunal Corazón de Jesús desde hace 6 años, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 23, 19, 16 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan le económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja en varias actividades como es en la albañilería y carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María Rosario la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y cría animales como cerdos, pollos y cuyes que los vende en su comunidad. Trabaja solo 3 días a la semana como empleada domestica sin un horario y también cultiva sus terrenos, lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cerdos y en el alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es  tener un galpón de pollos más grande y crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Corazon de Jesus is a community bank formed by 12 members that live in different places of the district of Valle en Cuenca, the district has an architectural style mix between the antique and the modern, it is surrounded by landscapes that make it special thanks to its rugged geography, in this town you can see the colorful clothing of its people, particularly elders have kept their traditional dress which is a “pollera” (dress), shirt and hat.  The people are hardworking like the members that work everyday in different economic activities such as raising livestock, agriculture and commerce.  Many of them have emigrated looking for better work opportunities but still maintain the culture and traditions of its people and priding themselves in keeping these traditions.
One of the members of the group is Maria Rosario who's been part of the community bank for 6 years, she is 40, married and has four children ages 23, 19, 16 and 12, her two oldest work and help her financially, her two youngest study at a local school.  Her husband works on several activities such as construction and carpentry, they don't own a house thus they rent.
Maria Rosario spends most of her time doing housework and raising livestock such as pigs, chicken and “cuyes” (guinea pigs) that she sells in the community.  She only works three days per week as a domestic employee with no set schedule and she also seeds her land and consumes what's harvested.
Her loan will be invested in buying pigs and feed for livestock.  Her goal is to have a larger amount of chickens and grow this business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for livestock.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Desde hace más de veinte años Eusebio se ha dedicado a la agricultura y su principal cultivo es el café, actividad que aprendió a realizar al lado de sus padres, quienes más tarde le heredaron una parcela para que pudiera trabajarla cuando se casó. Él y su esposa Tolentina tienen cuatro hijos y para poder sacar adelante a su familia Eusebio trabaja también como maniobrista en un benefició de café. En la cosecha pasada la producción de Eusebio fue de cinco toneladas y para la siguiente cosecha el necesita comprar fertilizantes y realizar labores de limpieza en su parcela y por eso solicita un crédito. De esta forma podrá aumentar su producción y tiene como meta comprar un nuevo terreno. La mayor preocupación de Eusebio y su esposa es que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria pues las oportunidades de trabajo son cada vez más escasas.
texts.en: For more than twenty years, Eusebio has worked in agriculture. His principal crop is coffee. He learned this activity from working at the side of his parents, who later bequeathed him a parcel of land so that he could work it when he married. He and his wife Tolentina have four children, and to be able to raise his family, Eusebio also works as a loader at a coffee processor. In the last harvest, Eusebio's production was five tons, and for the next harvest he needs to buy fertilizers and do cleaning work on his parcel of land. For this reason, he is applying for a loan. In this way he will increase his production, and he has a goal of buying a new plot of land. The greatest concern of Eusebio and his wife is that their children be able to study for a university degree, since the opportunities for work are increasingly scarce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and clean his land

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is a 42-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and daughter. All of her children are studying in school.  

She and her husband have owned a fast food business for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. Now for the further growth of their business, Najma, as a member of an eight-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some crockery and chairs for her fast food business. 

As their family expenditures are much higher as compared to their monthly income and savings, she wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit amount. As a result, they can increase their monthly income as well as savings. Her dreams are for the higher education of her children. And she is very much thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase some crockery and chairs for the fast food business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has six children. He is the only provider for the family. His brother, who is employed, lives with him.
 
Hasan owns a small grocery store, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He has acquired this profession by working with his father for several years. He established his business in 1992, and now he has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make renovations to the exterior of her house.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertence al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de auto partes de automoviles ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia cuenta con local donde vende su mercaderia a todos sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra llantas para su negocio.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank “Todos Unidos” (everyone united) she still has her business of auto parts sales, she has been in this business for years because she does well thanks to the effort she puts in every day into her business, the member has a store where she sells her merchandise to the clients that need it, she is a responsible and hardworking person and this business helps her get her family ahead.
She requests the loan to buy tires for her business.

loans.use: to buy tires for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the delivery truck for his business

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena lives in Buchanan. She is married and has two children, aged 2 and 6; both of them are in school and live at home.

She stopped school at 11th grade. For the past five years, she has been selling from a table at the market such items as oil, onion, soap, pepper and salt. She started this business with the sum of 3,000 Liberian dollars that she was lent from her mother. Some problem she is facing is few commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, onion, soap, pepper and salt for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save. Her plan is to build her house and become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onion, soap, pepper and salt for her business.

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita is 44 years old. She is from the community of Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. She is married with one son who is 14 years old. 

Crestita is dependent for her livelihood on preparing and collecting firewood to sell. It is not an easy business since she really has to work hard to reach places where she can find firewood that she can dry and sell for a profit. 

She is asking for a loan to be used for the transportation expense of the firewood that she delivers and to buy more dried fish that she can resell for a profit. Crestita is hoping that through the loan, she can continue to support her son's education and give him a better future.

loans.use: to transport firewood and buy dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Juan Marcelo

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Macelo tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, ejerce la profesión de Abogado hace más de 2 años, actualmente el cliente vive con su conyugue en la casa de sus padres quienes les ayudan moral y económicamente quienes además de brindarles una vivienda son ellos además los que cubren con los gastos de servicios básicos y de alimentación, es así que solicitan el crédito para poder implementar y mejorar el aspecto de su lugar de trabajo (Bufete) e tal forma que puedan dar un mejor aspecto y prestar más eficientemente su labor como abogado, ya que con el crédito creen mejorar sus ingresos y de esa  forma superarse y crecer ya que tiene muchas aspiraciones, deseos  y de esa forma mejorar  su nivel de vida, puesto que con el crédito será más fácil avanzar en el sueño que quiere lograr,  además de sentirse más satisfecho de haber logrado lo que quiso.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Marcelo is 28 years old, married, and has been a practicing lawyer for more than two years. He and his wife currently live in the home of his parents, who provide them with moral and financial support. In return for providing them a home, Juan and his wife cover the cost of basic services and food.

Juan is requesting a loan so that he can equip and improve the space where he practices law so that it will have a better appearance and help him be more efficient in his work as an attorney. This loan will help to improve his income so that he can excel and grow in his many aspirations. As a result, he will be able to improve his standard of living. The loan will also make it easier for him to accomplish his dream and become more satisfied in whatever he accomplishes.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his law office.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man. He has been working to manufacture aluminum closets, windows and doors since 2004. In June 2006, Mohamad started his own business and worked hard on improving and developing it. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the fourth time. Unlike the previous loans that were used to improve and expand his business, this one is to pay for his marriage legal documents and to finish pasting tiles in his house.

He has every Palestinian's dream of living in Lebanon to improve his life, expand his business and provide his family with a caring and loving life.

His honesty with his customers gave him the market's trust and support. He is working hard on including the glass in his business, which will be a good step towards a wider market.

He is looking forward to his new life and for this important step he is going to take.

loans.use: To pay for his marriage legal documents and to finish pasting tiles in his house.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is from Iraq. She is 48 years old, married and has eight children. Her husband is employed, and she helps him with the family income.

Leila is a seamstress. She always wanted to have her own tailoring project and in 2010, she opened her small business. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $1,500 loan to buy a sewing machine. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
La señora Hortensia solicita el préstamo para invertir en compra de ropa de invierno, ya que le esta haciendo falta y sus clientes le están solicitando ya este tipo de mercancía.
La señora Hortensia se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y artículos desde hace más de cinco años, en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más variedad de mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes y le sigan comprando a ella. Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito y que su esposo el señor Mario se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos niñas quienes estudian una en la primaria y la otra cursa el secundaria,  con el sueldo que recibe por cuidar un rancho.
texts.en: Hortensia requests a loan to invest in the purchase of winter clothing, because she needs it and her clients are requesting it.  Hortensia's activity for more than five years is the sale of used clothing and other items, she sells in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo.  She wants the business to have more variety of merchandise to offer her clients so they continue to buy from her.  With the profits she will repay the loan.  Her husband Mario takes care of the family expenses and the education expenses of their two daughters who are in elementary school and junior high school with the salary he receives from working at a ranch.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for sale.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS,el socio continua con su negocio de venta de repuestos de automoviles,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio cuenta con un local donde vende su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su negocio.
texts.en: The member belongs to the community bank “Todos Unidos” (everyone united), he continues with his business of auto repair parts sales, he has been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort he puts in each day to his business, he has a store where he sells merchandise to his clients, he is responsible and hardworking and this activity helps him get his family ahead.  The member requests a loan to buy tires for his business.

loans.use: to buy tires for his business.

loans.name: Aura Estella

texts.es:
Bondadosa es la mejor manera para poder describir a la señora Aura, a quien su esposo hace 18 años sufrió un accidente cerebro vascular y desde entonces ha quedado en la cama y a ella le toca brindarle todos los cuidados necesarios. Además, como era su esposo quien generaba los ingresos para el hogar, Aura tuvo que comenzar a buscar alternativas para generar recursos y poder seguir sosteniendo su hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Fue así como montó un taller de confección en su casa aprovechando que ya tenía conocimientos de esta actividad, y se dedica principalmente a elaborar manualidades y con esto brinda los recursos económicos para el hogar. Como no cuenta con un capital que le permita responder a unos pedidos que tiene, Aura busca un préstamo que le permita comprar insumos como telas e hilos para fabricar las manualidades y responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos y continuar cuidando de su esposo quien no se puede mover de la cama.
texts.en:
Kindhearted is the best way to describe Sra. Aura. Her husband suffered from a stroke 18 years ago and has been bedridden ever since. Aura does everything necessary to take care of him. Since her husband was the breadwinner, she had to begin finding ways to generate income required to maintain the home where she lives with her husband and two children. This led to the establishment of a sewing workshop in her home so that she could take advantage of her knowledge and skills in this area. Aura mostly produces handicrafts and uses the income she generates to maintain her home.

She does not have the capital required to fulfill her existing orders, so Aura is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as fabrics and thread, for making handicrafts. This will enable her to complete her customers’ orders. Her dream is to help her two children move forward and continue caring for her husband since he is not able to get out of bed.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 37 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They have four children between the ages of 3 and 16; all of them are attending school and live at home.

For the past 16 years, she has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She plans to be a big businesswoman and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Nehmiye

texts.en:
Nehmiye is from Iraq. She is 47 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is employed, and she helps him with the family income.

Nehmiye owns a women's clothing shop. She specializes in selling and renting wedding and evening dresses. She is been in this business since 2011. She has a good reputation, and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi town in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 18 years and 26 years. One of her children is currently attending school. 

In 1997, Mamie established her palm oil business. She began her business to improve her life and to have a permanent source of income. She works at the business 13 hours a day, seven day per week. She describes her main challenges as transportation costs and price inflation. 

Mamie requires a loan in order to increase her business with more gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open a palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Ma. Febrica

texts.en:
Ma. Febrica is 57 years old. She is from Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. She is married with four children; three are adults, and the youngest is 17.  

Ma. Febrica is a midwife by profession, and she also owns and operates a small drugstore. Her business is within the health center where she works, providing her customers with affordable but quality medicines. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more medicines for her drugstore. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger drugstore that will provide a better service and affordable medicines to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for her drugstore.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 22 years. He is married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family. His brother, who is employed, lives with him.

Safaa owns a carpentry business. He has acquired this profession by working with his father for several years. In 2005, he established his own carpentry shop. He now has one employee and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn and her nine-year-old daughter live in the town of Antequera, Bohol where she makes and weaves baskets for an income. She also raises hogs for a profit. She has been struggling to provide for her child because she is not earning much income from her business due to limited capital. Marlyn is asking for a loan to buy feed, nylon, buri and rattan. The availability of the needed materials will help Marlyn to be more productive in her basket making business and to produce fattened hogs.  A successful business will allow her to buy food for her family and send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, nylon, buri and rattan

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He is the only provider for the family. 

Houssein owns a grocery store which sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He has acquired this profession by working as an employee in grocery stores. He established his business in 2010 and now he has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Falah

texts.en:
Falah is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Falah owns a shop for children's clothing. He also sells fragrances. He established his own business in 2006. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate the shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Sajjad

texts.en:
Sajjad is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 26 years, married, and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Sajjad owns a small grocery store which sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2007 and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3000 as a Youth loan to buy 2 refrigerators. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2 refrigerators.

loans.name: Hasime

texts.en:
Hasime is a fifty-one-year-old Egyptian woman who is married with five children and all of them live in a village in northern Albania. Her children range between 12 and 25 years old and two of them are still going to school. Most of the time, members of the Egyptian community live in the cities and the outskirts of major cities; yet Hasime chose to live in a village and engage in agricultural activity. She has been doing this for the past 22 years and has made a good earning all along. 

Hasime is now applying for a loan for the first time because she wants to prepare the soil for fall planting. In addition to the land she owns, last year she rented some from others and wants to plant it as well. She plants crops such as grains, potatoes and onions. 

Hasime is very proud of herself because she is doing something different from others in her community.

loans.use: To prepare the soil for seasonal planting

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 61 years old. She is married with two grown children. She is from Maribojoc, Bohol. She works very hard in her hog-raising business to sell hogs for a profit to help provide for her family. 

At this time, Cirila lacks the funds needed to purchase more feed and supplements to fatten her hogs. With a loan she will be able to purchase more quality feed and supplements so she can grow healthy hogs that will attract more buyers. The loan will enable her to expand her business and increase her income. With the additional income, Cirila will be able to provide for her household's basic needs and save for a future use.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor  Javier es nacido en la comunidad de Minas Pampa de la provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente vive en su comunidad con su familia y su esposa y sus seis hijos menores, la descripción de su casa está construido de barro con techo de teja con revoques de barro la determinación es rustico prácticamente, la comunidad del cliente esta a 4 km al este de la localidad de Tiraque. La actividad económica es la agricultura que produce tubérculos y cereales, la producción es estacional en la zona son alturas del valle alto. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de abono de gallina y semilla de papa, el cliente tiene interés de superarse sus ingresos económicos en los próximos años, los trabajos agrícolas lo realizan toda la familia en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos para la siembra y la cosecha los labores culturales trabajan la familia.
texts.en: Javier was born in the community of Minas Pampa in the province of Tiraque of the Department of Cochabamba. He currently lives in his community with his family, his wife and six young children. The description of his home would be that it is made out of mud with a tiled roof and mud plastering. The home assessment would be that it is practically rustic. The client's community is 4 km to the east of the town of Tiraque. The main economic activity is agriculture which produces root vegetables and cereals. The production is seasonal in the high zones of the high valley. The loan Javier is requesting is to purchase hen manure and potato seeds. The client has an interest in increasing his income in the next years. The agricultural workload is undertaken by the whole family and in some cases with the help of neighbors for the sowing and the harvest, the cultural labor is done by the family.

loans.use: to purchase hen manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma describes herself as a hardworking and honest person who does not fear any challenge. She is a married mother of three children, whom she has been able to take through school. She has been running a fish-selling business for the past five years, selling from her home to the neighbors. Fatuma sells different types of fish, and her customers like her because she provides a variety for them to choose. Recently, there has been a demand for fish and she does not want to fail her regular customers. The problem is that she does not have enough capital to restock her business. 

With this investment from the requested loan, she will be able to purchase more fish and frying pans. This way she is sure to have good results out of it.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and frying pans.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 52 years old, from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with seven children ages 15-31. Irenea is engaged in an eatery business where she cooks vegetables and meat for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy kitchen utensils like plates, forks and spoons, as well as seasoning, meat and vegetables. 

Irenea is optimistic that a loan will come a long way in helping her to be more stable in her business. In the future, she hopes to have another business so she can provide for the needs of her children, especially their education.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils like plates, forks and spoons, as well as seasoning, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, 44, is a divorced mother of seven children. She sells fish in one of the busy markets in the township. She has had the business for several years and has acquired much experience that makes it possible for her to earn higher profits. She has a large, regular clientele because people prefer her because of the quality of her fish, their variety, her good prices, and above all for the excellent service. Amina always has a smile that she cannot hide, making her liked by many people.

Amina is a woman who is dedicated to her work and determined to get ahead. She strives daily to reach success. She carries her box daily and sets it in her regular position. At times her daughter helps her in the selling when she has other activities to do. She is asking for this loan to buy more stock of fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio es productor de café orgánico desde hace muchos años. Durante varias generaciones su familia se ha dedicado a esta actividad así que desde pequeño comenzó a aprender todo lo relacionado con este cultivo. Durante la última cosecha Porfirio tuvo una producción de 9 toneladas las cuales entregó a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que fueran procesadas y exportadas. Porfirio necesita comprar nueva planta para resembrar parte de sus fincas pues muchas de las que tiene ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida y ya no tienen un buen rendimiento. También necesita hacerle algunas reparaciones a su camioneta que utiliza para el trabajo Para eso él necesita un crédito el cual va a pagar al final de la cosecha. Las nuevas plantas que siembre estarán produciendo café en dentro de tres años. Porfirio tiene instalaciones para una granja de cerdos y pasando la cosecha le gustaría poder echarla a andar.
texts.en:
Porfirio has been an organic coffee producer for many years. Several generations of his family have engaged in this business, so at a young age he began learning everything related to growing coffee. During his last harvest, Porfirio produced nine tons of coffee that was delivered to Unión Regional de Huatusco for processing and export.

Porfirio needs to buy new plants to replenish parts of his farm. Many of his existing plants have either completed their life cycle or did not produce very well. He also needs to make a few repairs to the truck that he uses for his work. Porfirio is in need of a loan that he will repay at the end of his harvest. The new plants that will be sowed will begin producing coffee in three years. Porfirio also has facilities for raising pigs. When he is not spending time with his harvest, Porfirio enjoys relaxing and going for walks.

loans.use: to acquire new coffee plants and to pay for repairs to his truck.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 49 years old and lives in Air port. She stopped her education at 2nd grade, is married and has 11 children between the ages of 10 and 34, two of them in school and all of them at home. 

Nancy received money from her husband to start her business. For fifteen years she has been involved in business but currently she sells used clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: LA SRA. MARIA TIENE 57 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA ES UNA MUJER CASADA. VIVE DE SU NEGOCIO PROPIO QUE TIENE EN SU CASA, MANEJA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU COLONIA, ES UN NEGOCIO CON EL CUAL LE HA IDO MUY BIEN, YA QUE HA PODIDO SOLVENTAR SUS GASTOS PERSONALES Y LOS DE SU FAMILIA GRACIAS A SU TIENDA. ACTUALMENTE MARIA Y SU ESPOSO HAN VISTO EN SU HOGAR LA NECESIDAD DE AMPLIAR Y REMODELAR SU BAÑO. ES POR ESTA RAZON ELLOS SOLICITAN UN CREDITO PARA MEJORAR SU CASA Y REALIZAR LOS TRABAJOS DE REMODELACION NECESARIOS EN SU BAÑO.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a 57-year-old married woman. She lives in her own home and manages a grocery business in her neighborhood. Maria has done very well in her business. She has been able to cover her personal expenses and those of her family as a result of her store.

At the moment, Maria and her husband need to expand and remodel the bathroom in their home. For this reason, they are requesting a home improvement loan so that they can pay for the necessary renovations to their bathroom.

loans.use: to expand and remodel the bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación  de ladrillo, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche como chofer propietario de un taxi, ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general y del motor de su vehículo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos y necesita algunos arreglos.
El sueño de Jhonny es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse ya que desea tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jhonny is single and has no children. He lives at his parents’ home which consists of a single room made of brick. The house is located in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

Jhonny currently works more than eight hours a day and into the late hours of the evening as a taxi driver. Through his work, he is able to pay for expenses such as food and basic services. The loan he is requesting will be used for general vehicle maintenance and an engine tune-up since his vehicle is his only source of income and in need of a few repairs.

Jhonny’s dream is to improve his earnings and become independent. He wants to become more comfortable and have a better quality of life. This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for general maintenance and an engine tune-up for his taxi.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora, que al verse obligada de generar los recursos económicos para su hogar se le despertó el espíritu emprendedor y montó su propio almacén de venta de productos de uso personal. Las grandes dificultades económicas que le trajeron el ser madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 4 hijos luego de que su esposo la abandonaran, hicieron que tuviera que idearse la forma de salir adelante, es por esto que sin contar con mucho capital, ha tenido un gran esfuerzo que le sirve para salir adelante y superar las adversidades. Como se acerca la temporada de amor y amistad, Maria busca un préstamo para surtir su negocio con productos que le permitan aumentar sus ventas en la época de amor y amistad, además de hacer algunas adecuaciones en el local para exhibir mejor la mercancía.

Su sueño es poder sacar adelante sus 4 hijos ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida y también tramitar los papeles del divorcio con el padre de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking individual. When she was obligated to generate income for her household, the entrepreneurial spirit woke up in her. She established her own shop where she sells personal use products. Being a single mother with four children, Maria had to deal with great financial challenges after her husband abandoned her. She had to devise a way of moving forward, which explains why she does not have much capital. Through hard work, she is determined to succeed and overcome adversity.

Since Valentine’s Day in Colombia (also known as the “Day of Love and Friendship”) is approaching, Maria is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business with products to increase her sales during this holiday. In addition, she will make a few renovations to her shop so that she can display her merchandise better.

Her dream is to move forward and provide her four children a better quality of life. Maria will also file for a divorce from the father of her children.

loans.use: to buy Valentine's Day merchandise and to pay for a few renovations to her shop.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: ELEUTERIO TIENE 48 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE A 28 KILÓMETROS DE LA CIUDAD, LA LOCALIDAD SE LLAMA PILANCHO, SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE SERVICIOS ES ALBAÑIL. TRABAJA EN CONSTRUCCIÓN EN DIFERENTES PROVINCIAS Y LA CIUDAD, ASIMISMO TIENE VAQUITAS DE LAS CUALES TRES ESTÁN EN PRODUCCIÓN Y UNA ESTÁ PREÑADA, ENTREGA LECHE A UNA RESCATISTA PARA LA ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE LECHE Y QUESILLOS EN LA LOCALIDAD DE SACABA CERCA DE SU COMUNIDAD, TAMBIÉN SIEMBRA PAPA Y COMERCIALIZA EN LA PLAZA DE PAPAS DE SACABA UNA VEZ AL AÑO.  ELEUTERIO TUVO UN PRIMER CRÉDITO KIVA EN AGOSTO DEL 2010 CRÉDITO SOLICITADO PARA LA CONSTRUCCIÓN Y MEJORAMIENTO DE HABITACIONES EN SU VIVIENDA PORQUE ESTABA CONSOLIDANDO UNA FAMILIA, ÉL ESTÁ MUY AGRADECIDO CON ESTE CRÉDITO PORQUE LE DIO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE MEJORAR SU HÁBITAT Y BRINDARLE A SU PAREJA UN MEJOR ESPACIO PARA LA VIDA FAMILIAR.  ACTUALMENTE ESTÁ CRECIENDO EN SU ACTIVIDAD DE SERVICIOS Y QUIERE COMPRARSE UNA MEZCLADORA MUY NECESARIA PARA LA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA Y ASÍ RECIBIR CONTRATOS DE OBRA VENDIDA,  POR ESO ESTÁ SOLICITANDO ESTE SEGUNDO CRÉDITO, TIENEN UNA HIJA DE AÑO Y MEDIO DE EDAD, ESTÁ MUY CONTENTO PORQUE HA FORMADO SU FAMILIA HACE DOS AÑOS Y QUIERE MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA PARA EL FUTURO TAMBIÉN DE ELLOS.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 48 years old and lives 28 kilometers from the city in a town called Pilancho. He offers his services as a bricklayer and works on construction jobs in different provinces and in the city. Eleuterio also has dairy cows, three of which are producing and another that is pregnant. He delivers the milk to a processor for making cheese and other dairy products, which are then sold in a town near his community. In addition, Eleuterio grows potatoes and sells his harvest in the market square once a year.

Eleuterio took out his first Kiva loan in August 2010. The loan he requested was used to build and improve the rooms in his home because he was starting a family. He is very grateful for that loan because it gave him the opportunity to improve his home and provide his wife a better space to live as a family.

Eleuterio is currently growing in his construction jobs, so he wants to buy a cement mixer that he needs for his work. He already has contracts to perform more work, so he is requesting his second loan. Eleuterio now has a daughter who is 1½ years old, so he is very pleased that he started his family two years ago. He wants to improve his family’s living conditions for the future.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a concrete floor in the back patio of his home.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Âgé de 34ans, monsieur Koffi  est marié à une secrétaire et est père de 02 enfants (05ans et 03ans) tous sur les bancs de l’école. En 2007, il revend des produits cosmétiques qu’il livre aux détenteurs de boutiques. Il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses nombreux. Avec les profits, il veut assurer l’épanouissement de la famille et augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Koffi is 34 years old, married to a secretary and father to two children (five and three years old respectively) who both attend school. Since 2007 he has been retailing cosmetics that he delivers to shop owners. He is requesting a first loan from WAGES to get fresh supplies of goods so that he can respond better to the demands of his numerous customers. With the profits he makes he wants to ensure his family's prosperity and also increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.
