loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba est âgée de 38ans. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien et ils ont 03 enfants en charge. Les deux premiers âgés de 08ans et 06ans sont scolarisés. Le dernier est âgé de 04ans. Afin d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2008 dans une boutique. Son premier crédit qu’elle sollicite à WAGES lui servira à acheter des produits d’alimentation générale pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, ouvrir d’autres boutiques et acheter un terrain.
texts.en: Ayaba is 38 years old. She is married to a mechanic and they have three children in their care. The two eldest children, who are eight and six years old respectively, are both at school. The youngest is four years old. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Ayaba has been selling groceries in a shop since 2008. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy groceries so that she can respond to customer demand. She wants to reinvest in her business, open other shops and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy general groceries.

loans.name: Falade

texts.fr: Falade est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 03 enfants  dont 02 sur les bancs d’école. L’ainé est âgé de 20ans et le dernier 12ans.  Âgé de 47ans, Mr falade est revendeur de profession.  Il est dans le domaine de l’informatique et vend des accessoires d’ordinateurs et des ordinateurs.  Cette activité qu’il mène depuis 2000 se fait dans une boutique. Il est un ancien client de WAGES et par ce prêt qu’il sollicite, il veut s’approvisionner en marchandises pour pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. Avec les profits, il veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en: Falade is married to a retailer and has three children, two of whom are at school. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest 12. Falade is 47 years old and is a retailer by trade. He works in the computer field and sells computers as well as computer accessories. He has been carrying out this business in a shop since 2000. He is an old customer of WAGES and with the loan he is now requesting he wants to get fresh supplies of goods to satisfy customer demand. With the profits he makes, he wants to reinvest in his business and ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy computers and computer accessories.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Père de jumeaux âgés de 02ans, Komlan âgé de 24ans est mariée à une revendeuse. il est policier et en même temps revendeur. En 2011, il vend des arômes et des ustensiles en plastiques dans une boutique. Cette activité est gérée par sa femme. Pour répondre plus aux demandes des clients, il sollicite de WAGES un premier pour acheter de nouveaux stocks de marchandises. Il veut agrandir son activité, ouvrir une grande boutique d’ustensiles en plastiques et permettre à sa famille de bien s’épanouir.
texts.en: Komlan, who is 24 years old, is father to two-year old twins and married to a retailer. He is a policeman and at the same time a retailer. Since 2011 he has been selling food flavourings and plastic utensils in a shop. This business is managed by his wife. In order to respond better to customer demand, he is requesting a first loan to buy new supplies of goods. He wants to expand his business, open a large plastic utensil shop and enable his family to prosper.

loans.use: to buy flavourings and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Téko

texts.fr: Téko âgé de 39ans vit avec sa femme couturière et leurs enfants à Lomé. En 2005, il a commencé par vendre des cartes de recharges au bord de la route. Il s’approvisionne chez les sociétés de télécommunication et sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des cartes de recharges. A l’avenir, il  voudrait devenir grossiste et voir sa famille vivre dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Téko is 39 years old and lives with his wife, who is a dressmaker, and their children in Lomé. In 2005 he began selling telephone recharge cards on the side of the road. He gets his supplies from telecommunication companies and is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy recharge cards. He would like to become a wholesaler in the future and have his family living in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Irma Haydee

texts.es: Irma Haydee de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos. Ella  se dedica a la venta de mariscos camarones, pescado, conchas entre otros, tiene varios años con el pequeños negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en las ventas siempre logra obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy concurrido de personas y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, fresco, a precio accesible pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Irma es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ganarse un futuro mas prospero, sabe que solo con todo su esfuerzo y constancia alcanzara ese éxito que tanto desea,  en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para también aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mariscos por mayor. Irma Haydee tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que le ofrecerá a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma Haydee de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos. Ella  se dedica a la venta de mariscos camarones, pescado, conchas entre otros, tiene varios años con el pequeños negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en las ventas siempre logra obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy concurrido de personas y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, fresco, a precio accesible pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Irma es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ganarse un futuro mas prospero, sabe que solo con todo su esfuerzo y constancia alcanzara ese éxito que tanto desea,  en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para también aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mariscos por mayor. Irma Haydee tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que le ofrecerá a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Irma Haydee is thirty eight years and lives with her life partner and three children. She sells seafood including shrimp, fish and conch. She has several years of experience with small businesses which has given her valuable experience. Irma always gets the best profits from sales, and the place where she does business is very crowded with people.  She has many customers who prefer her because everything she sells is top quality, fresh and at reasonable prices. But more than anything she provides excellent service. Irma is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and is eager to get ahead and create a more prosperous future. She knows that it will take all of her effort and persistence to reach this goal that she so wants. Over the past few weeks, demand has increased and she would like to take advantage of this to increase her investment. This is why she is asking community bank Integral for a loan that will help her buy wholesale seafood. Irma Haydee has a good history of paying, and is sure she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time trusts she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use:
mariscos por mayorl

wholesale seafood

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita de sesenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos por catalogo cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en el pequeño negocio y eso le ha dado mucha experiencia en las ventas por lo que siempre obtiene las mejores ganancias, comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, es muy conocida en los alrededores y se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Ana es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y muy activa siempre esta en la búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan dar un paso mas cerca al éxito ya que no piensa rendirse hasta lograr, como toda buena comerciante quiere expandir su negocio e invertir en nueva mercadería pero para ello necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos, perfumes, cremas etc. Ana Margarita tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez le ofrecerá a su grupo familiar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita, sixty-eight years old, lives together with her life partner in their own house. Se buys and sells products from catalogs: cosmetics, perfumes, creams, among other. She has been working in this small business for several years, and this has given her a lot of experience in sales, which is why she has always obtained the best profits.

She sells both by traveling to different neighborhoods and from home, she is very well-known in the surroundings, and she has got a lot of fixed customers who prefer her because she always has what they need at affordable prices and with a service without equal.

Ana is a woman committed to her work, energetic and very active; she is always looking for new opportunities that allow her coming one step closer to success, because she does not think of quitting until achieving.

As any good salesperson, she wants to expand her business and invest in new merchandise, but for this she needs capital as back up. This is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that allows her to buy cosmetics, perfumes, creams, etc. Ana Margarita has good payment references, she assures that she will be able to repay the loan within the established time and at the same time she will offer her family group a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Eugenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Eugenia de 53 años de edad, vive junto a tres nietos quienes son la alegría de su hogar y principal razón para salir adelante. Sus hijos se encuentran en los Estados Unido de quienes recibe una pequeña ayuda económica para el sostenimiento de sus nietos. Eugenia se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas, las cuales comercializa frente a su casa de habitación, debido a que está ubicada en calle principal, cuenta con varios clientes gracias a quienes ha podido mantener a flote su negocio. Eugenia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de poder comprar maíz, verduras, queso, frijoles y otros ingredientes más para elaborar las pupusas y de este modo producir más y aumentar sus ventas
texts.en:
Eugenia, 53 years old, lives together with her three grandchildren who are the joy of her home and the main reason to progress. Her children are in the United States, from whom she receives a small economic aid for supporting her grandchildren.

Eugenia prepares pupusas [a thick corn tortilla filled with cheese, meat and/or refried beans], and sells them in front of her house. Because she is located in a main street, she has numerous customers, thanks to whom she has managed to keep her business going.

Eugenia is asking INTEGRAL for a loan, with the intention of being able to buy corn, vegetables, cheese, beans and other additional ingredients for preparing pupusas and in this way producing more and increasing her sales.

loans.use: tu buy corn, cheese and beans for preparing pupusas [thick corn tortillas filled with different things]

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old. She lives in Airport, is single, and has two children aged five and 12 years old that live with her and go to school. Her children's father works with Firestone. 

For four years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She worked as a caretaker to start her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. She hopes to build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a bale of shoes and pay for transport.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Adama. She is married and has two children aged 10 and 13. Two of her sisters live with her to get assistance with their schooling. In 2000, Adama established her cosmetics and provision business. She began her business at the age of 20 when she became pregnant. Her parents told her to go to the man who impregnated her and at the end, the man decided to give her substantive capital to establish her own business so that she could get help for some domestic issues. 

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to buy goods worth SLL 3,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 500,000. In the future, Adama plans to become one of the leading agencies for cosmetics sales. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and is from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with five children aged between 11 and 27. She has a business making rice cakes that she sells in her locality. She is asking for a loan to buy the needed ingredients like sticky rice, cooking oil, sugar and margarine. This will help her to cook on time and generate a better income for her family, especially her children. 

Elizabeth is confident that she can make her business successful with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice, cooking oil, sugar and margarine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Mary. She is married, and has two children aged 12 and six years old. In 2005, Mary established her soft drinks, beer and stout business. She began her business after completing high school. Unfortunately, she lost her dad and things became rough and with such, she did not continue her education but rather engaged herself in business so as to allow life to go on smoothly. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan for an amount of SLL 4,000,000. Mary requires a loan in order to buy assorted drinks worth SLL 4,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 500,000. 

In the future, Mary plans to expand her business and also support her husband to educate their children. Honest and hardworking, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks.

loans.name: Idalis

texts.es: Idalis tiene 43 años y vive en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 19 años; ella es propietaria de un taller donde confecciona ropa en las línea femenina, masculina e infantil. Por muchos años, Idalis trabajó confeccionando para terceros, mediante el sistema de maquila, es decir empresas de mayor tamaño le entregan la prenda ya cortada para que en su taller sea ensamblada y la acabe con sus capacidad creativa; Hace 8 años ella  decidió a independizarse y empezar su propio negocio, para estar más cerca a sus tres hijos y poder cuidarlos mientras produce ingresos que los beneficien en su bienestar. Ahora, ella confecciona camisas, pantalones, blusas y bermudas, productos elaborados que vende entre vecinos y a familiares y es apoyada también, por su hermana, quien  los distribuye en otros municipios cercanos al Soledad, municipio donde tiene su domicilio. En la actualidad Idalis está aplicando a un crédito de Kiva para comprar materias primas para su negocio, como telas, botones, e hilos. También quiere comprar una máquina de coser, para facilitar la producción y mejorar aun mas la calidad de la ropa que hace. Esto la va a ayudar a realizar una de sus metas para su negocio, que es ampliar la producción para poder proveer mejores ingresos que beneficien a su familia. Ella y su esposo recién compraron una vivienda, y una amplificación de producción en su negocio va a ayudarlos a terminar de pagarla y eso es justamente un motivo de gran entusiasmo, con el que estamos seguros logrará cualquier propósito que emprenda.
texts.en:
Idalis is 43 years old and lives in a town which is very near the city of Barranquilla.  She lives with her husband and their three children who are between 12 and 19 years old.  Idalis owns a workshop where she makes men's, women's and children's clothing.  For many years Idalis worked making clothing for third parties.  Large companies would deliver the items of clothing to her already cut out so that she would sew them together in her workshop and finish them off using her creative skills.  Eight years ago, she decided to start working for herself and start her own business so that she could be closer to her three children and take care of them while she made money to improve their well-being.  Now Idalis makes shirts, pants, blouses and Bermuda shorts which she sells to neighbors and family members.  She has the support of her sister who delivers her products to other towns near Soledad where she lives.  

Idalis is applying for this Kiva loan to buy materials for her business such as fabric, buttons and thread.  She would also like to buy a sewing machine to help with her production and to help her make further improvements to the quality of the clothing she makes.  This, in turn, will help her to achieve one of her business goals: to increase her production so that she can make better income for the benefit of her family.  Idalis and her husband recently bought their own home and, by increasing her business production, she will be able to help finish paying for it.  This motivates her greatly and we are certain that she will manage to achieve any goal she sets herself.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business such as fabric, buttons, thread and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita tiene 36 años y es una estilista, que se hizo profesional, después de haber estudiado técnica de belleza en una academia y perfeccionado sus conocimientos con procesos de formación y actualización. Ella tiene 16 años de experiencia en este arte, que ha perfeccionado trabajando todos los días desde su casa, para  proveer servicios como el corte del pelo, masajes, cepillados, manicures, pedicuras y másy vendiendo productos a sus clientes. Jovita está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  los productos necesarios para su trabajo, como shampos, y artículos que tambien vende mediante guías especializadas a sus clientes que acceden a los servicios de mejoramiento de imagen personal y profesional. Su  sueño  más adelante respecto al negocio es que lo pueda ubicar en un local fijo y posicionado así como el de organizar su vivienda, para lograr ambientes confortables y seguros tanto en su casa como en su negocio. A veces ella se encuentra con desafíos en su negocio porque en algunas épocas del año, las ventas por los servicios que ofrece se disminuyen un poco, pero Jovita sigue trabajando para proveer una buena calidad de servicios a sus clientes y para seguir mejorando la calidad de su vida y la de su familia, que conforma con su esposo
texts.en:
Jovita is 36 years old and she is a stylist who became professional after having studied beauty technique in an academy and developed her knowledge thorugh training and updating processes. She has 16 years of experience in this art, which she has improved by working every day from her home, in order to provide services such as haircuts, massages, hair styling, manicure, pedicure and more and selling items to her clients.

Jovita is applying for a credikiva, the first loan she makes with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy the products needed for her job, such as shampoos and items she sells through specialized catalogs to her clients who get personal and professional image improvement services.

Her dream regarding her business in the future is to be able to have a fixed and well-located establishment and to improve her house in order to obtain comfortable and safe environments both at home and at for her business. She sometimes faces challenges in her business because during some seasons, sales decrease a little from the services she offers, but Jovita keeps on working in order to provide good-quality services to her clients and to continue improving her quality of life and that of her family, which she forms together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy the necessary products for her job, such as shampoo and other items she sells through specialized catalogs to her clients, which get personal and professional image improvement services.

loans.name: Yader Eulogio

texts.es:
Por un pedazo de cielo mi Nicaragua se formó por eso es lindo este suelo, el suelo donde nací yo.

Y de este pequeño suelo pertenece el municipio de El Sauce donde habita Yader, un joven de 32 años que se gana la vida laborando como profesor de primaria en una comarca aledaña y para su superación estudia los fines de semana la carrera de Magisterio con el fin de llegar a tener su título y de tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Por los bajos salarios que se gana en nuestro país muchas personas no pueden cumplir sus sueños de prepararse profesionalmente o de preparar a sus hijos y de llegar a tener una vivienda digna pero también hay personas luchadoras que buscan la manera de llegar a cumplir su objetivo como es el caso de Yader que solicitó un crédito para pagar los aranceles de la universidad y así no tener obstáculos para obtener su título de docente.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a través de estos préstamos que vienen a resolver problemas personales que por los bajos salarios en nuestro país no pueden cubrirse.
texts.en:
From a little bit of heaven, my Nicaragua has grown, which is why this land is beautiful, the land where I was born*

The town of El Sauce belongs to this small land and it is where Yader lives.  Yader is a 32-year-old man who earns a living working as an elementary school teacher in a neighboring region.  In order to improve himself, he is studying for a teacher training degree on weekends so that he will have his degree and therefore a better quality of life.

Owing to the low salaries that are paid in our country, many people are unable to fulfill their dreams of training to become a professional, doing the same for their children and managing to own a decent home.  However, there are also tenacious people who seek a way to achieve their goals.  This is the case for Yader who has requested a loan to pay his university fees so that he won't face any obstacles in obtaining his teaching degree.

Yader is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they have given him through these loans which help him to solve personal problems which, owing to the low salaries in our country, he would otherwise be unable to solve.

*(line from a well-known Nicaraguan song)

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria is 57 years old and from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with nine adult children. Hilaria likes to be engaged in something that will make her productive. For 15 years now, she has been producing baskets and other craft for an income to help her carpenter husband. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials like buri and rattan and to pay for the transport expenses of her finished products. Hilaria knows the value of good work and perseverance. In the future, she hopes that she can save enough so she can retire in comfort and enjoy her golden years.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like buri and rattan and to pay for transport expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 59 years old and from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her husband works as a chef in a hospital. Felisa has small businesses which help her husband in providing for their family's basic needs. She grows rice and makes baskets for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials like rattan, buri and sticks. These are vital for her business so she can produce more baskets. In the future, she hopes to save and reinvest in a bigger production for an increased profit.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like rattan, buri and sticks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old, lives in Airport, and she is married and has children between 15 and 26 years old. She never attended school. Her husband is a businessman. For years now Mary has been involved in business. Currently she sells palm oil by the gallon in the local market. She requesting a loan to purchase palm oil for her business. One problem she is facing is less availability of commodities. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. She owns a fish mongering business which she has been operating for four years.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are finding customers, price fluctuation, inflation and customers not paying on time. 

Binti is applying for a loan of 43,150 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of fish and start a retail shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to open a retail shop and build a residential house.

loans.use: To add to her stock of fish and start a retail shop.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina lives in the community of Bien Unido, Bohol, along with her husband and four children ages 14-25. To provide for her family, she started a Sari-sari store (general store) business 10 years ago. Severina is asking for a loan to buy more supplies for her general store, like canned goods, seasonings, rice, soft drinks, toiletries, and a manicure kit, too.
 
With the loan, Severina will be able to increase her inventory level, attracting more customers. This will increase her sales and income. With the profits, she will be able to provide her family with the things they need and her children will be able to go to school. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, seasonings, rice, soft drinks, toiletries and a manicure kit.

loans.name: Demare

texts.en: Demare is 34 years old, lives in Airport, and is married with two children aged 5 and 15. They are in school and live at home. For the past seven years she has been selling fish in the local market where she makes a profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for the business. In the near future she wants to build a house and a shop and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for the business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past four years, and the business has improved. He is applying for his fourth loan cycle from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

Joseph will use the loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to grow and help other people in the society.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 53 years old and is from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with two adult children.  Rita has a Sari-sari store business and also sells home-cooked dishes and snack foods. In her spare time, she also makes baskets for additional income.  At this time, she lacks the funds needed to buy soft drinks, rice, canned food, toiletries, seasoning and noodles for her store.

With a loan she will be able to replenish her stock on time, and she will be able to serve her customers better while increasing her profitability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, canned food, toiletries, seasoning and noodles.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 48 years old and lives in Airport. She stopped her education at 3rd grade. She has 5 children between 20 and 35 years old. Two are in school and live at home. Her husband is not working now.

She started her business with the little amount that her sister gave to her. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, pepper, charcoal, etc. for her business. Her dream is to see her children attending college.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, charcoal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Con su crédito anterior, Luis logró comprar más frutas como manzanas, peras, pomelos, fresas y uvas para vender a sus clientes en el centro de Barranquilla; también lo usó para comprar una carreta con la que pudiera vender sus frutas de casa en casa en varios barrios de la ciudad. Ahora, Luis Enrique quiere otro crédikiva, para aumentar el volumen de frutas que puede comprar, para poder satisfacer la demanda del mercado. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por confiar en mi y espero que me sigan apoyando para ampliar mi negocio y poder generar empleo con otros puntos de venta.”
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Luis was able to buy more fruits such as apples, pears, grapefruit, strawberries, and grapes to sell to his clients in Barranquilla’s city center. He also used the loan to buy a cart to sell fruit from house to house in various neighborhoods in the city. 

Now, Luis Enrique would like another loan to increase the number of fruits he can buy in order to satisfy his customer demand. His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you for trusting in me and I hope that you continue to support me in expanding my business and in creating jobs in other outlets”.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume of fruit to meet customer demand

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es: Wendy usó su credikiva anterior para comprar insumos de peluquería, como shampoos, y productos que sus clientes normalmente la piden. Wendy quiere otro crédito para comprar más productos por catálogo para vender a sus clientes, y para utilizar en sus servicios estilísticos que ofrece en su peluquería. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias al apoyo brindado por ustedes, he podido hacer crecer mi negocio y la cobertura de clientes es cada día mayor, ya que tengo el capital necesario para la operación de mi negocio.”
texts.en:
Wendy used her previous loan to buy hairdressing supplies such as shampoos and products that customers normally request. 

Wendy would like another loan to buy more products from catalogs to sell to her clients and to use in her services offered in her salon. Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: “Thanks to support from you, I have been able to grow my business and my number of clients in growing every day because now I have the capital necessary to operate my business.”

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies such as shampoos and products that her clients typically request

loans.name: Yolbin

texts.es: Yolbin usó su crédito anterior para comprar productos para su negocio como calzados y dulces, y también compró artículos cosméticos y perfumería que vende mediante guías especializadas  o por catálogos, a un buen precio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva para comprar más zapatos y para elaborar anchetas de dulces para colegios – porque los estudiantes las compran para regalar a amigos en el Mes del Amor y Amistad. Ella tiene muchos pedidos para sus anchetas y son muy  rentables, lo cual la entusiasma. Ella quiere   “Agradecerles por la oportunidad que le dieron a sus finaciadores.”
texts.en: Yolbin used her last loan to purchase products for her store such as shoes and sweets, and she also bought cosmetics and perfumes that she sells from specialized guides or by catalogs at a good price.  Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan to purchase more shoes and to make packets of sweets for schools.  The students buy the packets to give to their friends during the Month of Love and Friendship.  She has many orders for her sweet packets and they are very profitable, which makes her enthusiastic.  She says that she is thankful for the opportunity that the lenders have given her.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and to make packets of sweets for schools.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta lives in the community of Trinidad, Bohol, with her husband. She is 56 years old and she owns two businesses, operating a convenience store (sari-sari store) and growing rice.  Vicenta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, canned goods, rice, soft drinks, seasoning and toiletries. 
With the loan, she will be able to increase her inventory and supplies, attracting more customers and gaining an edge over her competitors. In the future, she hopes to sustain her business and expand the type of merchandise that she sells to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, canned goods, rice, soft drinks, seasoning and toiletries.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 30 years old, a single man who supports two siblings. He has been a dairy farmer for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000. 

He is applying for his first loan of KES.10,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase another dairy cow. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is an enthusiastic and responsible woman who loves to be engaged in various small businesses. She is 36 years old, from Antequera, Bohol. She has a convenience store (sari-sari store), and she also sells home-cooked dishes. She wants to do the best for her only child, who is 12 years old.  The loan will enable Juanita to improve and expand her offerings and to buy in bulk. This should improve the profitability of her business. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and a better income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, seasoning, meat, soft drinks and chips for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana está separada del esposo y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa de familiares ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleada de limpieza en un hotel y por las noches vende comida rápida ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de operación de su nariz ya que tiene complicaciones para respirar.
El sueño de Ana, es mejorar sus ingresos y alquilar tres habitaciones para darles más comodidad a sus hijos de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Ana, who is separated from her husband, has two school age children.  They live in her relatives’ house, occupying only one room with brick walls and a dirt floor.  The house is in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

She currently earns money working as a cleaning lady in a hotel.  In the evenings she sells fast food because it is the only way to cover her family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

She needs the loan to pay for an operation on her nose because she has difficulties breathing.

Ana’s dream is to improve her income and to rent three rooms.  She wants to do this in order to make her children more comfortable and to improve their quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an operation on her nose because she has difficulties breathing.

loans.name: Nurys

texts.es: Con su crédikiva anterior, Nurys compró insumos de modistería y mercancías variadas para su miscelánea. En la actualidad tiene mucho entusiasmo, por eso está aplicando a otro crédito de Kiva para comprar más variedades, detalles y accesorios para sus clientes leales y surtir su negocio en una de las temporadas más productivas en el año, donde sus ventas usualmente se incrementan, el segundo semestre del año, y esto es justamente la razón de éxito de su inversion. Nurys envia este mensaje a sus fondeaderos de Kiva: “Gracias por todo el apoyo que Kiva me ha brindado, gracias a los créditos recibidos he podido incrementar mi capital y mi negocio ha salido adelante.”
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Nurys bought dressmaking supplies and various goods for miscellaneous use. She is very enthusiastic and is applying for a new loan to buy more variety, details and accessories for her loyal customers and to stock her business in one of the busiest times of year when her sales increase, typically in the second half of the year, and this is the reason this investment will be successful.

Her message to her Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you for all the support Kiva has given me. Thanks to the loans I have received I have been able increase my capital and my business been able to get ahead."

loans.use: o buy more variety, details and accessories including jewelry, Christmas adornments, etc.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, 48, lives with her four children in the coastal region of Kenya. She is single, and she has discovered that she has to work extra hard to be able to meet the needs of her family. Thanks to her efforts, her children rarely lack for basic necessities. All of them are attending school. Her goal is to make sure that they become professionals, so that they can have a better future.
For the past 10 years, she has been operating a food stall serving her neighborhood. She has a good customer base due to her kindness and her ready smile. She tells us that her supply of ingredients is reduced, and she wants to increase her inventory. This is why she has applied to Yehu for a loan that will enable her to purchase cooking oil, flour, rice, and additional cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, flour, rice, and additional cooking utensils.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Fish selling has become a common activity in the town of Msambweni. This town is where Mwanaisha sells fish from her home. She is a 49-year-old divorced woman, taking care of three children. Despite the adversities she is encountering, she has never given up and never will. She works hard to ensure that her children get a quality education. She is requesting this loan to buy a larger stock of fish for resale. This way she will be sure to increase her income, in order to continue providing a quality life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy está separada del esposo  y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de libros de toda variedad ya que cuenta con un puesto fijo y trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El  crédito lo requiere para la compra de más libros de cocina, educación y diccionarios para mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar su mercadería.
El sueño de Lucy, es ampliar su negocio de libros y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita créditos junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lucy, who is separated from her husband, has two school age children.  They live in their own house, occupying three rooms.  The house is in the Mariscal Sucre area of the city of La Paz.

She currently sells all types of books.  She has a fixed stand, and she works for over eight hours a day.  This is the only way for her to cover her family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

She needs the loan to buy more cookbooks, school books and dictionaries.  She needs this in order to improve her income and to have more merchandise.

Lucy’s dream is to expand her book business.  This way she will improve her income and her quality of life.

This is the second time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more cook books, schoolbooks and dictionaries for her book stand.

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena is 35 years old and lives in Airport. She stopped her education at fourth grade, married and has six children between 4 and 18 years old who are in school and live at home. Her husband is a builder.

For the past ten years she has been selling slippers, soap, towels, etc. She started this business by selling for friends and learned it from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers, soap, towels, etc., for her business. She likes her business because it enables her to take care of her family. Her plan is to buy land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, soap, towels, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Konah K.

texts.en:
Konah is 44 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is married and she has eight children between 19 and 29 years old. Four are in school, and one is working. Six are living at home. Her husband works with Firestone.

For the past 20 years she has been selling bitter ball (a vegetable) and pepper. She started this business with a little amount that her husband gave her. She learned this business from her mother. She like her business because of the way people respond to it. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bitter ball, pepper, onion, garlic and salt for her business. Her plan is to send her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase bitter ball, pepper, onion, garlic and salt for her business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos  los cuales ya son todos independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona  Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como profesor  asalariado por más de ocho horas al día al igual que su esposa deben cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de estuco, pinturas, lijas, para la  refacción de su habitación ya que las paredes se encuentran muy deterioradas y desea mejorar su calidad de vida haciendo un terminado fino y pintado de las paredes.
El sueño de Cesar es refaccionar las demás habitaciones de su vivienda para poder acoger a sus hijos.
Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Cesar is married, and he has four children.  All of his children are now independent.  He lives in his own house, occupying two rooms.  The house is in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

He now earns money working as a teacher for over eight hours a day, the same as his wife.  They need to cover the expenses for food and basic services.

He needs the loan to buy stucco, paint, and sandpaper to repair a room.  The walls are badly damaged, and he wishes to improve his quality of life by putting on a fine finish and painting the walls.

Cesar’s dream is to repair the rest of the rooms in his house in order to be able to accommodate their children.

This is the sixth time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stucco, paint, and sandpaper to repair a room in his house.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 26 años y nació en Cali, Colombia. Logró estudiar comunicación social en la Universidad Pública del Valle, gracias a que recibía subsidios económicos por parte del Estado por su excelente rendimiento académico y por la limitada situación económica de su familia.  En estos momentos, Alejandro y su hermano solo cuentan con el apoyo económico de su madre ya que su padre falleció hace algún tiempo.

Alejandro es un apasionado por la tecnología y su sueño es estudiar una maestría en diseño sonoro en Reino Unido.  Una vez admitido en alguna de las mejores universidades de ese país, Alejandro está seguro que gracias a sus buenas notas, experiencia en el medio  y sus proyectos sociales podrá lograr el apoyo de una beca que financie sus estudios. Ahora quiere solicitar este préstamo con Kiva porque es la única manera que tiene para poder pagar el curso de preparación del TOEFL y la inscripción al examen, que son los primeros pasos que debe superar para poder lograr su sueño.

Aquí esta su historia:

La gran pasión de mi vida es la música y el sonido. He recibido educación musical desde muy pequeño, mi primer instrumento musical lo comencé a ejecutar desde los 8 años. Más recientemente he sido partícipe de oportunidades que me han permitido desarrollar mi talento y el de muchos otros jóvenes para la transformación social a través de los medios de comunicación, divulgando mensajes de bienestar, esperanza, conocimiento y desarrollo.

El cine es también otra de mis aficiones y por tal motivo he trabajado en proyectos de corto y largo metraje desde el colegio. Tal motivo me llevó con mucho esfuerzo tanto económico como académico a concluir mis estudios en la escuela de comunicación social de la Universidad del Valle, que se destaca particularmente por su énfasis en audiovisuales y por sus cineastas egresados.

Desde hace algunos años vengo desarrollando y participando de proyectos que fusionan lo audiovisual con la música y el sonido, tengo un blog sobre música y he tocado en grupos, he diseñado algunas piezas sonoras para cortometrajes en edición e incluso he trabajado como DJ. 

Sin embargo, en este momento mi sueño es llevar mi talento al siguiente nivel y es por eso que quiero aprender de los mejores, el arte del diseño sonoro. He escogido estudiar en el Reino Unido, entre otras razones, por la afinidad que siento por su aporte a la cultura universal desde la música y  su consabida y mundialmente famosa calidad en ingeniería de sonido.

Una vez regrese al país sueño con contribuir socialmente a Colombia, creando mi propia empresa en medios digitales en donde quiero asesorar a jóvenes de sectores marginados con técnicas de realización audiovisual, manejo de redes sociales y video comunitario orientados al sonido, música y diseño sonoro. 

El apoyo de Kiva es sin duda la herramienta mas importante que tengo para dar el primer paso que necesito para la consecución de mi sueño. Este préstamo sería destinado para cubrir el costo de un curso de preparación para el examen de proficiencia en el idioma inglés, así como del costo de inscripción a una de las universidades a las que pienso aplicar.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 26 years old and was born in Cali, Colombia.  He was able to study social communication at the Public University of Valle because he received financial support from the state for his excellent academic record and his family's limited financial situation.  Currently, Alejandro and his brother only have their mother's financial support since his father died some time ago.  

Alejandro is passionate about technology and his dream is to study for a Master's degree in sound design in the United Kingdom.  Once he is admited to one of the best universities in Colombia, he is sure that his good grades, media experience, and social projects will allow him to receive a grant to finance his studies.  Now, he is asking for this Kiva loan because it is the only way he can pay for a TOEFL preparation course and the exam fee, which are the first things he has to do to achieve his dream.  

Here is his story:

The great passion of my life is music and sound.  I have received music education since I was very young.  I started studying my first musical instrument when I was eight years old.  More recently I have participated in opportunities that have allowed me to develop my talent and that of many other young people for social transformation through the media, spreading messages of well-being, hope, knowledge, and development.

Movies are another one of my hobbies, and for that reason I have worked on short and long films since high school.  I made academic and financial effort to study at the school of social communication at the University of Valle, which is known for its emphasis on audiovisual studies and its alumni filmmakers.  

For the last few years, I have been developing and participating in projects that fuse audiovisual with music and sound.  I have a music blog and have played in groups.  I have designed some sound pieces for short films being edited and I have also worked as a DJ.

However, at this time my dream is to bring my talent to the next level and that is why I want to learn the art of sound design from the best.  I have chosen to study in the United Kingdom, among other reasons, because of the affinity I feel for their contribution to world culture through music and their world famous quality in sound engineering.  

Once I return to this country, I dream of contributing socially in Colombia by creating my own digital media company where I advise young people from marginalized areas on audiovisual techniques, using social media, and community video oriented to sound, music, and sound design.

The support of Kiva is without doubt the most important tool that I have to take the first step necessary to achieve my dream.  This loan will cover the cost of a preparation course for the English proficiency exam as well as the cost of enrolling at one of the universities I plan to apply to.

loans.use: to pay his application costs for a Master's degree in Sound Design for Film and Television.

loans.name: Aida Maria

texts.es: Aida tiene 27 años y trabaja en un negocio que heredó de su familia. En este negocio, que ha estado operando por 16 años, Aida compra retazos de tela, los corte y los convierte en  limpiones industriales. Ella los vende directamente a revendedores y fábricas en la ciudad de Barranquilla y en el municipio donde habita. En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito con Kiva, porque requiere comprar una gran cantidad de retazos de tela, en un volumen de  tonelada, para asegurar que siempre tenga materiales para hacer limpiones, pues muchas veces este insumo escasea y una mayor cantidad de retazos la ayudarán a aumentar la producción y la falta de retazos detendrá el proceso productivo. Aida tiene grandes metas para su negocio: quiere aumentar los volúmenes con que trabaja, y es tan inmenso este propósito que planea mas adelante adquirir una nueva maquina y abordar al inmenso mercado potencial que la circunda. También tiene otra gran meta  para su vida personal y es la de comprar una casa propia. Aunque a veces siente que es difícil ahorrar suficiente dinero, Aida sigue trabajando en su negocio familiar y espera que este crédito la ayude a cumplir sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Aida, 27, works in a business she inherited from her family. In this business, which has been operating for 16 years, Aida buys fabric scraps, cuts them, and makes them into industrial wipes. She sells them directly to retailers and factories in the city of Barranquilla and in the municipality in which she lives. 

She is requesting a loan with Kiva because she wants to buy a large amount of fabric scraps, a ton, to make sure that she always has enough fabric scraps to make wipes because oftentimes there is a supply shortage. An increased number of fabric scraps will help her increase production while a lack of fabric scraps stops the production process. 

Aida has big goals for her business: she wants to increase the volume of her work and this goal of hers is so big that she plans to buy a new machine later down the line and address the huge potential market that surrounds her. She also has a big goal in her personal life which is buying her own home. Although, sometimes she finds it hard to save enough money. Aida continues to work in her family business and she hopes that his loan will help her accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to buy a large number of fabric scraps (a ton) to make sure that she always has enough material to make industrial wipes

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 39 years old and lives in Airport. She stopped her education at seventh grade, married and has six children between 2 and 20 years old. They are in school and live at home. Her husband is a taxi driver.

For the past ten years she has been selling rice by the cup. She started this business with her husband's salary and learned it from her friends. She likes her business because of the way she exchanges money for goods.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice for her business. Her plan is to send her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice for her business.

loans.name: Mayadevi

texts.es:
Mayadevi, es soltera y no tiene hijos; vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada en una entidad privada por más de ocho horas al día y por las noches estudia  Fotografía y el crédito lo requiere para la compra de material fotográfico (una cámara fotográfica y libros relacionados a Fotografía) ya que desea terminar sus estudios y con lo que gana no le alcanza ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de Mayadevi es mejorar sus ingresos y tener su propio estudio fotográfico para posteriormente independizarse.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mayadevi is single, and she does not have children.  She lives in her parents’ house, occupying only one room.  The house is in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

She is currently employed by a private company, and she works for over eight hours a day.  She studies photography in the evenings.  She needs the loan to buy photography materials (a camera and photography books) because she wishes to finish her studies.  She does not earn enough to buy these things because she needs to cover the expenses for food and basic services.

Mayadevi’s dream is to improve her income and to have her own photography studio.  She wants to do this in order to later become independent.

This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a camera and photography books in order to continue the photography course that she is taking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the costs of matriculation and enrollment in his studies.

loans.name: Ruku

texts.en:
Ruku is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, age 21 and 16. 

In 2001, she established her potato selling business. She buys potatoes from the Kalimati bazaar, which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. She sells potatoes cheaply in the local market. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy potatoes for her business. In the future, Ruku plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Tete

texts.en:
Tete is 50 years old and lives in Airport. She stopped her education at second grade. She is married and has six children between 12 and 23 years old. All of them are in school and living at home.

For the past 15 years she has been selling dried bush meat. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She likes her business because it is profitable.

She is requesting a loan to purchase dried bush meat for the business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase dried bush meat for the business.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Huasao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE HUASAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny ella es conviviente y tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de crianza de pollos,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende enlas diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene en este negocio 5 años y le va muiy bien,la socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de tienda de abarrotes pero no le fue muy bien porque los productos subieron de precio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los pollos y también para comprar pollos.
 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de carpinteria, negocio de venta de salón de belleza y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “NUEVO AMANECER DE HUASAO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district which is part of the Cusco province and Cusco department. 

Fanny is 40 years old. She has a partner and two children. She works in her business selling chickens. The member fattens and raises the animals. Later, she sells them in different markets. The member has had her business for five years and it is going very well. Previously, the member had a grocery store but it didn’t turn out well because the products increased in price. The dream of the member is to have a business location where she can sell her chickens. She is requesting a loan to purchase food for the chickens and to also purchase chickens. 

The other members sell animals and have carpentry, beauty salon and restaurant businesses. 

The member is thankful to the people who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase food for chickens and purchase chickens.

loans.name: Edith Del Socorro

texts.es: Edith, una mujer de 38 años, que está aplicando a un crédito de Kiva para su negocio, que consiste en ofrecer de servicios de belleza, a  sus vecinos del sector donde está domiciliada; Mucha gente de su barrio y de otros sectores, llega directamente a su negocio acceder a sus servicios de cortes de cabello, embellecimiento de imagen y para comprar productos de belleza como cremas, champoo y otras mercancías. Hace 12 años, por la poca oportunidad laboral existente en su municipio, Edith decidió crear su propio negocio y ahora los ingresos la ayudan y puede simultáneamente cuidar su  hijo  pequeño. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, para comprar productos para su peluquería y vender a sus clientes, artículos a un precio razonable, y en el marco de lo que ellos necesitan comprar. Edith sabe que tener un negocio es mucho trabajo, porque trabaja 12 horas diarias. Porque ella tiene grandes metas de ampliar su espacio, para poder generar empleo para otros. Edith sueña con mandar a su hijo a la escuela, para que él pueda tener una buena calidad de vida, pero conoce que los costos educativos son muy altos y por eso se esfuerza mucho trabajando mucho para aumentar los ingresos familiares y proveer para su familia.
texts.en: Edith is a 38 year old woman who is applying for a Kiva loan for her business. Her business is offering salon services to the residents in the area where she lives. Many people from her neighborhood and from others go directly to her business to get their hair cut, improve their image and buy beauty products such as creams, shampoos and other merchandise. Twelve years ago, because of the scarce employment opportunities in her town, Edith decided to start her own business and now the income help her and her young son. That is the reason she is turning to a Kiva loan to buy products for her hair salon and to sell articles to her customers at a reasonable price and within the time frame they need to buy it. Edith knows that having a business is a lot of work, because she works 12 hours a day. She has big goals of expanding her space and generating employment for other people. Edith dreams of sending her son to school so that he can have a high quality of life. She knows the cost of education is very high and that is why she works very hard to increase the family income and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy products for her hair salon and articles to sell to her customers at a reasonable price.

loans.name: Sando

texts.en:
Sando is 46 years old and lives in the Airport area. She is married and has five children between 11 and 25 years old. Two are in school and all live at home. Her husband is pastor.

For the past 15 years she has been selling powder, knives and clothes. She started this business by selling cold water.

She is requesting a loan to purchase powder, knives and clothes for her business. Her plans is to build a house for her children and send them to school.

loans.use: to purchase powder, knives and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bali

texts.en:
Bali, 60, is an Egyptian woman with eight children who was widowed long ago. Some of her children are married and have children; some are still dependent. They live all together and Bali enjoys having 12 grandchildren around. “Had I had money, I would spoil them all,” Bali said. “All I have been able to offer all these years was the basics. I couldn’t provide any extras, despite my hard work.”

The last 20 years, Bali has been selling used clothes and she finds this activity profitable. Thus far, she never requested any loans, because she managed her earnings very well. Now she wants to go to a new revenue stream and sell fabric in addition to what she’s been doing. With the earnings from the new activity, she plans to save money to educate her grandchildren.

Bali is aware that other people in her community have received financial help from Kiva lenders and she hopes she will receive the same.

loans.use: To buy fabric to resell.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 33 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and stopped her her education in second grade. She has four children between 14 and 18 years old that live with her and are in school.

For the past eleven years, she has been selling soft drinks in the community. She enjoys her business because she has lots of customers, and the profits she generates help her buy food for her family, She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth de 38 años de edad, es una mujer responsable quien vela por el bien de sus hijos, ella vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos por quienes ambos deben luchar día con día. Ana se dedica a la comercialización de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual vende por la calle de forma ambulante, modo el cual le ha permitido ser muy conocida en diferentes zonas, aumentando la cantidad de pedidos que posee. Ella solicita un préstamo, por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor variedad de colores, estampados y marcas de ropa para vender, con lo que Ana espera salir adelante y mejorar en gran manera la económica de su hogar lo cual es la prioridad de Ana y su esposo y por lo que  luchan tanto.
texts.en: Ana Ruth is 38 years old. She is a responsible woman who cares for her children's well being. She lives with her husband and four children, for whom they both fight every day. Ana sells clothing for men, women and children. She sells them as a street vendor and this has allowed her to become well known in different areas, increasing the orders she gets. She is asking for a loan to have the money she needs to buy a wider variety of colors, designs, and brands of clothing to sell. Ana hopes to get ahead and improve her household finances. This is Ana and her husband's priorty and the reaosn why they work so hard.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 32 years old, and lives in Airport. She is married. She stopped her education in the first grade. She has four children, who are in school and live at home.

For the past five years she has been selling fish in the local market. She started this business with credit from her mother. She likes her business because of the profits that she makes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Dhan Kumari

texts.en:
Dhan Kumari is 55 years old. She is married and has two children aged 35 and 27. In 2007, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used it to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Dhan Kumari plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has two children aged 19 and 25 who both attend school. 

For the past 5 years she has been operating a table where she sells fish. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to expand her business. In the future she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Durga

texts.en:
Durga is 49 years old. She is married and has two children aged 30 and 27. In 2000, she established her vegetable-farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loans to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Durga plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elio Roberto

texts.es: Elio de 26 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable quien se dedica por completo a dar lo mejor de sí y de esta forma sostener su hogar. Él vive únicamente junto a su esposa con quienes tienen mucho sueños y anhelos que desean cumplir. Elio posee un pequeño taller automotriz donde repara los motores de automóviles y así mismo brinda otros servicios relacionados. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en el taller, comprando mayor cantidad de repuestos, herramientas y otros más para tener bien equipado el negocio y brindar un mejor servicio, así mismo parte del dinero lo destinará para saldar una cuenta pendiente y de esta manera poder estar tranquilo. El desea salir adelante y así vivir mejor junto a su esposa.
texts.en: Elio is 26 years old. He is a hardworking and responsible young man who is totally dedicated to doing his best and in this way support his home. He just lives with his wife and they have a lot of dreams and goals that they want to achieve. Elio has a small workshop  where he repairs car engines and offers other related services. He is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to have the money he needs to invest in the workshop, buying a larger quantity of replacement parts, tools and other things so that he will be better equipped and able to offer a better service. The money will also be used to pay off a pending payment so he can be more at ease. He wants to get ahead a live in a better way with his wife.

loans.use: to buy automobile replacement parts.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children, ages 20 to 35, and all of them attend school. For the past 20 years, she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She started by getting some money from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil for her business. She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business

loans.name: Sayee

texts.en: Sayee is 25 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has a 4 year old child that is in school and lives at home. For the past 4 years, Sayee has been selling palm oil and used clothes in and around the market and surrounding communities, an activitiy she enjoys because it makes her self employed. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and use clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 28 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland for cultivating cassava. By doing so, she will earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating cassava.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 26 years old, single and lives in Buchanan. She stopped her education at grade 8. For the past 11 years, she has been selling underclothes in the market. She established the business with small loans from her father. She is requesting a loan to purchase more underclothes for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more underclothes for her business

loans.name: Nalle

texts.en:
Nalle is 32 years old and Lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have three children between the ages of 7 and 12 years old. All of the children live at home and attend school. 

For the past 2 years Nalle has been selling fish in the local market. She gets a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. In the future she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
The Tunas Mekar Asih group is made up of 11 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 16,500,000 IDR, and each member will receive 1,500,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in education in best practices for pig raising. This is their seven loan with MUK.

Ni Ketut, is the new head of the Tunas Mekar Asih group. She is married and has one child, aged nine who is in the third year in Elementary School. Her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Ketut would like to help support her family with her pig-raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after five months fattening them. Aside from being a pig breeder, she also has a small kiosk business. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Ron is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) is running a business selling firewood. He earns about $7 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s living condition, Ron is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more firewood to resell. By doing so, she will earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a truck to use for carrying the firewood to sell and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Marina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Marina became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Berawan Salak Permai Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek raises pigs in her back yard. She lives in the village of Berawantangi in west Bali. Her husband is a brick maker. With her business, Ni Kadek supplements her husband's income.
 
In order to expand her business, Ni Kadek wishes to raise capital by way of joining the group Berawan Salak Permai, where she was selected by the other members as the head of the group. The group works together with MUK to provide pig farmers with access to business loans.
 
With her portion of the loan of 1,5M IDR per person, Ni Kadek is planning to buy three piglets at the price of 500.000 IDR each. Although the price of feed is currently very expensive, Ni Kadek expects that the eventual sale of these pigs will bring her an advantage of over 500,000 IDR per month.

loans.use: to buy three piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 44 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have two children, ages 3 and 25. For the past fifteen years, Rebecca has been selling rice and red oil in the local market. Sometimes she buys at a very high price and she realizes a very low profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, by the bag, and red oil for her business. In the future she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rynalyn

texts.en: Rynalyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. Rynalyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rynalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rynalyn hopes to improve her business in order to provide an education for her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Rea provides motorela or motorcycle services as her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of the vehicle.

Rea has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rea hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Jayneveb

texts.en: Jayneveb is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. Jayneveb has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Jayneveb  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jayneveb hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Rosalie has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7 years. 

Rosalie has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rosalie  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. Romela has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 9 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Romela became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Romela hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kwt Sawe Permata Indah Group

texts.en:
Evaluating the last loan, the Sawe Permata Indah group decide to continue and borrow another loan. With the same size of loan, they will use the loan to expand their businesses.
