Still in the same business, Agung Ayu will use her loan to purchase crops to sell such as banana, cocoa, coconut, jackfruit, etc. Now she has a much wider area from which she can purchase crops from farmers. She hopes her dream to have a car will soon come true and she can purchase more crops.

loans.use: To purchase crops to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Emelia buys and sells products from BoardWalk. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more products from BoardWalk to resell like sandals and shoes.

Emelia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Emelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more products from BoardWalk to resell.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb, age 37, has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops for more than 10 years, earning approximately $2 daily. She lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a construction worker who has an income of about $5 each day. Two of her children are garment workers, earning about $6 per day.

Chreb is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and to help her youngest child earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
For over seven years, Elsa, a 49-year-old married mother of 6 children, has made a living in Taraka, Jimenez through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,000 a month for these activities.
Recently, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en:
The Sari Pertami Group received their loan with an increasing loan amount. They need more loans to develop their business. Now their loan is 21.5 million IDR, and each member received 1.7 million IDR or 1.5 million IDR. Since the last loan period, two of the members resigned because they moved to the city and the group also has five new members.

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase feed for her piglets. Now she has 10 piglets. According to her plan, she will be selling 2 next month. She’s very happy because her plan to be a piglet seller is like a dream come true. She hopes her business runs smoothly and brings welfare to her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her piglets

loans.name: Ranilo

texts.en: Ranilo is a married man and a father of two young children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has been a fisherman for more than two years now. Ranilo is asking a loan worth 5,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets. With this loan, he will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market. Ranilo dreams of making his business a success and saving for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Ardin

texts.en: Ardin, who is 24 years old, lives in Sumasap, Pana-on. He earns money through providing transportation services for two years so as to help his family. He gets an income of 3,000 PHP a month for this business. Without hesitation, Ardin borrows an amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to repair the transport vehicle used in his business. Ardin is new in GDMPC. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa, 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Donato, a driver. She, together with her husband, manages their  household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Ma. Theresa operates a poultry business. She has ducks and chickens that she sells. She also has a direct selling business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy stocks of feeds and additional chickens and ducks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Theresa hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and poultry needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en:
Lilita is from Poblacion, Sinacaban. She is 62 years old. Lilita is separated and has three children. To make a living, Lilita is planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Lilita has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Lilita joined GDMPC. Lilita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 47 years old and married with four children.

Bernadeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, sugar and other groceries.

Bernadeth has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Bernadeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Yorn is 58 years old. She is widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her children are employed. They earn about $15 each day. In order to improve her family’s living condition, Yorn is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
This is Ma. Heidi, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a driver, and is the mother to their children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Heidi has an apartment that she offers for rental. It is rented on a monthly basis.  She earns a minimum of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales monthly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. She expects a boost in her business income as he expands his business. 

Ma. Heidi hopes to be able to have her renovation soon and dreams to give her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Jenelyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000  to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Jenelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Roki

texts.en:
Roki is a 29 year old single man. He lives with his mother, Rahel, a 52 year old widow. After resigning from his job, Roki took over his mother's business which was a kiosk. This kiosk was inherited from his father. Roki is glad because the business enables him to meet his family needs as well as his personal needs, although sometimes he experiences deficiency. 

Roki wants to increase his income by adding more stock to meet the demands of his customers. He had very limited capital and came to TLM to ask for help. Roki requested a loan from TLM of around IDR 3,000,000 to purchase extra stock for his kiosk, i.e. instant noodles, cigarettes, snacks, candy, etc. Roki is hoping that his dream will come true through the loan from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase extra stock for his kiosk like instant noodles, cigarettes, snacks and candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben is 52 years old, married and resides in Taraka, Jimenez. Ruben plants and harvests rice to sell in the local community to earn a living and has been in this business five years. Each month, he earns 7,000 PHP from his business. He has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for his next crop. Recently, Ruben joined GDMPC. In the future, Ruben wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Naily

texts.en:
Naily, of San Isidro Alto, Sinacaban, helps her family through a business manufacturing lumber. She’s a 27-year-old single woman, who tries her best to earn on her own. For two years, she has managed this business and earns about PHP 4,500 per month. 

For the time being, she needs to purchase raw materials to manufacture lumber. She joined GDMPC this year, and thanks GDMPC micro finance for the loan of PHP 5,000 they have provided to her. 

Naily desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture lumber.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor, 53, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Nenita, his business partner, and mother to his children. He and his wife manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nestor is a fish vendor. He buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. He buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. His store is located in a temporary fish market.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help him continue business operations, he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy more fish to sell every day. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Nestor dreams to be able to give all his children a high-quality education and wants his family to have a good life through all his hard work in his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and it's where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn is 56 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband runs a repair shop. He earns about $2 each day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokhorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she would earn more profit. In the future, she would like to run a cosmetics shop for her daughter and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda  is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Imelda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 40 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working as construction workers for more than two years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $9 each day. 

Pov is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business in order to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Paul Angelo

texts.en:
This is Paul Angelo, 25, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rendyl, a housewife. He is a father to his child. Paul, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Paul Angelo maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one Tricycle (motor cycle with a sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning and continues until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community members. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan amount of PHP 17, 000. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his vehicle in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Paul Angelo hopes to buy another tricycle unit and hopes to support his child's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en: Cerela is married and has 6 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Cerela runs a general store to earn a living. She has been doing this for 21 years. She earns 6,000 PHP a month from the business. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Cerela been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Cerela hopes to expand her store in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn, age 29, runs a sari-sari (general store) business. She buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has operated her business for four years. 

She and her husband have three children.

Ronalyn has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. Ronalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. 

In the future, Ronalyn hopes to improve her business for the purpose of ensuring an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
This is Benedicta, 56, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Juanito, her business partner, and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Benedicta operates a vegetable growing farm. She grows vegetables and fruits on their farm located in Cavite. It is in the highlands where it is suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies as well as to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Benedicta dreams to be able to give her whole family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Bensie

texts.en: Bensie, 36, and married, is from Rizal, Jimenez. Bensie runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Bensie has been in business for six years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. Bensie is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This year, Bensie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Srey Noch

texts.en:
Srey Noch is 28 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breakfasts (noodle and rice) for more than ten years, earning approximately $20 per day. Her husband is a teacher who earns about $3 daily. 

Srey Noch is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase construction materials to build a store. This money will help her get a good place for her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a store.

loans.name: Rainer

texts.en:
Rainer is married with two children. He is 37 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Rainer owns and manages a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month he earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. Rainer been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Rainer hope to expand his sari-sari store to sustain his family's daily needs and for the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is from Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a general store. She's been engaged in her business for 22 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Grace joined GDMPC. Grace is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles, 35, is a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She has four children who work already. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Angeles operates a piggery and sells live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes, they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. She also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of  PHP 1200 in sales every week.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Angeles hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to give her children a high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feed and more hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou is 59 years old, widowed and resides with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been producing stoves to sell for more than 10 years, earning approximately $11 per day. In order to improve her business, Sou is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase clay and metal to produce more stoves to sell. This money will help her expand her business and earn more profit. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger shop and provide better product for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase clay and metal to produce more stoves to sell.

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia, age 35, is a responsible and hard-working homemaker in Punjab, Pakistan, where she lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Her son is 10 years old and in the fifth grade, and her daughter is three years old.

Since 2007, her husband has been running a vegetable shop, which is the only source of income for their family. In order to further grow his business, he is interested in purchasing a variety of vegetables for his shop. Toward this end, as a member of an eight-person lending group, Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Brac Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, her husband can offer a greater variety of fresh vegetables to his customers and can increase his monthly income as well as his savings. 

With the profit amount, Sobia wants to renovate the house and add to the family's savings for the future. She also wants to purchase a new tailoring machine for personal use. She dreams of a bright future for her children and prays for her husband's good health. 

She wants to say that Brac is doing good things in the field of microfinance, and she is very thankful to Brac and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables for her husband's vegetable shop

loans.name: Yulieth Patricia

texts.es: Yulieth tiene 27 años y vive con su esposo, un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 5 años en el municipio de Soledad, municipio en la costa caribeña de Colombia. Ella tiene un negocio mediante el cual  vendiendo perfumes y mercancías por catalogo a vecinos y amigos en su barrio, caminando casa a casa, logra generar ingresos que benefician el sustento de su hogar. Hace 5 anos que empezó este negocio como su forma de empleo, pues con tan pocas oportunidades laborales en la ciudad, decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios. Inicialmente vendió productos mediante una sola revista o guía especializada y posteriormente en sus últimos 5 años, siguió aumentando su oferta de productos y ahora vende ropa interior, blusas, perfumes y calzados. Yulieth esta aplicando a un credikiva, para comprar mas de estos productos y vender a sus clientes; estos productos en la actualidad vinieron con muy buenos descuentos y el objetivo es aprovechar estas ofertas para ganar nuevos clientes y aumentar sus ingresos y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión credikiva. Pues con dos hijos pequeños, Julieth quiere mucho, mejorar la vida de su familia, por eso una de sus metas es ahorrar los ingresos de su negocio para comprar un vehículo familiar y facilitar su tarea de distribución así como compartir mucho mas en familia..
texts.en:
Yulieth is 27 years old and lives with her husband, her 3-year-old son and 5-year-old daughter in the town of Soledad, a town on the Caribbean coast of Colombia. She has a business whereby she sells perfume and merchandise by catalogue to neighbours and friends in her neighbourhood, going door to door managing to generate income that benefits the livelihood of her home. Five years ago she started this business as a form of employment, with so few job opportunities in the city, she decided to start her own business venture. Initially she sold merchandise through only one magazine or specialized guide and in the last 5 years, continued to increase her product offerings and now sells undergarments, blouses, perfume and footwear. 

Yulieth is applying for a Kiva loan to buy more of these products, to sell to her customers. These products are currently at very good discounts and the objective is to take advantage of these offers to gain new customers and increase her revenue and this is precisely the success of her Kiva loan investment. With two small children, Yulieth wants very much to improve the lives of family therefore, one of her goals is to save revenue of her business to buy a family car and to make her distribution job easier as well as to share more in her family.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, blouses, perfume and footwear.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon is 59 years old, widowed and resides with her daughter and grandchild in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling mixed cakes in school for more than five years, earning approximately $8 daily. Her daughter is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 each day. Yon is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her grandchild to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo is 30 years old, married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $7 daily. Due to lack of funds, Sambo is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide convenient living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, age 33, is a tailor. She has been running her tailoring shop for more than two years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $4 daily. The family lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  

In order to increase her income, Chantha is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase more cloth, which will allow her to sew more clothes to offer for sale. This money will help her stabilize her family’s livelihood. 

In the future, she would like to expand her shop to provide better services for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, allowing her to sew more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 49 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making creels to sell for more than five years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $5 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $8 per day. 

Yon is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase timbers to build a new house. By doing so, she would have a comfortable house for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build a new house

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is 56 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge for more than four years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $3 each day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $7 daily. 

Savy is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice. This money will help her expand her farming business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she wants to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun, age 51, is a charcoal vendor. She has operated this business for more than 10 years, earning about $17 per day. She resides with her husband and their two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $3 daily. One of their children is a bamboo train driver who earns about $2 per day. 

Sarun is requesting a loan of $750 to pay for her child’s passport fee. By doing so, her child will be able to work legally in Thailand. 

In the future, Sarun would like to expand her business and renovate her house in order to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to pay for her child's passport fee

loans.name: Eufenia

texts.en:
Eufenia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. Eufenia has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Eufenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Eufenia hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en: Annalyn is 30 years old. She lives in Sapang Dalaga together with her live-in partner. Annalyn makes and sells nipa huts (nipa is a large palm) to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. She earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC to obtain nipa palm to make roofing materials. Annalyn joined GDMPC this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to obtain nipa palm to make roofing materials

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is 33 years old, is married, and lives with her life partner and their two children in the Msambweni region of Coast Province. Asha is involved in the sale of fried fish, selling to one of the busy markets in the urban area. She has been engaged in this work for several years and has a good clientele. Asha is happy because she feels like a responsible person now that she helps her husband with the daily household expenses. She needs to grow her business since her husband is unable to fully support her. After being introduced to Yehu by a friend, she decided to ask for a loan in the amount of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more fish to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Ms. Irshad, age 45, runs a retail shop on a small corner outside her house. She has operated her business for the last four years and it has helped her to bring in a reliable source of income for the family, pay utility bills, and save enough so her children can go to school. She and her husband have three children. 

Irshad is a good business woman and is doing well for her family. She recently borrowed Rs 25,000 and used it to buy rice, beverages, and a digital weighing machine for her retail store. She is hopeful that she will earn more profits through the increase in sales. She has taken out several loans and her repayment behavior is good.

Irshad dreams of sending her children to school so eventually they can provide for their families in a much better way. She says that with Kashf’s help and her own hard work she will eventually make this possible.

loans.use: To buy rice, beverages and digital weigh machine for her retail store.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Ra is 38 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs a business purchasing cattle to resell. He earns about $30 daily. One of her children is a clay pot vendor who earns about $4 each day. Ra is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a trailer for her child to carry the clay pots to sell. This purchase will help her expand her target market and earn more income for the family. In the future, Ra hopes to build a new house and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her child, a clay pot vendor, to carry the clay pots to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is married with three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. Merlinda owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting jack fruit to earn a living. She has been in this business for 6 years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Merlinda been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Merlinda's plan is to save her profits in order to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 36 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a driver who earns about $5 each day. Pov is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timbers to cover her house’s wall. In addition, a part of this money will be used to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to cover her house's wall, and a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Christianus

texts.en:
Christianus is 19 years old, and he is currently studying at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, in the program of Management, Commerce and harbor administration. Christianus comes from the islands, precisely from the village of Duroa, in the Maluku islands. The state of nature and the geographical islands motivates Christianus to work at a port or shipping company. Christianus's parents are long dead, and he is now living with his brother. School fees for this, are the responsibility by his brothers. 

With the condition of his family, Christianus with spirit is determined to complete his studies, so that he can quickly work as a professional employee in harbor administration. A loan from Kiva can cover all the costs of college, so he can focus more on learning. Christianus says a big thank you to Kiva lenders who decide to help him in his studies.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 45-year-old woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and three daughters. Her husband is an auto electrician and one son is doing a job while the rest of the children are studying in school.

She herself has had been running a garment shop since 2000, which is going successfully. She wants to extend her business more and for that she is looking to buy some more fabrics from different cities. Shehnaz is a member of an eight-person lending group. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase fabric and some furniture like chairs and tables for the garment shop.

She dreams for her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health. She wants to say that BRAC is working very well in the field of micro finance, and she is very thankful to BRAC and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and furniture for her garment shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another loan to expand her existing business. With the previous loan, which enabled her to buy fish in large quantity, she was able to increase her sales. However, demand for fish has increased, and she does not have enough capital to meet the demand, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more fish and a frying pan. Fatuma aims to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more fish and a frying pan

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of five children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (her aunt’s children). She operates a beauty salon. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 25 years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more weaves, braids and a hand dryer. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a stand alone hair dryer and chairs so as to serve her customers better. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more weaves, braids and a hair dryer

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, age 50, is a maize and charcoal trader in Narok. He has been running this business for the past six years, making a monthly income of KES 35,000. He and his wife are blessed with three children. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd, which he intends to use to purchase more maize to offer for sale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. 

His future dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Saven

texts.en: Saven is 27 years old. She is married with three children and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling charcoal for more than five years, earning approximately $17 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $13 each day. Saven is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase timber to fix parts of her house. Doing so will make her house more comfortable for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to fix parts of her house

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is from Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is 54 years old. Josephine is married and has one child. To make a living, she makes and sells snack food. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. This year, she joined GDMPC. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, 40, is a married mother who lives in the town of Msambweni, Coast Province. She earns a living in food vending, selling at the market and through door to door.

Mwanaisha is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to stock up her business with wheat flour, rice, beans, and add utensils. With this investment, she can increase her sales and income. Mwanaisha's goal is to always have the resources for the daily support of her family, so that they can have good opportunities.

loans.use: to stock up her business with wheat flour, rice, beans, and add utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and care for pigs.

loans.name: Mary Chriz

texts.en: Mary Chriz is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last seven years by selling home and used products. She makes PHP 4,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She joined GDMPC last year as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee for her store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Delia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Delia has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income through food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and married with 4 children. With 3 of the children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her farm

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula de 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos nietos quienes son total responsabilidad de ella. Paula es muy trabajadora y desea darles lo mejor a sus nietos así mismo darles estudios para que puedan contar con un futuro mejor. Ella posee una pupusería la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación, ella se encarga de elaborarlas ya sea de queso, de frijol con queso o revueltas, y así mismo las comercializa en su casa, este es un negocio bastante estable en el cual Paula quiere crecer aún más por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder contar con el capital necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: verduras, queso, granos básicos, bebidas para vender y otros más de forma que sus ventas aumenten, lo que es lo principal para Paula porque así podrá vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: Paula, 62, lives together with her husband and two grandchildren, whom she is responsible for. Paula is very hardworking and she wants to give her grandchildren the best as well as give them an education so that they can have a better future. She has a pupusa business, which is located in her home. She is in charge of making them, whether it's with cheese, beans with cheese or asparagus and egg. She sells them in her home. It is a stable business in which Paula wants to grow. This is why she is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL, to have the money necessary to buy more ingredients like: vegetables, cheese, dry grains and beans, drinks to sell, and other things so that her sales will increase. That is the most important thing for her, because that way she can live better together with her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pupusas (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, or other fillings)

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 44. She is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Julian and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nenita oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community members. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (Php) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also to pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams to be able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children and grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms. Nazia is a 35-year-old married woman. Two years ago, she started her own business of jewelry sales when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys jewelry of different designs from market at lower rates and sells them to her community. She counts a good client list; most her clients are her neighbors.
  
She is the mother of 3 children. All of them go to school. She wishes to send other children to school but is unable to cover the expenses. She has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She is going to use this loan to buy a sample of jewelry from market at lower rates. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s educations. She purchases the jewelry parts from the shalmi market at lower rates and sells it in these markets at the maximum price that is suitable to both of them.

loans.use: to buy a sample of jewellery from market at lower rates

loans.name: Gimema

texts.en:
Gimema is 49 years old and married with seven children.

Gimema works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shoes, bags, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Gimema has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for four years and also earns an income by selling frozen foods.

Gimema aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes, bags, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Gemma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, soap, sugar, and other groceries.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, soap, sugar, and other groceries for her store

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a salt retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Jelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Jelyn would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of salt to sell

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Ms. Raheela is a 48-year-old married woman. Five years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys cloth of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells to her community. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors.
  
She is the mother of eight children. Seven of them are going to school. She wishes to send her other child to school but is unable to cover the expenses. Raheela has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000. She is going to use this loan to buy a sample variety of clothes in larger quantity to add to her current ones. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education. She also teaches people trailing and gets machines to increase her business from the use of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a sample variety of clothes in larger quantity to add to her current ones

loans.name: Aguilas Group

texts.es:
Águilas son un grupo solidario conformado por 6 mujeres emprendedoras que estaban decididas a salir adelante junto con sus familias; se llamas águilas porque sus sueños llegan a ser tan altos como el vuelo de las mismas. Petra es una de las integrantes del grupo, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 hombres de 25 y 21 años, los cuales trabajan para contribuir en los gastos del hogar y una niña que cursa el 4to grado de primaria. La señora Petra se dedica a la venta de tacos, gorditas y comida sana para los niños, tiene su puesto enfrente de una escuela. Con el crédito comprara todo lo necesario para preparar los tacos y las gorditas, surtirá su tanque de gas, etc..

Una meta muy importante para Petra es establecer su negocio formalmente y poder abrir todo el día, ya que normalmente abría en las mañana.
texts.en:
Águilas is a group made up of six enterprising women, dedicated to getting ahead with their families.  They are called “Águilas” (Eagles) because their dreams are to become as high as the flight of Eagles.  Petra is one of the group’s members.  She’s married, and has three children, two sons ages 25 and 21 who work to help with the household expenses, and one daughter in fourth grade.  Petra sells tacos, gorditas, and healthy food for children.  She has her stand set up across from the school.  She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients to make her tacos and gorditas, refill her cooking gas, etc.
 
One of Petra’s important goals is to set up a formal business and be able to open it all day; normally she is only open in the mornings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and cooking fuel

loans.name: Tima

texts.en: Tima is 38 years old, is an entrepreneur and is dedicated to her home. She lives together with her husband and seven children. Tima works making and selling dumplings. She makes the dumplings in her home, selling a small quantity right from her home and selling the rest in different neighborhoods. With the goal of increasing her sales and improving her earnings, Tima is asking for a loan in order to buy a larger amount of ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil and flavorings, as well as firewood for cooking. Tima is a very positive person who fights for the hope of being able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of ingredients to make and sell dumplings

loans.name: Merpati S

texts.en:
Merpati is a 41-year-old widow. She is blessed with five children: Inkun, 19, a college student; Christianus, 18, graduated from senior high school; Christantri, 12, is attending the first grade of junior high school; Christologos, 9, is attending the fifth class of elementary school; and Christian, 5, is not attending school yet. 

Merpati runs a second-hand clothing business. She has been operating the business since 2009. Merpati rents a small stall at a local market to display her products. The business begins at 8 am and ends at 4 pm each day. Merpati wants to expand the business. She sees opportunity to generate more income by opening a kiosk. To do so, she is requesting loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. She would like to use the loan to buy items like biscuits, soft drinks, snacks, coffee, sugar, cigarettes and shampoo, as well as two sacks of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, soft drinks, snacks, coffee, sugar, cigarettes and shampoo, as well as two sacks of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en: Mwanaulu continues selling local liquor in her neighborhood. It is a business it has allowed her to increase her income. Mwanaulu says that her aim is to improve her living standards. She is requesting a new loan so as to invest in her existing business. This is a second loan she is requesting both from Yehu and Kiva. This loan will enable her to purchase tables and seats so that her customers can have a more comfortable place to enjoy themselves. Her goal is to have a a bigger store to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: to purchase tables and seats for her palm wine-selling business

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a married woman with one child. She is 36 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. 

Mely owns and operates a plot of farmland and plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Mely joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, last year. Mely's plan is to save her returns in order to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, reside en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira.
Ella inicio su negocio de venta de comida y golosinas hace 8 años, con el fin de adquirir recursos económicos para la subsistencia.
Doña María elabora tamales, ticucos (alimento típico de maíz, condimentos y carne) y pan para la venta ambulante, además en su vivienda vende golosinas, abarrotes, dulces y condimentos.
Con el propósito de surtir su negocio y comprar materia prima (harina de maíz y carne), ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 8,000 Lempiras.
Sus planes a futuro es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias crecer económicamente para apoyar a su hija con quien convive actualmente.
texts.en:
Maria, 58, is a single mother of 2.  She lives in a rural community in the municipality of Gracias, which is in the department of Lempira.

Maria started her business selling food and snacks 8 years ago, with the goal of making a living through the business.

Maria makes tamales, ticucos (a traditional dish made from corn, condiments and meat), and bread to sell.  She sells her dishes from place to place, and she also sells snacks, groceries, sweets and condiments from her home.

In order to stock up her business and buy supplies (corn flour and meat), she has requested a loan of 8,000 Honduran lempiras.  

In the future, Maria plans to increase her sales and earnings so that she can support the daughter who is currently living with her.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food to sell (corn flour and meat), and to buy snacks

loans.name: Ernesto Porfirio

texts.es: Ernesto de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar y por quienes Ernesto trabaja muy duro. Él posee una venta de gorras, gelatinas para el cabello, champo, cremas, talcos, galletas y otros productos más. Ernesto posee varios clientes fijos debido a que su puesto está ubicado en el centro del lugar que reside, un lugar muy concurrido y de mucho comercio, lo que beneficia a Ernesto. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor variedad de gorras, y así mismo comprar más productos para ofrecer a las personas. Con esto Ernesto podrá aumentar en gran manera sus ventas ya que ofrecerá más productos, lo cual serpa de mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: Ernesto is 50 years old, he lives with his wife and three children who all study and for whom Ernesto works very hard. He runs a business that sells hats, hair gel, shampoo, creams, talc, cookies and other products. Ernesto has various loyal customers thanks to his location that is right in the center of the place where he lives, a place very much frequented and with a lot of business, which is good for Ernesto. He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase a variety of hats and also to purchase more products to offer to people. With this, Ernesto will be able to increase his sales in a big way since he will be offering more products, which will benefit his family as well.

loans.use: purchase hats and hair products to re-sell.

loans.name: Paulinus

texts.en:
Paulinus is a 36-year-old man and is married to Ince, a 26-year-old lady. They have been blessed with a son, Patris, who is 5 years old and is attending
kindergarten. 

Paulinus owns a public minivan business. The business enables him to fulfill his family's needs as well as his child's schooling needs. Last month, his
van broke. Some of the parts of the van needed replacement. He did not have enough money to buy them so he came to TLM for help. He is requesting a 
Rp. 10,000,000 loan, which he would spend on purchasing a carburetor, tubes, machine oils, etc. for his van.

loans.use: to purchase a carburetor, tubes, machine oils, etc. for his minivan business

loans.name: Negociantes Group

texts.es: Son un grupo muy trabajador y puntual, llevan con la empresa 4 ciclos y tienen sus juntas en el municipio de Monterrey. La señora Noemí es una mujer muy activa tiene 54 años de edad, es casada (su esposo era trailero, pero esta pensionado) y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 29 años, es casado y es jefe de turno en una famosa empresa de telecomunicaciones. Y el menor próximamente se casara y trabaja como operador de tráileres. Noemí se dedica a la venta de repostería, tiene con su negocio 15 años, comenzó la venta, ya que dejo de trabajar como enfermera y como su esposo la dejaba sola en su casa debido a su empleo, a ella no le gustaba estar sin hacer nada. Ella tiene mucha venta los días festivos y el crédito la ayudara comprando mas materia prima como moldes, harina, azúcar, 2 fuentes chocolateras para poder rentarlas. En un futuro Noemí desea tener su propia panadería, ya que tiene muchos clientes y una gran fama como buena repostera. Negociantes nos mencionan que les gusta ser un grupo pequeño, ya que piensan que si fueran mas personas batallarían para poder juntarse y para dar los pagos, ellas prefieren ser un grupo pequeño y con integrantes que se conozcan muy bien.
texts.en: They are a very hard working and punctual group and have four cycles with their business and meet in the municipal of Monterrey. Mrs. Noemí  is a very active woman who is 54 years old, is married (her husband was a truck driver, but now he is retired) and has two children, one is 29 years old, married and the boss of a famous telecommunications business. And the youngest is soon to be married and works as a truck operator. Noemí has a baking business, which she has been running for 15 years, she started selling her products and she quit her job as a nurse and because her husband left her alone at home a lot because of his job, she didn't like to be there with nothing to do. She sells a lot on festival days and the loan will help her purchase more primary materials like molds, flour, sugar and two chocolate fountains so she can rent the latter. In the future, Noemí  would like to have her own bakery since she has a lot of customers and a good reputation as a baker. The group mentions they like to remain small since they think that more people would add strife in their bid to join and in order to pay back the loan, they like to remain a small group and with members they know well.

loans.use: purchase more primary materials like molds, flour, sugar and two chocolate fountains.

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.ru:
Шарифчон предоставляет услугу. Он уже 7 лет как открыл мужскую парикмахерскую. Шарифчон хороший специалист. Ему 33 года. Он проживает в районе Хамадони. Шарифчон живет с женой. У него трое детей. 
Шарифчон берет кредит для покупки стройматериалов. Он хочет построить новое собственное помещение (парикмахерскую), чтобы продолжить и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Sharifjon works in the service sector. Seven years ago, he opened a barber shop. Sharifjon is a skilled specialist. He is 33 years old and lives in the Hamadoni region. He is married and has 3 children. 

Sharifon is seeking a loan in order to buy construction materials. He wants to build a new building (barbershop) of his own so that he can continue his business and expand it.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него двое детей. Фирдавс предоставляет услугу, он работает таксистом. В этой области он работает два года. Фирдавс просит кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en: Firdavs lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children. Firdavs works in the service sector. He drives a taxi, and has been working in this field for two years. Firdavs is seeking a loan in order to repair his vehicle. He needs your support.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 58 years old and married with four children. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, and other groceries. 

In the future Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a 33-year old, married woman with 2 children living in Bunawan, Calamba. In order to add income to the family, she entered into a buying-and-selling of clothing business, which started 5 years ago. She usually gets PHP 8,000 per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Rosalie will be able to buy more clothes to sell because of the money amounting PHP 10,000 rendered to her. She joined GDMPC this year. She hopes for much greater revenue someday for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Odalma Lisseth

texts.es:
Odalma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en la compra de repuestos, por ejemplo necesita comprarse luces, bujillas, dos llantas, entre otros repuestos que son necesarios para mantener en orden y en adecuado uso el vehículo.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar las condiciones del vehículo, espera que esto ayude a aumentar la vida útil del vehículo ya que su familia goza de viajar con ella y tambien le sirve hacia su empleo ya que aun permanece trabajando en la Alcaldia.
texts.en:
Odalma is asking for a new loan so that she can continue investing in repair parts, such as lights, spark plugs, two tires, among other things she needs to maintain her vehicle.

She was able to use the previous loan to improve the conditions of her vehicle and hopes to use this one to increase her vehicle’s useful life, since her family likes travelling with her.  It also helps her with her work with the city call.

loans.use: to buy repair parts.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo desea realizar el mejoramiento a su vivienda cambiando el cableado eléctrico ya que esta en muy malas condiciones y puede ocasionar un accidente.
El señor Guillermo se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la elaboración y venta de carbón y su esposa la señora Leticia lo apoya realizando trabajos de costuras. Ellos son originarios del estado de San Luis Potosí, tiene ya más de veinte años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio será para pagar el préstamo, ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos que están estudiando la primaria.
texts.en:
Guillermo wants to do renovations to his house by changing the electrical wires that are in really bad condition and could cause an accident. 
For more than two years Guillermo has made and sold charcoal and his wife Leticia supports him doing sewing work.  They are originally from the state of San Luis Potosi and have lived in the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than 20 years.
He requests a loan to buy materials and pay the person that is going to do the renovations.  With the profits he makes he will repay the loan, his wife will take care of the family expenses and the education expenses of their children that are in elementary school.

loans.use: to change the electrical wiring of his house.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 39 años y trabaja en el sector de comercio, ella vende cosméticas, ropa, perfumes, platería y variedades,  directamente a sus clientes, que la conocen después de 4 años de experiencia con este negocio. Marina  está aplicando a un primer  crédiKiva para comprar en mayor volumen, cosméticos, perfumes, ropa interior y exterior, platería, desodorantes, lociones y muchas más mercancías. Este crédito es muy necesitado por Marina, porque uno de sus desafíos mayores en su productividad  es la ausencia de capital. Con este crédito, podrá tener mejor liquidez en su negocio, y así mismo ofrecer una mejor variedad   a sus clientes, aumentado las utilidades de su negocio y por consiguiente  sus ingresos. Marina vende directamente al consumidor final mediante créditos que su clientela paga en plazos cortos de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago, mientras sus compras las realiza de contado a grandes distribuidores que utilizan el sistema multinivel y guías especializadas a través de  las cuales Marina ofrece  sus productos a su clientela. Maria había recibido anteriormente un crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual logró mejorar su liquidez  e incrementar un poco sus utilidades, por eso su nuevo credikiva se proyecta con un potencial exitoso.
texts.en: Marina is 39 years old and works in sales.  She sells cosmetics, clothes, perfume, silverware, and other items directly to her customers, who are familiar with Marina after 4 years of experience with this business.  Marina is applying for her first Kiva loan to buy cosmetics, perfumes, clothes and underwear, silverware, deodorant, lotions and many more products in greater quantity.  This loan is much needed for Marina because one of her greatest challenges in productivity is lack of capital.  With this loan, she she’ll have greater liquidity in her business and be able to offer her customers a better variety, thus increasing profits and by consequence, income.  Marina sells directly to her customers through credit that her customers pay in small amounts according to their ability to pay, while she makes her purchases in cash from big distributors who use the multilevel system and specialized guides through which Marina offers her products to her customers.  Marina has previously received a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she was able to improve liquidity and increase profits a little, so she expects this new loan to be successful too.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, perfume, clothes and underwear, silverware, deodorants, lotions and many more products in greater quantity.

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William, está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en su venta de pan, comprándose diariamente cierta cantidad a las panaderías de variedad de pan, con la intensión de tener surtido el negocio para los clientes.

El considera que estos prestamos le han permitido empezar el negocio con la venta de pan, y esta elaborandolo tambien para ganar clientes, poco a poco ira aumentando la producción para evitar comprarlo ya elaborado, en su familia comenta que todo a marchado bien.
texts.en:
William is asking for a loan to be able to invest in his bread business, buying a certain quantity and variety from bakeries so that he has a greater variety to offer his customers.

He considers these loans to have allowed him to start the business selling bread.  He is also baking it so that he can win new customers, and is increasing production little by little so that he doesn’t have to buy it.  He says that everything has gone well for his family.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Heri

texts.en: Heri is 49 years old and married to Ernia, 59. He has a 25-year-old son who was graduated from Senior High school.  Heri operates a welding shop. The income generated from the business helps him meet his family needs. Heri wants to improve this business by adding more products and therefore he has requested a loan IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. Heri plans to spend the loan on putty, car paint, and sandpaper.

loans.use: to spend the loan on putty, car paint, and sandpaper.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 37 years old and married with three children.

Karen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, soft-drinks, seasonings and other groceries.

Karen has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Karen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft-drinks, seasonings amd other groceries.

loans.name: Melenia

texts.en:
Melenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has selling of used clothing business in the Philippines.

Melenia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothes, bags and other relief goods.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Melenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes, bags and other relief goods.

loans.name: Visa Joy

texts.en: Visa Joy is 31 years old, married and the mother of 1 child. She lives in Swp, Calamba, where she has earned a living for the last 5 years by selling general merchandise/accessories. She makes PHP 15,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 to obtain more accessories to sell. Recently, Visa Joy joined GDMPC as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to obtain more accessories to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 35 years old and single.

Milagros is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Milagros has been farming rice for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is 38 years old and lives with her vast family, which is made up of her eight children and her husband who also works. Mwanakombo has a fruit and vegetable stand in her home, in which she sells products like tomatoes, kales, potatoes, etc. She has many customers because she sells the fruits and vegetables at very good prices. It is for this reason that Mwanakombo requests a loan, with which she will be able to buy a bigger quantity of fruits and vegetables, since she wants to buy more in order to buy at lower prices and sell at even cheaper prices. This is of much importance for her since it allows her to receive better profits which benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is 38 years old a business man, he is married to Saran a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been running a green grocer business for the past one year with the monthly income of KES. 3,200 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET LTD staff member. Sylvester will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid, tiene 33 años de edad y trabaja en la ciudad de Barranquilla vendiendo mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos a sus clientes. Ella compra ropa interior y exterior y va a sus vecinos y gente en su barrio directamente, para ofrecerlos y entre ellos distribuirlos mediante créditos pagados a plazos ajustados a sus posibilidades; Ella permanece trabajando todos los días por 10 horas, pues en condiciones de mujer separada de su esposo y con 2 hijos en las edades de 16 y 10 años, es  cabeza de su familia, y  tiene a su cargo la responsabilidad de su  hogar. Hace solamente 1 año empezó este negocio, por la necesidad de estar más cerca  a sus hijos, mientras generaba ingresos. En la actualidad Edith está solicitando un credikiva para poder comprar mas productos del catalogo de su oferta, para poder vender mas y así aumentar sus ingresos. Sus sueños son muy sencillos: generar crecimiento a su negocio para ganar más ingresos. Lo cual  servirá para alimentar el bienestar a su familia, cuidar sus hijos, e incrementar sus ahorros. Algún día Ingrid, como tanta gente en el mundo, quiere tener la oportunidad de comprar una casa propia. Aunque se encuentra con muchos desafíos en su vida, como el estar sola y tener la responsabilidad de sostenimiento de la casa y sus hijos, Ingrid sigue trabajando y ahorrando, y con la ayuda de Kiva esta mejorando la calidad de su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ingrid is 33 years old and works in the city of Barranquilla, selling merchandise through specialized catalogs or her client's catalogs. She purchases underwear and other clothing and goes to her neighbors directly to sell them merchandise and between them distribute paid credits in installments that can be adjusted to different situations. She works every day for 10 hours because she is separated from her husband and has two children who are 16 and 10 years old, making her the head of her household and so she has to be responsible for her home. It was only a year ago she started this business because she needed to be closer to her children but also earn an income. Today, Ingrid is asking for a loan in order to purchase more catalog products that she offers in order to sell more and increase her earnings. Her dreams are very simple: generate enough growth in her business in order to earn more. This will allow her to take care of the well being of her family, take care of her children and save more money. One day, Ingrid, like so many people in the world, wants to have an opportunity to buy her own house. Even though she finds herself facing many challenges in life, like being alone and having the responsibility of taking care of her house and children, Ingrid also continues working and saving and with the help of Kiva she is improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: purchase more catalog products that she offers.
